fields.title: Fading Fast
fields.description: Artist Gary J. Noland Jr. exhibits an eye-catching abstract as an expression of feeling. The dynamic red paintwork drives the viewer''s attention to the center and encourages an exploration of the cerulean background. Gary furthers his investigation into the properties of paint and how color, line, texture, and composition can create figure-ground relationships. He captures a specific mood for the viewer to interpret based on their understanding.

fields.title: Indigo Landscape 2
fields.description: Artist Janet Hamilton depicts an intricately textured abstract painting with rich gradations of color. She paints vivid indigo rays elegantly rising to meet pristine white. Structured frequencies of blue hues delicately flow throughout the canvas. Janet applies paint with a palette knife, creating a channeled surface.

fields.title: Indigo Stripes 3
fields.description: Artist Janet Hamilton depicts an intricately textured abstract painting with rich gradations of color. She paints vivid indigo rays, elegantly meeting pristine white, creating bands of soothing hues. Structured frequencies of blue hues delicately flow throughout the canvas. Janet applies paint with a palette knife, developing a channeled surface.

fields.title: Fragmentation II - Rings
fields.description: Part of artist Marie-Eve Champagne''s Fragmentation series—playing with notions of deconstruction and movement. "Can something broken remain whole?" queries Eve-Marie. Lines connect, disconnect, and reconnect with intertwining strokes in a dynamic rhythm of hues. Earthy tones of ochres, greens, and blacks mingle in flowing, elegant patterns. Fragments of color appear almost floating on the surface, moved by an unknown current, ready to be reconstructed or deconstructed anew. Yet, in the end, the gist is one of quiet unity.

fields.title: Fragmentation II - Pieces
fields.description: "Can something broken remain whole?" probes artist Marie-Eve Champagne. Lines connect, disconnect, and reconnect with intertwining strokes in a dynamic rhythm of earthy tones in ochres, greens, and black. Fragments of color appear almost floating on the surface, moved by an unknown current, ready to be reconstructed or deconstructed anew. Yet, in the end, the gist is one of quiet unity. Part of Marie-Eve''s Fragmentation series, where she plays with notions of deconstruction and movement.

fields.title: Joy of Life
fields.description: "There''s something about the joy of life that makes us happy," says artist Elena Andronescu. She expresses raw emotion in a dynamic and spirited abstract. The piece represents enjoying every minute of life, especially in its simplest moments. Elena captures the essence of joy perfectly, inspiring everyone to enjoy life to the fullest.

fields.title: High Spirits
fields.description: Luminous, vibrant gems take center stage in this dazzling abstract by artist Eric Wilson. Fluid layers of alcohol ink cascade in a dynamic display of color, with each hue radiating toward the other. The energy from the painting intends to activate the law of attraction to onlookers. "It helps you attract your greatest good," says Eric.

fields.title: Live Free
fields.description: Artist Eric Wilson displays a dramatic abstract of rich and vivid hues with his signature alcohol ink layering technique. The lively colors float and link in a way that feels unrestricted. “At its core, the painting is intended to represent an energetic spiritual flow of energy unbounded with limitless potential,“ says Eric. The piece represents the energetic law of attraction.

fields.title: Happy Abundance
fields.description: Ringed color formations excite the senses in this dazzling abstraction by artist Eric Wilson. "The piece intends to amplify our connection to spirit and create more joyous fulfillment within ourselves," says Eric. Dynamic layers of bright hues freely drift in on the surface with intense energy. The piece represents happiness, abundance, and the imminent spiritual growth that follows.

fields.title: Nothing Else Matters
fields.description: "Life could be as beautiful and colorful as we create it—this is my message, my philosophy," says artist Elena Andronescu. The piece highlights a beautiful example of the power of light and its positive energy that can inspire anyone. The beaming rays appear as the central focus of the painting, with expressive paintwork completing the composition.

fields.title: Meet the Light
fields.description: Artist Elena Andronescu presents an abstract painting with a glowing, colorful palette of yellows and white. The piece highlights a beautiful example of the power of light and its positive energy that inspires. The beaming rays appear as the central focus of the painting. "It''s so bright and beautiful, it''s easy to get lost in its beauty, and you may even find your way," says Elena.

fields.title: Fragmentation II - Spaces
fields.description: Artist Marie-Eve Champagne presents a flow of geometric structures in an intriguing abstract. Part of her Fragmentation II series, the work plays with notions of deconstruction and movement. Lines connect, disconnect, and reconnect with intertwining strokes in a dynamic rhythm of hues. Earthy tones of ochres, greens, and blacks mingle on the surface. Segments of color appear almost floating on the surface, moved by an unknown current, ready to be reconstructed or deconstructed anew. Yet, in the end, the gist is one of quiet unity.

fields.title: Lily Pond
fields.description: Artist Linda Shaffer presents a lily pond in nine individual monoprints that can be freely arranged in various patterns. An assortment of green, turquoise, and muted pink hand-printed papers celebrate the beauty of nature and the power of abstract structures. She creates a captivating fusion of vibrant colors, polka-dotted patterns, and painterly brushwork in an engaging display. The work draws inspiration from Linda''s travels - maps, journeys, and hopping from one place to another.

fields.title: After Midnight
fields.description: Artist Terri Bell presents an abstract arrangement of detailed geometric forms. She paints soothing colors and patterns atop a rich mahogany-colored background. Circles and squares dance inside a loose grid. "This piece reminds me of those nights when I stay out late after a great evening, and all of the colors of the city seem to settle in," shares Terri.

fields.title: Indigo/Beige Stripes
fields.description: Artist Janet Hamilton depicts an intricately textured abstract painting with rich gradations of color. She paints indigo and beige stripes,  creating bands of soothing hues. Structured frequencies of blue hues delicately flow throughout the canvas. Janet applies paint with a palette knife, developing a channeled surface.

fields.title: Where the Sea Meets the Sky
fields.description: Relaxing waves smoothly drift along artist Nava Lundy''s tranquil seascape. The direct view renders the composition in an abstract style. Thick impasto paint mimics the energy and movement of the ocean. Nava incorporates sand to create an extra dimension to this seascape.

fields.title: Opposites
fields.description: "Opposites attract," says artist Terri Bell. A tight textual and linear border holds together a loosely arranged grid area. Terri creates minimalist geometric structures but adds compelling points of interest through the busy lines and curves in the center. The stark contrast builds an effective harmony between the eye-catching arrangement of patterns.

fields.title: Drifting
fields.description: A delicate cloud gently meanders along the horizon in artist George Peebles'' ethereal seascape. He displays a striking view of the majestic ocean in a rare moment of calm. The brilliant turquoise hues embody an impression of a powerful renewal. A mesmerizing dreamlike state prospers within the whimsical atmosphere.

fields.title: Afloat
fields.description: Artist Terri Bell displays a soothing abstraction of random shapes floating in a linear field. The round structures appear slightly dimensional and elevated. Terri uses an earthy color palette suggestive of small stones and pebbles. The soothing and meditative composition invokes the feeling of being afloat in a pool of cool water.

fields.title: Crown, No. 12
fields.description: Artist Mary Dorfner Hay presents abstractions of bold colors in motion for her spiritual series, Crown. She illustrates the crown chakra energy using celestial bodies as inspiration for ethereal compositions filled with light and color. Puffs of white overlay a teal background creating a mysterious, unknown space. The piece pairs well with Crown, No. 13, but remains a bold standalone.

fields.title: Crown, No. 15
fields.description: Artist Mary Dorfner Hay presents abstractions of bold colors in motion for her spiritual series, Crown. She illustrates the crown chakra energy using celestial bodies as inspiration for bold compositions filled with light and color. Ethereal flowing colors meld into one another, creating an organic but unknown space. The piece pairs well with Crown, No. 14, but remains a bold standalone.

fields.title: Crown, No. 14
fields.description: Artist Mary Dorfner Hay presents abstractions of bold colors in motion for her spiritual series, Crown. She illustrates the crown chakra energy using celestial bodies as inspiration for bold compositions filled with light and color. Vibrant flowing pink, orange, and blue meld into one another creating an organic but unknown space. The piece pairs well with Crown, No. 15, but remains a bold standalone.

fields.title: Always
fields.description: Artist Linda Shaffer presents a vibrant, multi-layered abstract representation of a heart. Embedded monoprints, washi papers, mark-making, and original images constitute the striking image. Bold brushwork in black, red, and gray create intriguing points of interest. "It is a celebration of the everlasting nature of love," describes Linda.

fields.title: Winter Landscape.
fields.description: Artist Olena Drobysheva presents a peaceful winter landscape in flowing blue and brown shades. She veers away from the typical cold and restrained representation of the season. "It is always a little difficult for an artist who loves bright colors to convey the mood of winter," says Olena. She challenges herself with a different approach to capture the season. Snow, morning light, and a slight frost blanket the field gracefully.

fields.title: Steppe.
fields.description: Artist Olena Drobysheva presents a view of a vast grassland in vivid orange, green, and dark blue hues. "The picture is expressive, impulsive, and charged with intense positive energy," describes Olena. She conveys the state of a hot day in the steppe. The bright sun shines on the orange terrain in a dynamic display.

fields.title: Mountain Reverie Series 8
fields.description: Artist Siyuan Ma illustrates a snow-capped landscape engulfed by the mist. After the rain, the mountain range feels like a huge watercolor painting. The water and pigment blend and remain on the paper, creating a charm that gradually unfolds. Siyuan paints the depth and intensity of colors with a delicate balance. "The near and far perspectives are perfectly captured, and the trees, rocks, and clouds are all portrayed in the shades of the painting," explains Siyuan.

fields.title: Mountain Reverie Series 5
fields.description: Artist Siyuan Ma shares an ethereal outlook of a snowy mountain range with an abstract approach. After the rain, sunlight shines on the water droplets in the air. Rainbow-like colors surface from the snowscape through refraction and reflection. "It is like a beautiful and dreamlike palette dropped by God," says Siyuan.

fields.title: Holy Realignment
fields.description: Artist Sarah Parsons paints a dramatic abstract, creating an atmosphere of calm and serenity. She presents a response to life-altering seasons or situations and our power to choose our attitude as we navigate them. "What was meant for darkness can become light," says Sarah. The piece evokes a strong sense of hope, peace, and joy.

fields.title: Humble
fields.description: Artist Gary J. Noland Jr. demonstrates an abstract grid with organic structures. He combines two of his signature series to create a captivating composition. Gary creates tension by applying brightly colored layers under a muted pearl-white surface. He scrapes, scratches, and sands the top layer to reveal what lies beneath.

fields.title: The Clearing
fields.description: Hope, peace, and joy emanate within the abstract landscape in artist Sarah Parsons'' absorbing piece. She explores the process of transition through a rich gradient of colors. Subtle representational details develop throughout the intuitive layers of paint. "I aim to capture the feeling of stepping out into an open space with a new clearer vision and multiple possibilities of the next path to take," shares Sarah.

fields.title: Signs of Spring
fields.description: Artist Sarah Parsons presents an abstract landscape with towering snowy mountains against the early blooms of spring. Expressive bands of white strike across the dreamy gray and green gradient. "This painting is part of a larger collection of work exploring the process of transition." shares Sarah. The piece represents hope and the inevitability of new life and growth in spring after the death and dormancy of winter.

fields.title: Break of Day
fields.description: Artist George Peebles exhibits a captivating view of a dramatic landscape. The striking colors of a new day beautifully emerge from the sky. A stark contrast between the muted blue atmosphere and prismatic flares of multicolored clouds creates an enchanting feast for the eyes.

fields.title: Dreams Do Come True
fields.description: Artist Eric Wilson presents luminous formations within a rainbow haze of alcohol ink color washes. Abstracted layers of color freely flow throughout the composition. The painting represents a positive affirmation that activates the law of attraction. "It cultivates spiritual awareness on a level that will allow the viewer to attract their greatest good," says Eric.

fields.title: The Love Story
fields.description: Artist Elena Andronescu presents a beautiful abstract piece that tells the story of love. Composed of bright hues and soft brush strokes, it arouses love in any viewer who beholds it. The story sets in a landscape that features the colors of passion and emotion. "The painting is perfect for any space that needs inspiration and can be customized to fit any personal style and preference.

fields.title: Broken Heart
fields.description: "When you have a broken heart, it feels like the world is against you," says artist Elena Andronescu. "The best way to get through it is to acknowledge it and let it out." She captures the emotion in an abstract more intensely, perceptibly, and beautifully from a plastic point of view. Her romantic temperament shines, with a lively sensitivity and a sentimental tension with spirituality.

fields.title: Breathing Silence
fields.description: Artist Elena Andronescu presents an abstraction about the beauty of breathing silence. "The calm in the room is so peaceful and calming, it can be difficult to focus on anything else," says Elena. The way the light reflects off the water creates a harmonious and relaxing effect, while the gentle sound of the waves grows more soothing. The image shows the importance of breathing and how it can be vital to have moments of stillness.

fields.title: Struggle with Life
fields.description: Artist Elena Andronescu presents an abstract that captures the struggle of life according to her optimistic philosophy. The work represents small moments of happiness to heavier moments of trouble. The bright, bold colors, full of life and energy, will help the viewer feel at peace and overcome their struggles. "Life could be as beautiful and colorful as we create it," says Elena.

fields.title: Symbiosis
fields.description: Artist Elena Andronescu shares an abstraction of symbiosis beautifully and innovatively. The piece focuses on the reciprocal relationship between different species. The painting shows a fish swimming in water that is full of bacteria. Elena demonstrates how different creatures can benefit from each other''s presence.

fields.title: Triple Stripes E
fields.description: A radiant palette of vivid pink hues creates a striking geometric abstract in artist Janet Hamilton''s piece. She arranges vibrant vertical lines in cascading patterns with expressive color and texture. "My process involves stacking oil paint carefully into lines using knives to create this colorful artwork," shares Janet. The dynamic synthesis of vibrant hues creates bold pops of color.

fields.title: Triple Stripes D
fields.description: Artist Janet Hamilton presents a bold and bright abstract inspired by positive thoughts and happy feelings. She arranges vibrant vertical lines in cascading patterns with expressive color and texture. "My process involves stacking oil paint carefully into lines using knives to create this colorful geometric artwork," shares Janet. The dynamic synthesis of vibrant hues creates fun pops of color.

fields.title: Apparition
fields.description: Artist Eric Wilson offers a unique abstract view peering into the spirit realm. He never intends to paint physical forms. However, indistinct and shadowy figures often emerge beautifully in his work. "The piece invites the viewer into a transcendent experience far surpassing the visible universe," says Eric. The painting carries a message of wisdom and truth that have value to humankind. Eric suggests having the diptych dry-mounted.

fields.title: Awakening
fields.description: Artist Eric Wilson demonstrates a striking abstraction of layered ink washes, conjuring an impression of a spiritual awakening. Expressive black hues prevail over accents of vivid magenta and lime. The unique diptych explores a state of wakefulness that amplifies the voice of the heart. "Life expands as we do, through the darkness comes a journey to the light," says Eric.

fields.title: Awakening
fields.description: A spiritual awakening of emotions surfaces in artist Elena Andronescu''s vibrant abstraction. An arrangement of lightly textured rows of canary yellow borders the central cream segment. She channels her creative energies and allows her imagination to run wild. "It requires awakening your creativity and skill, and it can be difficult to get the right feeling for the painting," shares Elena.

fields.title: The Never Ending Story
fields.description: Eric Wilson demonstrates a playful, minimalistic abstract of pastel colors that swish across the canvas with perfect harmony. “A lot of my works have some sort of circular gestural movements,” says Eric. The piece stands as a symbol of our life force and how that vitality never ceases. Eric expresses eternal energy that is infinite.

fields.title: Bliss
fields.description: Eric Wilson demonstrates a lively organic pastel abstraction that elicits being in the present moment. Fluid layers of earthy tones cascade in a vibrant display of color. Eric intends to evoke a feeling that excites the soul. The divergent flow of energies captures a palpable sense of bliss.

fields.title: Aquatica
fields.description: Eric Wilson presents a lively abstract that dances across the canvas with elegant fluidity. Stunning blue, teal, and silver merge into a dramatic bubble effect of aquatic suggestion. “As a Pisces, I’m naturally drawn to the ocean and the element of water,” says Eric.  The meditative quality of the piece brings out an evident calmness.

fields.title: Crown, No. 13
fields.description: Artist Mary Dorfner Hay presents abstractions of bold colors in motion for her spiritual series, Crown. She illustrates the crown chakra energy using celestial bodies as inspiration for aoft compositions filled with light and color. Puffs of white blow into a teal background, creating a mysterious, unknown space. The piece pairs well with Crown, No. 12, but remains a bold standalone.

fields.title: Primal
fields.description: Artist Terri Bell demonstrates an abstract that conveys a primal sense of being. Graphic geometric structures connect and form a new whole. It presents an organic quality through loose gridwork on an earthy, textural grey and brown background. The linear and circular elements punctuate the composition.

fields.title: Batik
fields.description: Artist Terri Bell presents an abstract grid in various colors and arrangements. She pays homage to Batik, a traditional Indonesian technique of dyeing wax-covered fabric. Rich tones and contrasting geometric patterns convey an organic textural effect. "I have always been inspired by the rich complexities of Indonesian design work, and this piece is a tribute to that inspiration," says Terri.

fields.title: White Balance
fields.description: Organic geometric figures organize to encompass artist Terri Bell''s abstract composition. The piece consists of white and cream shades loosely balanced on a grey background. Several colors punctuate segments of the white field, creating points of interest. "This is a soothing and delicate composition that conveys a sense of peace and understatement, as do many of my work," says Terri.

fields.title: Finding Balance v5
fields.description: Artist Terri Bell presents an abstract piece that combines linear work and an organized circular pattern. "It organically combines the two areas into a peaceful composition of balance and counterbalance," states Terri. Geometric patterns and irregularities integrate with perfect harmony. The delicate piece conveys a sense of calm and meditation.

fields.title: Subtle Complexities
fields.description: Artist Terri Bell employs geometric forms and linear structures in a meditative abstract. The figures wander and converge into subtle textural segments. "This piece is completely intuitive," says Terri. She visually interprets the changes we all go through from minute to minute while navigating our busy and complex world.

fields.title: Beyond Time
fields.description: Artist Elena Andronescu shares an abstract piece portraying the passage of time. Various colors and shapes make up the composition, combining elements to create a cohesive image. The beautiful and captivating structure conveys important messages about life, happiness, and progress. "It''s sure to appeal to anyone who wants to explore the concept of time in a new and interesting way," says Elena.

fields.title: Deep Love
fields.description: Artist Elena Andronescu shares an abstract concept telling the story of love. The bright colors and soft brush strokes elicit inspiration and emotion from all points of perspective. "If you''re looking for a beautiful and romantic work that will remind you of love stories, this is a perfect choice," says Elena. The piece can be perceived as the viewer''s desires, fitting their style and preferences.

fields.title: Passageway
fields.description: Artist Eric Wilson presents a serene pastel abstraction with whimsical gestural marks. Soft hues of turquoise, magenta, and yellow meander along gentle streams of color. “The artwork was created around the idea that a higher power is at work to light the way to our destiny,” says Eric. The piece inspires hope and a chance at self-reflection.

fields.title: Euphoria
fields.description: Artist Eric Wilson demonstrates a sensual abstract with soft hues, amber tones, and curvatures that elicit the essence of divine feminine energy. “I believe manifesting a euphoric state of mind creates a connection from our consciousness to a spiritual dimension," shares Eric. He creates a mood in the piece that sets the tone for the viewer to explore their inner self and inner energies.

fields.title: Rebirth
fields.description: Artist Eric Wilson demonstrates a fresh abstract with vivid blooms of color. Diverging shades of green with hints of orange and lilac fuse in mesmerizing layers. "The spirit of the painting is meant to bring about feelings of renewal," says Eric. The splashing effect of washed alcohol ink captures a divine energy emanating a sense of renewal.

fields.title: Thankful
fields.description: Artist Eric Wilson demonstrates a playful alcohol ink painting on transparent yupo paper. Colors intermingle and flow about with perfect rhythm. “The painting stands as a divine symbol of gratitude and a reminder of how important it is to maintain a flow of good energy in your life,” says Eric. He builds upon the ethereal atmosphere by creating a cadent discharge of vibrant and delicate hues.

fields.title: The True Path
fields.description: Artist Eric Wilson presents an atmospheric abstract with flowing layers of color. Soft shades of magenta, teal, and black fluidly move throughout the composition. "The Ethereal presence in the piece makes itself known by beckoning your inner being to become one with the energetic flow and be serene," says Eric. He uses flowing pouring techniques that gracefully diffuse the washes of ink.

fields.title: Diving In - Teal Cloud
fields.description: Inspired by Rothko and color field painting, artist Marie-Eve Champagne explores the captivating power of color modulations. Marie-Eve plays with an extended notion of gradience and its contrasts. The soft textures obtained through an additive and subtractive technique with watery pigments accentuate the subtle transition between hues. This piece offers color variations from teal to ivory, giving the artwork a more elusive, almost meditative feel.

fields.title: Extra Hot Snack
fields.description: Artist Jose H. Alvarenga displays a fork, a canned good, and habanero sauce in a vintage still life setup. "The symbology between the skeleton drinking the hot sauce, the Underwood devil, and the fork, hints that the hot sauce is too hot and spicy to handle," shares Jose. He builds a witty and humorous narrative from the simple arrangement. The objects form a subtle triangular orientation with the fork sitting on top of the Underwood ham pointing up to the hot sauce.

fields.title: Theatre in the Sky
fields.description: As the sun slowly sets behind the headlands, a bold and colorful drama unfolds above.  This painting is on a gallery wrapped canvas with all sides finished in a warm brown/black.

fields.title: Poppy Path
fields.description: This is an imaginary landscape. I changed it a few times during the process. The sun is setting slowly as shadows lengthen on a nice summer day. This piece is on a gallery wrapped canvas and the painting continues around the sides. It comes ready to hang.

fields.title: A Little South of Marathon
fields.description: This painting was inspired by the skies of west Texas. This particular scene is from Highway 385 between Big Bend National Park and Marathon, Texas.

fields.title: Castle Vinne
fields.description: This painting depicts ruins of an old castle in morning light. It''s not far from my home, so I went there a few times to finish the painting. I then added small details in my studio. This piece is on a gallery wrapped canvas and the painting continues around the sides. It comes ready to hang.

fields.title: The Great Pumpkin
fields.description: In this classically styled still life, Jesse uses the opportunity to ruminate on colors he more frequently employs in describing a sunset. Deeply dyed fabric, a sturdy pumpkin leftover from the fall''s revelry and showy chrysanthemums stand in for cerulean sky and the fiery orange of clouds at the close of day.

fields.title: Montefioralle Italy
fields.description: Painting of courtyard in old Italian town Montefioralle. This painting is on a gallery wrapped canvas with finished black edges. It comes ready to hang.

fields.title: Morning Mist
fields.description: After an early morning trip to the Oregon coast, Jo painted this classic beach scene. The warm grasses and rocky shoreline draw the eye in and provide nice contrast with the cool water and foggy air in the distance. "I stood in awe, simply astonished at how stunning the surroundings were," says Jo.

fields.title: Late Afternoon At The River
fields.description: As late afternoon approaches, the sunlight glistens on the snowy bank by the river.

fields.title: Two Peas in a Pod
fields.description: Two geese turn to regard the viewer along the grassy bank of a quiet lake. "Growing up with my older sister, my mom would always dress us in the exact same clothes," shares Jo Galang. "With the same haircut and similar looks, people would always mistake us for twins since we were almost the same size and height. It was fun back then but as we grew up, we each evolved into our own distinct personalities."

fields.title: Crimson's Edge III: Waves at Daybreak
fields.description: As waves break on shore, a sailboat heads out to sea under the early morning sky.  A series of oil glazes were used to shroud the headlands in a mystical glow. This piece is on gallery wrapped canvas and the painting continues around the sides. It comes ready to hang.

fields.title: Summer Bouquet
fields.description: Artist Jonelle Summerfield pictures an earnest classical still life of a beautiful bouquet. Stunning dahlias and zinnias lay on the antique ceramic vase with ornate decorations painted in blue. She draws reference from flowers she obtained at the farmers'' market, part of her weekly ritual of relaxation and leisure. The colorful arrangement celebrates the joyful season of late spring.

fields.title: Broken!
fields.description: "Brown or white, when broken open, all eggs are equally colorful, gooey, and ultimately tasty," says artist Lynne Tompkins Brice. She presents the versatile kitchen staple casually laid out, with a single yolk spilled on the center. A careful balance between light and shadow blends between the vivid colors of brown, white, and yellow. Lynne loves capturing the variety and versatility of the not-so-common egg.

fields.title: An Apple a Day
fields.description: Artist Lynne Tompkins Brice depicts a still life of utensils on a clear glass beside a sliced granny smith apple. The realistic detail of the few simple objects presents a lot to observe. Lynne delicately blends the shadows, reflections, highlights, and a pop of color. She aims for the composition to help the viewer appreciate the beauty of the most common things.

fields.title: Bringing Back Memories
fields.description: "This painting is my tribute to the little pine forest near my home - it was a very inspiring place," shares artist Dariusz Choinski. "Unfortunately it no longer exists and all that''s left now are memories." The setting sun shines its golden rays on the snow-laden trees in the Mazovia region in Poland where Dariusz lives. The delicate blue sky contrasts the sunlight completing this heartfelt composition.

fields.title: Clemence
fields.description: A warm and personal portrait of artist John Kelly''s long-time model, dancer Clemence Bonin. "The tender treatment of her face, rendered in warm golds and highlighted by touches of vermillion balanced by cooler skin tones, creates a perfectly realized intimacy," says John.

fields.title: Metamorphoses
fields.description: "A beautiful time of the year when leaves just start to turn yellow," says Dariusz. "This nostalgic scene deserved to be captured - but also a wonderfully inspiring time too." Dariusz spends as much time as possible outside in rural Poland discovering new places and looking for inspiring subject matter. He brings his camera and plein air gear, always taking notes about the colors and values within interesting subjects. This allows him to correct the reference photos he may later use for his studio work, although he never copies his photographs. "I try to catch a feeling of the moment I witnessed," says Dariusz. Usually it takes him many weeks to finish a single painting, as he likes to give himself time to revisit the piece.

fields.title: The Memory of Autumn
fields.description: Rich, full autumn scene. The artist captures a sense of nostalgia and joy. Classical realism with painterly brushwork hinting at the fleetingness of the moment. Warm sunlight through the trees and gentle haziness in the distance.Dariusz Choinski spends as much time as possible outside in rural Poland discovering new places and looking for inspiring subject matter. He brings his camera and plein air gear, always taking notes about the colors and values within interesting subjects. This allows him to correct the reference photos he may later use for his studio work, although he never copies his photographs. "I try to catch a feeling of the moment I witnessed," says Dariusz. Usually it takes him many weeks to finish a single painting, as he likes to give himself time to revisit the piece.

fields.title: View at Civita Castellana No. 2
fields.description: "View at Civita Castella No. 2" captures the red glow of tufa cliffs at the golden hour.  This town in the Roman countryside has long lured painters with its timeless scenery.

fields.title: Calla Lily
fields.description: "The most popular calla lily meaning these days is that of purity, faithfulness, and holiness," says artist Jo Galang. "The flower is often depicted in images of the Virgin Mary. For millions of Christians all over the world, calla lilies are a symbol of rebirth and resurrection. This ties into the resurrection of Jesus Christ. These precious flowers are long associated with natural beauty and are symbolic of a wide assortment of things, many of which date back to Greek, Roman, and Egyptian legends."

fields.title: Easter Again
fields.description: Typical small old church in the Texas Hill Country. Easter time brings blankets of wildflowers throughout the Hill Country, and none more noteworthy than the bluebonnets. There is also some Indian paintbrush mixed in the scene.

fields.title: Woman at Mirror
fields.description: Artist John Kelly paints a dramatic portrait of a nude red-haired woman''s profile. The mirror augments the psychological complexity of the model, facing away, unaware. "Her contemplative face reflected in the mirror confronts the viewer directly, suggesting hidden motives or even affecting knowledge," says John. The soft light beams onto the figure in the shadowed room, further building the mysterious and theatrical atmosphere.

fields.title: 12 Variations
fields.description: "The painting expresses 12 different models in different poses stacked together creating an intricate design of figures," says artist McGarren Flack. Female nudes lay aligned, posed in alternating head to feet fashion creating a poetic composition of the human form, recalling Rennasaince relief work.

fields.title: Forest Encounter
fields.description: A narrow clearing in the woods lights up with soft afternoon sun, as though a spotlight from above. Deep reds and browns warm the verdant scene. "There are times when the best place to visit with God is simply away from everyone else and alone in nature," says Kent Sullivan. "Forest depths have been a shared conscience from artist to artist for thousands of years. King David wrote poetic in Psalm 96:12 - "Let the fields be jubilant, and everything in them; let all the trees of the forest sing for joy.""

fields.title: Brilliant Wave
fields.description: There is a very brief moment when sunlight hits the water and a prismatic array of color is illuminated on the underbelly of a wave. A glimpse of beauty, and then it is gone.  Study a coastline long enough, and you will be rewarded. This piece is on gallery wrapped canvas and the painting continues around the sides. The work comes ready to hang.

fields.title: Weathertop
fields.description: Kent Sullivan draws ideas for paintings from a variety of sources - plein air sessions, photography, videos, memory, and sketches. "There are so many ways to get inspired," Kent says. This cabin scene was created from a childhood memory coupled with a recent photograph.

fields.title: The Genie
fields.description: "I wanted to represent the genie by replicating a specific detail from Pedro Americo´s painting titled ''The Night with Genuises of Study and Love,''" shares artist Jose H. Alvarenga. "Pedro Americo was a 19th Century Brazilian academic painter contemporary of Bouguereau. He is one of my favorite painters and inspirations."

fields.title: Gymnastics
fields.description: "I always enjoy seeing the strength, grace, and flexibility of gymnasts, and this painting is a tribute to this wonderful sport," shares artist Jose H. Alvarenga. "I really like that metal figurine - it shows the strength and flexibility of gymnasts. In the middle is an off-white Carbothello colored pencil pointing to the drawing on the toned paper."

fields.title: Cupcake with Orange Slice
fields.description: Artist Jonelle Summerfield presents an enticing classical still life of a luscious cupcake topped with cranberries. The dessert sits on an antique porcelain plate with a golden fork positioned by its side. Jonelle draws inspiration from the plethora of piquant sweets from Market Street Pastries in Blairsville, Pennsylvania. "It was almost too pretty to eat," says Jonelle. Putting emphasis on almost.

fields.title: Pink Cupcake with Cranberries
fields.description: Artist Jonelle Summerfield presents an enticing classical still life of a luscious cupcake topped with cranberries. The desert sits on an antique porcelain plate with a golden fork positioned by its side. Jonelle draws inspiration from the plethora of piquant deserts from Market Street Pastries in Blairsville, Pennsylvania. "It was almost too pretty to eat," says Jonelle. Putting emphasis on almost.

fields.title: Sunlight
fields.description: Artist John Kelly displays a classical figurative portrait of a model gazing out a window bathed in cool light, reminiscent of Vermeer and Hopper. The woman faces away with just a hint of her face shown to the viewer, concealing her emotion. The loose treatment of the hands, shoulders, and garment creates an introspective feeling of longing. John further sets the mood with a warm interior of gold and earth tones complemented by a dramatic band of light from the exterior.

fields.title: Looking Back
fields.description: The first warm light of a new day casts a beautiful glow on a once busy farm.  I used layers of thin oil glaze to achieve the misty blush.

fields.title: The Afterlight
fields.description: A beautiful dreamy glow scatters across the lake after the sun has set.  An over-layering of paint was used to achieve the misty effect.  This painting is on a gallery wrapped canvas with crisp white sides and comes ready to hang.

fields.title: In Solitude
fields.description: A delicate portrait of a Canada goose against a pastel backdrop. "Spending time alone in nature is something I take advantage of whenever possible," shares artist Jo Galang. "It''s an opportunity to reflect on everything good in my life and one of those moments that allows me to express my gratitude to the most high."

fields.title: Break of Day
fields.description: Inspired by a summer morning along the Kanaka Creek in Maple Ridge, Canada, artist Jo Galang rendered this verdant landscape with soft light washing over the trees and grasses. "The beautiful golden leaves that morph into deep vibrant greens seem to be lighting the entire landscape," says Jo, "transforming it into a dream-like atmosphere where one could easily get lost in its entirety."

fields.title: Twilight Interlude
fields.description: As the day comes to a close, time seems to stand still as the remaining light casts an array of soft beautiful hues on the bluffs and the sea below.  This painting is on a gallery wrapped canvas with black sides, and comes ready to hang.

fields.title: Castles in the Air
fields.description: As evening descends upon the marsh, the tall grasses come alive with vibrant hues of gold.  This painting is on a gallery wrapped canvas with warm brown/black sides and comes ready to hang.

fields.title: Transition Crossroads
fields.description: As the day comes to a close, abundant shades of green, ochre and sienna scatter the landscape. "Sunsets can produce everything from brilliant lights to the deepest shadows," says Gail. "That contrast draws me in. I love the challenge of the half-light hour."

fields.title: Summer Reminiscence
fields.description: Light shades of dry grass and the color of dark leaves melt together in the thick hot summer air. The brush strokes in this painting are thick and expressive.

fields.title: Orchard in Spring
fields.description: The artwork features a nice contrast between dark and white flowers. This painting is on gallery wrapped canvas with finished edges. It comes ready to hang.

fields.title: Morning Haze
fields.description: An early morning scene touched by the first rays of warm sunlight, with a blanket of cool fog lingering among the trees below. Golden grass blankets the sweeping summer hills dotted with lush mature trees.

fields.title: Windmills
fields.description: On this piece I painted a little Dutch ceramic windmill souvenir with a small Delft blue windmill drawing.  In the background there''s another windmill scene: a copy of Jacob Van Ruisdael''s 17th century painting "The Windmill at Wijk Bij Duurstede."  I love the combination of a cloudscape and landscape in the same painting and all those wonderful details makes it one of my favorite landscape paintings.

fields.title: Japanese Elegance
fields.description: "In this piece, I was inspired to paint the doll with its beautiful kimono robe and the Japanese girl pictured on the mirror," explains artist Jose H. Alvarenga. The doll looks down, appearing to look at herself in the compact mirror set at her feet. "To harmonize the red robe I painted a red spool of thread."

fields.title: Windmills 2
fields.description: Part of artist Jose H. Alvarenga''s Windmills series. "In this painting, I decided to include another copy of Jacob Van Ruisdael´s landscape paintings featuring a windmill," says Jose. "I also painted a very old Flemish painting medium and a dutch flower vase with some tulips and yet with another windmill design. The composition forms a perfect triangle between the objects and the structural design."

fields.title: Concert Time
fields.description: "I got inspired to paint this cute figurine of a girl playing the flute to three birds," says artist Jose H. Alvarenga. "To complement the scene I decided to buy a small toy flute. I used the book as a pedestal for the figurine and also as a reference to music."

fields.title: Bread and Butter
fields.description: "The bread with butter and a tall glass of water represents a simple quick snack," says artist Jose H. Alvarenga. "I really love the details of the cow and the landscape on the cover." Jose takes inspiration from the small can of Dutch butter simply placed on a hazelnut table against a subtle emerald gradient.

fields.title: Got Milk? II
fields.description: "I always love to paint challenging yet simple still lifes as this," says Jose. "I was inspired by this vintage ''Our Dairy Best'' canister which I bought online to use as a model. The most colorful details are painted on the canister; the other subjects are variations of black, white and grays."

fields.title: Dedication
fields.description: Vintage piano-shaped music box, pen and handwritten note painted in a classical trompe l''oeil style. "I love the sound of music boxes, it''s incredible how all those tiny holes can replicate a melody," says Jose. "On the note I wrote "Gymnopedie #1 by Erik Satie" - one of my favorites classical pieces."

fields.title: Ravello
fields.description: A classic still life depicting a ceramic bottle and a half-peeled lemon with its peel twirling off the table. "I like to combine traditionalism with contemporary subject matters in my painting," shares artist Jose H. Alvarenga. "I really love the Ravello bottle and its details combined with a classical subject as the half-peeled lemon."

fields.title: Purple Kimono
fields.description: This intimate interior scene, of Parisian artist Ninon Luang Rath, suggests the languidness of a long afternoon. The light of an unseen window spills over the sleeping model, surrounded by gold and purple garments, framed by more muted grays of the couch and wall. The eye is led through the frame by the arrangement of her limbs, leading to the focus, the dreaminess of her facial features.

fields.title: Red Kimono
fields.description: This piece represents the transition in John Kelly''s painting after moving from southern California to Paris. In his new location, the quality of light has shifted from bright Californian light to a mistier, more subtle luminance. The bright red of the kimono frames the more complicated tones of the skin. "The competing forms of light create empathy with the model''s interior monologue, which remains mysterious," explains John.

fields.title: Two Dancers
fields.description: Part of John Kelly''s Dancer series, portraying classical ballet dancers he knows in Paris. Using a dark palette, John suggests an intimate interior feeling. This piece features Clémence Bonin, one of his long time collaborators, and Lucinne Vortisch Sementschenko. The gentle interaction between the two dancers is emphasized by the cascade of light entering from the window, while the before-performance meeting creates a frame of tension.

fields.title: Woman in Moroccan Costume
fields.description: "This piece of dancer Clémence Bonin uses a collection of color notes to frame the direct, challenging stare of the model," says artist John Kelly. "The ornate treatment of the mantle, with its vivid reds and golds subverts the traditional Renaissance images of Mary, while the stark white dress combines with the subtle twist of her waist into a flower-like column, supporting the whole composition."

fields.title: Clemence in the Garden
fields.description: In this piece, artist John Kelly once again paints one of his favorite muses, the dancer Clémence Bodin, done at the Jardin de Luxembourg in Paris. The loose brushwork of the background sketches a brilliant background of green and yellow, framing the figure in soft sunlight. "Her dancer''s pose suggests the moment just before movement, evoking spring, light, and color," says John.

fields.title: Woman with Moths
fields.description: "This haunting portrait was inspired by the filmmaker, Marian Liddel," shares artist John Kelly. John utilized deep shades of red and gold to frame a sensitive rendering of her face. His smooth brushwork conveys a soft expression while delicate moths float in and out of the composition. "It suggests an ineffable beauty, part innocent, with an undercurrent of darkness."

fields.title: First Thaw
fields.description: A small river near the artist''s home during the first spring thaw of 2019, under warm afternoon light. Classical realism capturing both the chilliness of the landscape and the warm diffuse light. Detailed reflections in the river and special attention paid to the grasses and trees along the banks.Dariusz spends as much time as possible outside in rural Poland discovering new places and looking for inspiring subject matter. He brings his camera and plein air gear, always taking notes about the colors and values within interesting subjects. This allows him to correct the reference photos he may later use for his studio work, although he never copies his photographs. "I try to catch a feeling of the moment I witnessed," says Dariusz. Usually it takes him many weeks to finish a single painting, as he likes to give himself time to revisit the piece.

fields.title: Ninon, Gold Sash
fields.description: An intimate portrait of the model Ninon Luang Rath, a Parisian artist, caught in a pose suggesting the work of Vermeer. She sits on a bed of cloud-like tulle, softening the sharp angles of the fabric draped on her shoulder. "It is a piece that is at once thoughtful and passionate," says artist John Kelly.

fields.title: Pause
fields.description: A quiet portrait of Parisian dancer Clemence Bonin. She sits on the floor in a cloud of fluffy tulle, framed by a backdrop of velvet theater drapery. Her manner suggests she is deep in thought while maintaining the grace that a ballerina carries at all times. The barely visible second figure in the background adds a hint of mystery.

fields.title: Woman in Satin
fields.description: This elegant portrait draws inspiration from John Singer Sargent''s spectacular society portraits from the 1890s. "The sensitive handling of the model''s face is in direct contrast with the exciting treatment of the satin, which falls like water from the top of the frame to the bottom," says artist John Kelly. "The deep red and glowing orange light makes the skin and hair of the model radiant with hidden warmth."

fields.title: Woman with Cardinal
fields.description: This piece is of the French artist Ninon Luang Rath, a friend of John''s, and is part of a series of nudes they worked on together. The cool light streaming from the unseen window spills over the distressed wall and dark couch, where the model is curled, the light half revealing, half concealing her body. The gray tones of the wall are interrupted by a burst of color from a cardinal hovering above the figure, focusing the composition, which radiates from the splash of vermillion.

fields.title: The Blue Bird
fields.description: Artist Burte-Ujin Batbayar presents the image of a woman with a colossal crown of flowers. She holds a bluebird in the palm of her hands with delicate conscientiousness. "As beings that are intrinsically connected to the natural world, we must recognize our responsibility to extend our moral considerations beyond just our fellow humans, but also towards the wildlife and the earth itself," states Burte-Ujin. By acknowledging and respecting the intricate balance of nature, humans can begin to nurture and protect it for the benefit of all living beings, including ourselves.

fields.title: The Earth 3
fields.description: "Despite our differences in nationality, ethnicity, or any other defining characteristic, we all inhabit the same planet and are united by our shared humanity," says artist Burte-Ujin Batbayar. He presents a portrait of a girl adorned with flowers, highlighting the beauty of the female form and nature — a solid standalone piece belonging to her series of three entitled The Earth. The work embodies a sense of appreciation not only for the diversity of individuals we encounter but also for the multitude of blessings that we have been bestowed with. Through this mindful approach to life, a greater sense of empathy and connection can be fostered with those around us.

fields.title: The Earth 2
fields.description: "Despite our differences in nationality, ethnicity, or any other defining characteristic, we all inhabit the same planet and are united by our shared humanity," says artist Burte-Ujin Batbayar. He presents an impressionist portrait of a girl with a crown of flowers, highlighting the beauty of the female form and nature—a solid standalone piece belonging to her series of three entitled The Earth. The work embodies a sense of appreciation not only for the diversity of individuals we encounter but also for the multitude of blessings that we have been bestowed with. This mindful approach to life fosters a greater sense of empathy and connection with those around us.

fields.title: Portrait - Michael
fields.description: Artist Hyoungseok Kim shows a man''s portrait in pointillism with metallic blue dots forming the image. The flow of particles emphasizes the material and scientific features of nature. "The minimum unit characteristics can be applied to all basic elements," describes Hyoungseok. He firmly bases his concepts and ideas on materialism and natural sciences.

fields.title: Portrait - Linsay
fields.description: Artist Hyoungseok Kim paints a monochromatic portrait of a woman in pointillism with metallic green dots forming the representational image. The flow of particles emphasizes the material and scientific features of nature. "The minimum unit characteristics can be applied to all basic elements," describes Hyoungseok. He strongly bases his concepts and ideas on materialism and natural sciences.

fields.title: Ghost in the City – City Tour
fields.description:
Arts Hyoungseok Kim paints tourists taking photographs in downtown New York City. He emphasizes nature''s material and scientific features by expressing the flow of dots or particles through pointillism. Hyoungseok shares an excerpt of John Updike’s Cosmic Gall as inspiration for his Ghost in the City series:

Neutrinos, they are very small.
They have no charge and have no mass. 
And do not interact at all. 
The earth is just a silly ball 
To them, through which they simply pass,
Like dustmaids down a drafty hall 
Or photons through a sheet of glass.

fields.title: Every Day
fields.description: Artist Linda Shaffer demonstrates a contemporary abstraction of an expression of love. She layers and sands over fifty coats of paint and collaged paper in a vibrant image of a heart. "The path through the piece reveals itself as I work," shares Linda. Monoprints, washi papers, and original images embed the surface and complete the dynamic execution.

fields.title: Secrets to Tell
fields.description:
Artist Johansen Newman paints a portrait of a young tattooed woman with short feathery hair and a delicate fishnet top. Beautiful silver hooped earrings dangle on her ears. A friendly raven sits on her shoulder, eagerly listening to the secrets she is willing to share. The pink-striped background creates a complementary hue to her skin tone.

The painting comes with a professionally-made frame in dark brown wood.

fields.title: House Sparrows About
fields.description:
Artist Johansen Newman paints a portrait of a young tattooed woman with flowing hair. Her hazel eyes strike a piercing gaze toward the viewer. Sparrows flutter around her head and play with her long brown locks. The aqua-blue sky and fluffy clouds create an atmosphere of carefree abandon.

The painting comes with a professionally-made frame in dark brown wood.

fields.title: Summer in Pecos
fields.description: Artist Warren Keating presents a dancer from Jemez Pueblo performing on a summer’s day in this contemporary figurative piece. Using his signature style, he builds the atmosphere and motion of the young dancer in New Mexico from an unconventional perspective. The expressive, colorful brushwork helps the viewer rediscover the beauty and poetry of the everyday.

fields.title: Showing Up
fields.description: I have always been drawn to Gustav Klimt''s use of color, especially gold, in his paintings of women. He used gold leaf; I use gold acrylic paint. Here we see these women painted in various layers of gold mixed and complimented with the blues, greens and yellows of the natural world.

fields.title: Friends for a Sobering Time 01 Bunny
fields.description: Part of a series of anthropomorphic animal portraits playing up the individuality of the subjects as a way to discuss current social tensions. "In these sobering times, we have to learn to read the air between us differently, learning to respect people conversely across the glances and glares we share with our eyes and the actions we express from our hearts," says artist Ziui Vance.This artwork comes in a simple frame to protect it in shipping and can be easily removed.Frame size: 27.5" x 19.75"Matte opening: 19.75" x 15.75"

fields.title: Friends for a Sobering Time 04 Cat
fields.description: Part of a series of anthropomorphic animal portraits playing up the individuality of the subjects as a way to discuss current social tensions. "In these sobering times, we have to learn to read the air between us differently, learning to respect people conversely across the glances and glares we share with our eyes and the actions we express from our hearts," says artist Ziui Vance.This artwork comes in a simple frame to protect it in shipping and can be easily removed.Frame size: 27.5" x 19.75"Matte opening: 19.75" x 15.75"

fields.title: Friends for a Sobering Time 05 Bunny
fields.description: A monochrome portrait of a rabbit rendered in fine brushwork. Despite the profile view, the animal shares a curious look, as if quietly regarding the viewer. Part of a series of anthropomorphic animal portraits playing up the individuality of the subjects as a way to discuss current social tensions. "In these sobering times, we have to learn to read the air between us differently, learning to respect people conversely across the glances and glares we share with our eyes and the actions we express from our hearts," states artist Ziui Vance.This artwork comes in a simple frame to protect it in shipping and can be easily removed.Frame size: 27.5" x 19.75"Matte opening: 19.75" x 15.75"

fields.title: Coastal Impressions - The Falls
fields.description: "Big Sur is one of many iconic spots in California where the Pacific Ocean meets the majestic cliffs," says artist John Jaster. "McWay Falls is an 80-foot tall waterfall on the coast that inspires tourists and artists from all over the world." John uses heavy body acrylics with multiple layers to achieve bold and rich colors.

fields.title: Kintsugi Horse-The Beautiful Changes
fields.description: Artist Jennifer Ross depicts a white horse with a stunning display of autumn colors in the background. She references the piece after a poem by Richard Wilber about wading through a fall meadow. Jennifer composes the equine portrait using her Kintsugi eggshell technique, a Japanese art form of repairing broken objects with gold lacquer. The white shell fragments form a striking image of the majestic creature, highlighted with a few touches of metallic gold to catch the light.

fields.title: Hug Me
fields.description: "Wouldn’t it be nice if the world would adopt the unconditional love, happy smile, and good nature of a Golden Retriever?" suggests artist Jeff Fleming. He paints a wide-eyed golden retriever with its tongue sticking out over a rainbow-bricked wall. Jeff begins with a pencil sketch and with gloved hands, applies oil paint with his fingers. He creates details with brushes and string, then drizzles paint in random strokes to replicate splashing.

fields.title: Dogmocracy
fields.description: Inspired by the German Shepherd for their loyalty and dedication, artist Jeff Fleming paints a portrait of the canine. He displays the stars and stripes background to emphasize freedom — and fun. Jeff starts with a pencil sketch and applies oil paint using his fingers then adds details with brushes and string for decorative patterns. "I whisk paint in random strokes, a technique which adds a boost of energy," says Jeff.

fields.title: Lying 2
fields.description: This piece reflects my engagement with color, shape, the body and the deeper issues of humanity. I chose "lying" for the title to suggest that  "truth" can be hidden or contradictory, even in conditions of beauty or attraction.  This ambiguity can evoke feelings of uncertainty and instability within the self as well as in society.

fields.title: Attachment
fields.description: This painting represents an ever present theme in life; attachment. This red figure is vividly attached to the red background, much the way I feel attached and connected to the people and parts of my life that bring me joy and love; my family, music, dance, literature, film, and of course my art.

fields.title: With Orange Flowers
fields.description: Part of the artist Scott Dykema''s series of works with the American Bison as the subject matter. He depicts the hefty animal standing firm in a verdant landscape. "This one is dense with textures and bold color choices," says Scott. The patterns fill parts of the ground and the sky, creating intriguing accents.

fields.title: Mod Calculation
fields.description: Artist Mary Pratt illustrates a group of women dressed in colorful costumes striking various poses, each distinct and full of personality. Exploring colorful aesthetics, Mary creates a vibrant and lively art piece filled with energy and vivaciousness. "The painting is a celebration of femininity and the joy of life," says Mary. It invites the viewer to join in the revelry of these exuberant women.

fields.title: Finding Glamour
fields.description: An elegantly dressed woman turns her back from the viewer in artist Mary Pratt''s contemporary portrait. The subject wears a chic ensemble of a white gown with black gloves and her lush black hair neatly tied in an updo. Using sketches from life, Mary infuses glamour using bright hues contrasted with a limited palette. "My go-to mixture of dark color is created using Egyptian violet with Courbet green," shares Mary. She uses copious amounts of the alluring combination to create a rich, captivating contrast.

fields.title: Bicycling in Blue
fields.description: A lone bicyclist tours around a cool spring morning in artist Warren Keating''s contemporary figurative painting. He captures the rider on video and uses that reference image, painting him alla prima in his signature style. The resultant expressive images communicate the atmosphere and motion of the subject in Santa Fe from his unusual perspective. "I hope my expressive painting helps you to rediscover the beauty and poetry of the mundane every day," says Warren.

fields.title: On the Banks of the Indian River
fields.description: Artist Mary Pratt creates a monochromatic rendition of a soothing lakeside view in Sebastian, Florida. A small wooden canoe moors along the bank of the tranquil inland stream. "During the holidays, someone decorated it, so I saved the photographic memory for future reference," states Mary. The limited color palette accents the areas with heavier brushwork and builds a quality of expansion.

fields.title: The Classic
fields.description: Artist Nava Lundy features an up-close view of an iconic chrome-blue Cadillac. "People love classic cars for many reasons, but the most obvious one is the sheer romance of the vehicles," says Nava. The timeless personality of the car shines through despite its dated design. Its stylish and distinguished sheen develops charm compared to how different the automobile industry has evolved now. "Even if you don''t have one, or even if you don''t know what it is, you have to admit that''s pretty cool," says Nava.

fields.title: Neutral
fields.description: This piece is a result of Amber''s current focus on become looser, more abstract and freer with her painting style. "I am experimenting with layering, texture, and the idea of leaving work with an unfinished, raw look," says Amber. This piece was made using a combination of house paint and oil paint. It has multiple layers of paint which gives it a subtle, slight texture.

fields.title: Catcher
fields.description: Inspired by a feline''s love for rolling toys, artist Jeff Fleming demonstrates a charming portrait of a cat playing with a green ball. It relaxes on a soft pink cushion with a gentle stare at the viewer. Jeff starts with a pencil sketch and applies oil paint using his fingers then adds details with brushes and string for decorative patterns. "I whisk paint in random strokes, a technique which adds a boost of energy," says Jeff.

fields.title: Here Today, Gone Tomorrow
fields.description: Artist Darlene McElroy displays a contemporary portrait of a woman with her hair flowing in the wind. Bold patterns in vibrant colors establish her dynamic silhouette. "The winds of life moved her to new places and new experiences full of secrets," reveals Darlene. The unconventional materials create a sculptural and dimensional aspect.

fields.title: Searching for Completion in My Garden
fields.description: "One wing symbolizes the quest of completion," states artist Darlene McElroy. "And where better to search but in the peace and quiet of your garden where it is both colorful and calming?" Darlene depicts a mysterious dark nude facing away from the viewer with only one wing attached to her back. The subject sets a unique contrast to its lively background filled with varying materials in tones of gold and beige.

fields.title: I am Woman
fields.description: "From Diana the huntress, Gaia, and the Amazonians, women are stronger than they first appear," says artist Darlene McElroy. "Women are connected with the Gods, the earth, growth, fertility, and in some cases —the underworld. Hear us roar!"

fields.title: The Earth
fields.description: "Despite our differences in nationality, ethnicity, or any other defining characteristic, we all inhabit the same planet and are united by our shared humanity," says artist Burte-Ujin Batbayar. He presents a portrait of a girl with eyes concealed by florals, highlighting the beauty of the female form and nature—a solid standalone piece belonging to her series of three entitled The Earth. The work embodies a sense of appreciation not only for the diversity of individuals we encounter but also for the multitude of blessings that we have been bestowed with. This mindful approach to life fosters a greater sense of empathy and connection with those around us.

fields.title: Joy of Celebration.1
fields.description: Artist Julia Hacker paints a contemporary still life of Moroccan lanterns. She pays homage to the rich culture revealed within their intricate designs. An explosion of vibrant colors and metallic shimmers come together in mesmerizing patterns of shapes and forms. The maximalist arrangement evokes a palpable sense of wonder and whimsy.

fields.title: On Top of the World
fields.description: Using colorful patterns and symbolism, artist Alana Clumeck creates a striking piece with two wolves facing each other, standing before a dark spheric background. "One representing good, the other representing evil," says Alana. "Perched on top of the world, with a patterned landscape and a star-speckled sky. Which wolf wins? The one that you feed more." In this piece, Alana used a mix of acrylic paint, oil pastels, and watercolor to create distinct dimensions of tone and texture.

fields.title: To Honor
fields.description: "This bird was painted as a part of a series after a huge catastrophic freeze in Texas," shares artist Scott Dykema. He depicts a thoughtful portrait of a bluejay perched on a golden slate melting under candles. "The power grid almost shut down. Many went without power for days during the coldest days in Texas history. However, even though many were inside trying to survive, the animals outside were doing the same. The days after the freeze were filled with so much gratitude and appreciation. Seeing the birds alive was just mind-blowing icing on the cake."

fields.title: With Golden Clouds Raining Down
fields.description: Artist Scott Dykema exhibits a hefty brown bison with a thick bushy mane. A psychedelic Aztec background in blue and red, with gold metallic accents draws interest to the engrossing background. Part of his series honoring the North American animal. He heavily works with details, patterns and well thought out colors.

fields.title: Expansion (Set of 2)
fields.description: Artist Yelitza Diaz displays a diptych with two central figures on each canvas. Yelitza draws circular patterns surrounding them to project the sensation of volume. A modern depiction of spirituality and growth unfolds in the meaningful modern piece. She conveys the idea that the human being is in constant expansion and connection with the environment. Her work seeks to connect the individual with the universe that surrounds them.

fields.title: Kintsugi Horses - Alchemy
fields.description: Artist Jennifer Ross composes an elaborate equine piece using the Kintsugi Eggshell technique. Inspired by the Japanese art form of repairing broken objects with gold lacquer, she collages white and brown eggshell fragments onto the canvas to form the structure of the horses. Jennifer applies metallic copper and silver paint to coat the shell pieces. The sky of gold above completes the metaphor of transforming base metals into gold to attain spiritual enlightenment.

fields.title: Asking You
fields.description: This painting is very personal. This couple is having dinner and the woman is asking for more wine in a very unexpected way.  I find it dramatic and the same time humorous.  I used acrylic paint on a horizontal, panoramic canvas.  Predominant colors are red, blue, yellow, and gold.

fields.title: Fade into You
fields.description: Artist Kristen Brown depicts an ethereal translucent shape of a young girl in a dress. Overlapping imagery of flowers and plant matter merge with the figure, obscuring the boundary between place and time, evoking a sense of enchantment. Rendered with soft light, the painting mimics the quality of a moment fading from memory.

fields.title: Orkney Coast
fields.description: Bold dimensions of color transform the quaint coastal village view into a gorgeous contemporary piece. Artist Rick "Marlowe" Schneider pictures the breathtaking Orkney Islands in a playful display of bright hues. Charming houses lead into the glimmering seashore with a spectacular background of a rocky mountain. The cobblestones, bricks, and wooden architecture give a nostalgic feeling of being transported back in time.

fields.title: Ghost in the City - Station
fields.description:
Artist Hyoungseok Kim paints five human figures in a bus station. He emphasizes the material and scientific features of nature by expressing the flow of dots or particles. Hyoungseok expresses his concept through pointillism. He shares an excerpt of John Updike’s Cosmic Gall as inspiration for his Ghost in the City series:

Neutrinos, they are very small.
They have no charge and have no mass. 
And do not interact at all. 
The earth is just a silly ball 
To them, through which they simply pass,
Like dustmaids down a drafty hall 
Or photons through a sheet of glass.

fields.title: Ghost in the City – Cosplay
fields.description:
Artist Hyoungseok Kim paints a group taking photographs of a cosplayer in an event hall. He emphasizes nature''s material and scientific features by expressing the flow of dots or particles through pointillism. Hyoungseok shares an excerpt of John Updike’s Cosmic Gall as inspiration for his Ghost in the City series:

Neutrinos, they are very small.
They have no charge and have no mass. 
And do not interact at all. 
The earth is just a silly ball 
To them, through which they simply pass,
Like dustmaids down a drafty hall 
Or photons through a sheet of glass.

fields.title: Pressure Point
fields.description: This painting is about rethinking the role of women in art history and examining the smile itself as a boundary.

fields.title: Dogmocracy ll
fields.description: Artist Jeff Fleming shows a contemporary portrait of a charming dog bouncing a blue ball with its button nose. "Dalmatians have a storied history of their contributions to helping firefighters," says Jeff. He pays tribute to their bravery and adds the stars and stripes background to emphasize their important role in American history. Jeff creates details with brushes and string for decorative patterns, whisking paint in random strokes for a dynamic boost of energy.

fields.title: He Finally Earned His Tiara
fields.description: Artist Darlene McElroy creates a portrait depicted as royalty with recurring accents of flowers in his accessories and in the background. "He never fit in the mold growing up," says Darlene. The subject loves dressing up, doing makeup, tiaras, and bling. He finally meets his tribe and finds others like himself.

fields.title: Ghost in the City - Restaurant
fields.description:
Artist Hyoungseok Kim paints three human figures sitting in a restaurant. He puts emphasis on the material and scientific features of nature by expressing the flow of dots or particles through pointillism. Hyoungseok shares an excerpt from John Updike’s Cosmic Gall as inspiration for his Ghost in the City series:

Neutrinos, they are very small.
They have no charge and have no mass. 
And do not interact at all. 
The earth is just a silly ball 
To them, through which they simply pass,
Like dustmaids down a drafty hall 
Or photons through a sheet of glass.

fields.title: Ghost in the City - Park
fields.description:
Artist Hyoungseok Kim paints four human figures in a park in a cold afternoon. He puts emphasis on the material and scientific features of nature by expressing the flow of dots or particles. Hyoungseok shares an excerpt from John Updike’s Cosmic Gall as inspiration for his Ghost in the City series:

Neutrinos, they are very small.
They have no charge and have no mass. 
And do not interact at all. 
The earth is just a silly ball 
To them, through which they simply pass,
Like dustmaids down a drafty hall 
Or photons through a sheet of glass.

fields.title: Ghost in the City – Crosswalk
fields.description:
Artist Hyoungseok Kim paints six human figures on a crosswalk in an urban setting. He emphasizes nature''s material and scientific features by expressing the flow of dots or particles through pointillism. Hyoungseok shares an excerpt of John Updike’s Cosmic Gall as inspiration for his Ghost in the City series:

Neutrinos, they are very small.
They have no charge and have no mass. 
And do not interact at all. 
The earth is just a silly ball 
To them, through which they simply pass,
Like dustmaids down a drafty hall 
Or photons through a sheet of glass.

fields.title: Ghost in the City - Track Running
fields.description:
Artist Hyoungseok Kim paints five human figures running on a track with pointillism. He puts emphasis on the material and scientific features of nature by expressing the flow of dots or particles. Hyoungseok shares an excerpt from John Updike’s Cosmic Gall as inspiration for his Ghost in the City series:

Neutrinos, they are very small.
They have no charge and have no mass. 
And do not interact at all. 
The earth is just a silly ball 
To them, through which they simply pass,
Like dustmaids down a drafty hall 
Or photons through a sheet of glass.

fields.title: Inside out /Red/
fields.description: Tapping into the realms of fantasy, artist Burte-Ujin Batbayar shares a striking image of a winged woman. Like a mythical phoenix that rises from the ashes, the vibrant red wings of this mighty creature symbolize her strength and resilience. The viewer can sense her unwavering determination through her piercing gaze. It serves as a reminder that even in the darkest moments, we can rise again and emerge stronger than ever.

fields.title: Inside Out /Purple/
fields.description: Artist Burte-Ujin Batbayar presents a portrait of a woman with striking dark wings. They set her apart from others and emphasize her otherworldly qualities, making her an intriguing and unforgettable presence. The subject''s body language, including her position, direct eye contact, and vibrant use of purple colors, all convey a sense of confidence and power. She appears to have already achieved victory, emanating an energy that commands attention and respect.

fields.title: Inside Out /Grey/
fields.description: Artist Burte-Ujin Batbayar presents a portrait of a woman with a poignant facial expression. The subject manifests the struggle that she faces with her insecurities and self-consciousness. Her wings, represented with grey hues, further emphasize her fragile state, alluding to a sense of vulnerability. However, hope prevails, even in this emotional portrayal. "It reminds us that we all have moments of uncertainty but can always find hope and strength to carry on," says Burte-Ujin.

fields.title: All That Is Golden
fields.description: Artist Mary Pratt paints a portrait of three women in beautiful long gowns. She pictures them in a neutral setting, subtly detailing the gold to pop. Layers of paint applied using a palette knife, and wide brushes keep the figures loose and flowing. Halos grace their heads, promoting the old world in a contemporary setting.

fields.title: Pawsitive Energy
fields.description: "No bad days with a dog, a ball, and a beach!" states artist Jeff Fleming. He describes his painting style as kinetic impressionism, embodying action, color and fun. "I started with a pencil sketch, then with gloved hands, applied oil paint using my fingers. Later, I added details using brushes and string. Once dried, I moved the piece to my studio floor where I whisked paint in authoritative strokes - a technique that replicates splashing."

fields.title: Ghost in the City - Police 2
fields.description:
Artist Hyoungseok Kim paints seven police officers on a street in full riot gear. He puts emphasis on the material and scientific features of nature by expressing the flow of dots or particles. Hyoungseok shares an excerpt from John Updike’s Cosmic Gall as inspiration for his Ghost in the City series:

Neutrinos, they are very small.
They have no charge and have no mass. 
And do not interact at all. 
The earth is just a silly ball 
To them, through which they simply pass,
Like dustmaids down a drafty hall 
Or photons through a sheet of glass.

fields.title: Ghost in the City - Lunch Hour
fields.description:
Artist Hyoungseok Kim paints human figures crossing the street with pointillism. He emphasizes nature''s material and scientific features by expressing the flow of dots or particles. Hyoungseok shares an excerpt from John Updike’s Cosmic Gall as inspiration for his Ghost in the City series:

Like dustmaids down a drafty hall

fields.description:
Artist Hyoungseok Kim paints three figures in a subway station with pointillism. He emphasizes the material and scientific features of nature by expressing the flow of dots or particles. Hyoungseok shares an excerpt from John Updike’s Cosmic Gall as inspiration for his Ghost in the City series:

Like dustmaids down a drafty hall
