fields.title: Ghost in the City - Whole Foods
fields.description:
Artist Hyoungseok Kim paints three women grocery shopping at a Whole Foods store. He emphasizes the material and scientific features of nature by expressing the flow of dots or particles through pointillism. Hyoungseok shares an excerpt from John Updike’s Cosmic Gall as inspiration for his Ghost in the City series:

Neutrinos, they are very small.
They have no charge and have no mass. 
And do not interact at all. 
The earth is just a silly ball 
To them, through which they simply pass,
Like dustmaids down a drafty hall 
Or photons through a sheet of glass.

fields.title: Ghost in the City - Lotte World
fields.description:
Artist Hyoungseok Kim paints human figures in green pointillism except for a little girl in pink. He emphasizes nature''s material and scientific features by expressing the flow of dots or particles. Hyoungseok shares an excerpt from John Updike’s Cosmic Gall as inspiration for his Ghost in the City series:

Neutrinos, they are very small.
They have no charge and have no mass. 
And do not interact at all. 
The earth is just a silly ball 
To them, through which they simply pass,
Like dustmaids down a drafty hall 
Or photons through a sheet of glass.

fields.title: Road Into Color
fields.description: Artist Kip Decker creates a captivating expressionist landscape. A small winding road climbs up a field full of colorful flowers toward a stand of trees. Vibrant pops of lavender and carnation emerge from the verdant meadow. The textured paintwork animates the relaxing spring scene.

fields.title: A Day on Monhegan Island
fields.description: Artist Rebecca Klementovich shares a colorful outlook on the beautiful Monhegan Island—one of her favorite places to paint off the coast of Maine. "Monhegan is a famous painters paradise which is a 45-minute boat ride from shore," shares Rebecca. She features the small houses nestled within the landscape that overlooks the sea.

fields.title: Summertime Rural Farm
fields.description: Artist Rebecca Klementovich presents a charming farm with a striking expressionist approach. She paints the piece en plein air during the breezy summer. "I love summertime in rural small towns. There is so much color to paint underneath the shadows of the trees and the bluebird skies.," says Rebecca. "The farmer has 30 cows that sometimes sneak onto the neighbor''s field."

fields.title: Ways of the City
fields.description: Artist Robert Hofherr presents an energetic rendering of a city scene. The fauvist colors and expressionist paintwork creates a memorable image. "The drawing style has been simplified, and the actual perspective altered to suit the needs of the composition," says Robert. He paints repetitive linear elements to contribute to the overall visual consistency of the piece.

fields.title: Sunflowers
fields.description: Artist Robert Hofherr presents an expressionist still life inspired by many of Van Gogh''s work in this genre. He executes the piece with looser and less realistic details. "In some portions, the paint application gives a nod to Matisse," shares Robert. The color palette eliminates red and orange, creating an image of yellow and gold as the show''s stars.

fields.title: Among the Hidden
fields.description: Artist Burte-Ujin Batbayar depicts an expressionist portrait of a woman enveloped by vibrant floral clusters. The radiant blossoms that adorn the body serve as an aesthetically pleasing accessory and symbolize a hidden desire. Interestingly, while the movement of the hands may suggest resistance to this passion, the posture of the legs conveys the opposite - a disobedient, unyielding spirit unafraid to pursue what it wants.

fields.title: Study in Blue and Gold
fields.description: Artist Robert Hofherr presents an autumnal scene with trees turning a golden hue, reinterpreted with a hefty dose of the fauvist palette and expressive paint handling. Bold and bright colors pop within the minimal representational detail. "I attempt to only paint in what is required and no more," states Robert. The composition results in little extraneous design to simplify the visual experience.

fields.title: Sunset
fields.description: Artist Olena Drobysheva presents an expressionist winter landscape soaked by the warmth of a sunset. She paints grasses and trees coated with frost, transparent as glass that crack a little in the cold. "I walked in the forest near Kyiv one February and saw the fabulous beauty of nature," shares Olena. She paints from imagination with multiple layers of color applied in thin strokes.

fields.title: Lake House with Two Boats
fields.description: Artist Laura (Yi Zhen) Chen exhibits an expressionist view of the lakeside rendered in heavy brushwork and bright colors. She paints a red house and two boats under the shade of the trees with vivid shadows on the green moss on the ground. The remaining leaves dance and rustle as cool gusts of wind blow over. "They are calling you to take one more fishing trip to soak up the sun and water before it gets gusty and cold," narrates Laura.

fields.title: Max and Sylvie
fields.description: Artist Lee Smith illustrates a woman with a wildly abundant mane of blue hair, gazing confidently at the viewer with piercing eyes and an enigmatic expression. The playful and mischievous grin of her cat nestled next to her chin brings the painting a playful touch. Lee’s skillful use of bold and delicate colors creates an engaging image, inviting the viewer to explore every detail.

fields.title: Duet
fields.description: Artist Darlene McElroy creates a mixed-media nighttime depiction of birds in flight. Patterned golden sheets make up their soaring wings, standing out from the evening sky. "Life is a dance, whether it is our career, love life, or just living each day," says Darlene. The composition exemplifies not knowing the next step but feeling the rhythm like music.

fields.title: Spin
fields.description:
Artist Darlene McElroy presents a portrait of a mysterious woman in a vibrant collage. Spinning tops hang ins strings depicting constant motion. "As life and the earth move forward in time, we all change mentally and physically," says Darlene. "One day we are barbie dolls, and the next we are the Venus of Willendorf - we are stuck in the spin." 

The painting comes in a light wooden box frame.

fields.title: Ridgetop Flowers
fields.description: Artist Kip Decker displays a flourishing landscape with an expressionist approach. Colorful wildflowers abundantly grow by the ridge of a hill. He paints the lively piece in strikingly dramatic impasto. Kip captures the feeling of spring with the evergreen panorama.

fields.title: Blue Eyes
fields.description: The distinguished stare of a young girl with green eyes pierces through artist Paulina Archambault''s expressionist piece. The emphasis on her pale white skin and rosy blush gives her the appearance of a porcelain doll. Paulina gives life to the undaunted character with gestural brushwork in bold colors.

fields.title: Autumn's Light
fields.description: Silvery autumn sunshine gleams over artist George Peeble''s dreamy landscape. A reflection of the colors of autumn luster within the vast clearing of trees. Intense yellow and orange hues blaze through the abundant foliage. The vast and unending terrain creates a whimsical and otherworldly feel to the composition.

fields.title: Canyon Rock
fields.description: In viridian hues, artist Vahe Yeremyan paints the towering cliffs in Sedona, Arizona. Creating a sweeping background of bright blues, Vahe highlights the majestic canyons with beautiful pops of magenta and pink. One can almost hear the impressive traverse of the wind through the rocks.

fields.title: Respite
fields.description: A face surfaces within the abstract expression of artist Sharon Sieben''s striking contemporary portrait. Cold wax mixed with oil constitutes a compelling image of her model in a meditative state. Sharon reminds us that sometimes, especially after a busy day, a quiet moment is most welcomed. "The subject in this portrait would agree," says Sharon.

fields.title: Abstract Still Life
fields.description: Artist Gail Ragains produces an expressionist still life with a tactile sculptural feel. Collaged papers layer and build up to form the structured elements. The shapes border into abstraction, appearing straightforward and robust. "When observed closer, one will notice the beautiful patterns on the surface," notes Gail.

fields.title: Quiet Embers
fields.description: Warm rays of light caress the autumn foliage in an exuberant display of fiery hues. Artist Michael Orwick presents a striking glimpse of a creek leading into a dense forest. He combines expressive brush strokes and subtle tonalist and impressionist influences. Michael highlights the evening light raking across the ground and against the bank of trees.

fields.title: Path.
fields.description: Artist Olena Drobysheva captures the feeling of flickering landscapes outside the window during long drives. "I love the road," says Olena. "And I go and think about how to convey these fragments of nature in a picture." Suggestions of houses, trees, and lights emerge as salient points of interest in the background. The sky bursts with glorious colors as the sun slowly sets in the distance.

fields.title: Still Life with Green Glass Jar
fields.description: Artist James Hartman presents an expressionist still-life of an inviting table spread. Vibrant hues of cyan, lime green, and purple pop within the encaustic composition. “I like to paint objects for their color relevance," shares James. In a small area, the antique ephemera ground peeks through the beeswax and oil paint.

fields.title: The Soil
fields.description: Artist Olena Drobysheva presents a sweeping view of a spring landscape using radiant hues of blue, yellow, and green against a distinction of black. She conveys the state of nature on a warm April day with an expressionist approach. The grass, trees, and land wake up from the cold winter as the sun grows warmer. "The soil is filled with moisture and ready to give birth to new grass and greenery," says Olena.

fields.title: Blue Horse with Crosses
fields.description: Artist Nick Bontorno exhibits a portrait of a blue horse. Spanish crosses frame its head in the corners of the image. Nick charmingly employs the fundamentals of primitivism with his unique touch. He focuses on how the piece feels rather than how it looks.

fields.title: Dreams
fields.description: Artist George Peebles presents a sweeping view of a grassy shore facing the open sea. A picturesque capture of a beautiful day with a dream-like quality. Colorful violet hues trail the horizon, fading and reemerging into cool gradients. The striking piece will enhance any space.

fields.title: Green Reflection
fields.description: In artist Mary Pratt''s expressionist work, a swift river gushes into the lake. She fully captures the beauty of the creek near where she lives. Mary simplifies the landscape and applies generous amounts of paint using a palette knife and wide brushes. "I could hear and see the rushing stream making this painting spot a new favorite that awakened my senses," says Mary.

fields.title: Reflection - Girl Portrait
fields.description: An expressionist portrait of a girl gazing directly at the viewer by artist Paulina Archambault. She wears her hair in separate pigtails with a red ribbon charmingly tied to one side. Her quiet expression evokes a calm and curious disposition. Using a minimal palette of red, salmon, and muted ivory, Paulina complements the child''s pale skin with lighter hues. With a palette knife, Paulina demonstrates gestural brushwork perfectly paired with a tightly cropped composition.

fields.title: Soul Searching
fields.description: Artist Sharon Sieben presents an expressive portrait of a woman in warm tones of red, maroon, beige, and ochre. With her eyes closed and head tilted forward, she stills and gathers herself in silent meditation. "Sometimes it helps to just take a deep breath and let the dust settle."

fields.title: Lady America
fields.description: A large-scale portrait of a woman painted in quick gestural brushwork. The character wears an expression of pleasant amusement, with her hands caught in mid-movement. Her hair and garb reminiscent of classical imagery, she is rendered with colors of red, white, and blue against a deep gray background.

fields.title: Beach Dancers
fields.description: Artist Diana Elena Chelaru depicts three expressionist female figures in a wavy dance. Their flowing dresses burst into a joyous explosion of blue flowers. She achieves a unique consistency through dripped and dried enamel paint layered with acrylics. Diana patterns fine pointillism details for more playful elements.

fields.title: Stagecoach Road
fields.description: A cradled panel is laid with vintage sewing tissues as a mordant to adhere the beeswax. I did an underpainting in ink then used a prismatic palette to lead the eye through the composition.

fields.title: Deep Love
fields.description: As part of her series of diverse family portraits, artist Diana Elena Chelaru demonstrates an expressionist portrayal of a mother and her two young children. She affectionately embraces them with tenderness. Diana represents the figures in a triangular composition to create a sense of visual unity. "I chose to represent the mother with closed eyes to symbolize the challenges of being a single parent," says Diana.

fields.title: Family Portrait
fields.description: Artist Diana Elena Chelaru displays an expressionist portrait of a family of five. They share a warm embrace evoking an outpouring of love. "Lately, I have been interested in depicting different types of families, starting with this traditional representation," says Diana. The gestural figures have a nuclear-like structure symbolizing the special bond between them.

fields.title: Autumn Leaves
fields.description: Artist Sharon Sieben paints a magical autumnal forest dominated by warm hues. The vivid palette of fall colors encompasses the striking landscape. "My goal is to capture mother nature''s inspiring paintbrush," says Sharon. In painterly brushwork, she displays the scene in fiery grandeur with a hint of whimsy.

fields.title: August in Full Dress
fields.description: A stand of deep violet trees on the horizon in striking contrast to the bright blue sky. Using swift brushwork, artist George Peebles creates a calm and peaceful scenic view. George is known for his dramatic autumn landscapes and panoramic ocean vistas. He enjoys painting brief, electric moments in nature. George draws on his surroundings in Michigan but ultimately paints entirely from his imagination.

fields.title: Tryon 12
fields.description: Artist Naoko Tadotsu demonstrates a colorful tree on a sunny summer afternoon. Reflections of bright sunlight from a nearby river pierce through the leaves of the lush foliage. A compelling display of blue and green marks intensifies in the warm background. "The lights and leaves together create an illusion of a large stained glass," says Naoko.

fields.title: The Wind
fields.description: Recently, Sumner has been exploring the use of text in her paintings, adding poetry to accompany the message of the artwork. "This piece is about the loss we feel when thinking of times we can never return to - fond memories of people, places and spaces in time that life has pushed us away from," she says. In this painting, Sumner included the following original poem:The wind wafts away my memoriesAs it waltzes through my hairOh how I wish I could tell it"By my ears, just leave them there""I may be a crumbling colossus" I say"Ozymandias beyond disrepairBut my memories are not your dust to breeze awaySo by my ears, to whistle to my soul once moreBy my ears, please just leave them there"

fields.title: Morning Light
fields.description: In this colorful landscape, James Hartman explores color placement and contrasts. The painting was worked on over a period of time, giving glimpses of different layers of color. James likes the Maurice Denis quote, "Remember that a painting - before being a battle horse, a nude woman, or an anecdote of some sort - is essentially a flat surface covered with colors, put together in a certain order."

fields.title: Dawn Over the Foliage
fields.description: Artist Rebecca Klementovich offers a vibrant mountainside view filled with multi-colored trees inspired by the Washington Valley of New Hampshire. "It is my favorite painting influenced by a hike on the mountain trail," shares Rebecca. "I grew up near the mountains and have spent so much time there. The light hitting the edges of the fall trees produces a subtle glow. It is this glow produced by the sunset that I was going for."

fields.title: Beach Chair
fields.description: In artist Gail Ragains'' figurative piece, a woman takes a breather on the beach. She reclines comfortably on a green chair, in a mix of gestural marks within a thought-out composition. The muted color combination allows the warm and cool shades to play off each other.

fields.title: Summer Coming In
fields.description: Artist Robert Hofherr presents a colorful rendering of a late spring woodland using bold hues and expressive paint application to create a compelling visual. "The blue underpainting is allowed to show in many places," shares Robert. He only presents a minimal amount of representational detail. This keeps the overall work fresh and vibrant.

fields.title: The Old Curiosity Shop
fields.description: Artist Robert Hofherr exhibits the whimsical interior of an antique shop transformed using pattern, and stylized rendering. He creates an interesting "color world," with a limited palette of blue and gold shades with accents of maroon. The expressionist style comes off as suggestive rather than explicitly representational. Robert uses the negative spaces of the white canvas to become an important part of the overall composition.

fields.title: Glow
fields.description: Artist Robert Hofherr reduces reality to a series of large color shapes making up an expressionist city park. A bright ray of light shines through and gives warmth to the tender scenery. He adds minimal details to represent the different elements of the composition without diminishing the graphic quality. "The limited palette creates a unique ''color world'' for the painting," says Robert.

fields.title: On a Clear Day
fields.description: Artist Robert Hofherr displays a study of an old bridge in Fauvist colors and expressive brushwork. Its reflection in the water creates a bold and confident mirrored image. Robert steers from anything too photographic and uses patterns and stylized rendering for representation. "There is sufficient detail in the trees and surroundings for the work to be understandable," says Robert. The use of primary hues allows the development of interesting color relationships.

fields.title: Natural Bridge
fields.description: A colorful study of a fallen log over a stream stretches out in artist Robert Hofher''s expressionist landscape. Influenced by English painter Icon Hitchens, Robert uses textures and graphic patterns for representation. Bold colors in expressive brushwork constitute the elements of nature. The limited color palette helps create a fascinating "color world" for this work.

fields.title: Path Through the Forest
fields.description: Artist Robert Hofherr paints an expressionist rustic woodland path winding into the forest. He challenges representation and only suggests the depiction of the scenery. Minimal details characterize the limbs and branches of the trees. "The rule is not to add anything to the painting that would totally reveal it," says Robert. The color palette warmly recreates the autumnal season.

fields.title: Saguaro Silhouettes
fields.description: "These amazing giants are my favorite from the Sonoran desert," expresses artist Sharon Sieben. "I feel fortunate to have them in my neighborhood." Bold and sturdy saguaro cacti stand tall in the middle of the bright warm desert. Their vibrant green colors create a delightful balance with the happy yellow hue. Vivid red and light blue peek from beneath adding energetic lines of color. A cloud of dark blue adds to the balance of composition, playing up the contrast with the black strokes of the sturdy plants.

fields.title: My Best Friend
fields.description: Two figures in floral gowns embrace in a quiet, dream-like moment. Part of artist Diana Elena Chelaru''s new series of works entitled Re-imagining Femininity. "The artworks delve into fragments of a secretive place where femininity and self are re-imagined - and triumph and vulnerability are laid bare," explains Diana.

fields.title: Glory of Autumn
fields.description: Fiery orange and red fall leaves adorn trees with lightning-like white branches that stretch toward the clouds. In the foreground, a wide expanse of tilled soil draws the eye to the horizon. Artist George Peebles is known for his dramatic landscapes and panoramic ocean vistas. He enjoys painting brief, electric moments in nature. He draws on his surroundings in Michigan but ultimately paints entirely from his imagination.

fields.title: Times Square II
fields.description: An expressionist depiction of the crowds of people enjoying the evening lights in Times Square in New York. A taxi zips by in the foreground leading the eye to the sidewalk and the glowing billboards above.

fields.title: Turquoise River
fields.description: An expressionist rendering of a mountain road. James painted the scene using color as a way to move through the picture. In the foreground, abstracted figures admire the view across the river of turquoise. Brighter colors give way to subtler tones in the distance.

fields.title: Another Day II
fields.description: Artist Sharon Sieben describes this expressionist portrait as a moment at the end of the day. "Everything that needed doing is done," says Sharon. The woman rests, tired from her work, and ready to reflect on her day.

fields.title: A Warm Interior
fields.description: A warm and vibrant display of orange and yellow flowers in vases, with fruits, cutlery, and wine by artist James Hartman. A painting hangs against the red wall while a view of another room peeks from the left. Part of James'' series of interiors using collage, beeswax, and oil paints. "My process is by experiment since the ancient art of encaustics was once lost," shares James. He fuses the pigment into beeswax giving them permanence, preserving the vibrant colors. "I like to begin the process by collaging antique or vintage papers to the wood panel. Bits of this imagery peeks through where designated and are little windows in time."

fields.title: Intimate Impasse
fields.description: This is a figurative expressive painting of two people intensely connected. It is on paper that is mounted to a wooden cradle.

fields.title: Five O'Clock Somewhere
fields.description: Artist Robert Hofherr paints a stylized rendition of a crowded pub. He uses line, color, and painterly strokes to create a unique visual. The limited palette makes a distinctive "color world" along with the integral negative white spaces. The composition operates on multiple levels – expressionism and an abstract color study.

fields.title: Woodlands
fields.description: Dense foliage encloses the verdant woodland in artist Robert Hofherr''s expressionist piece. He displays the forest in early autumn with a limited color palette of yellow, blue, and green. Robert goes against the typical representation of the season in red and yellow. Presenting a fresh twist to the seasonal work, repeated linear elements render the structures of nature.

fields.title: View of the Bay
fields.description: Artist Robert Hofherr presents a Fauvist-inspired piece of a stand of trees on a sunny shoreline. He interprets the foliage as large, wavy strokes of bold color. The intense blues, yellows, and reds in the foreground supercharge the entire color palette. The negative spaces enter the work in several areas and become part of the overall composition.

fields.title: Farm in January
fields.description: A traditional farmstead basks in the bright winter day in artist Robert Hofherr''s expressionist piece. He emphasizes painterly strokes and bold hues, drawing inspiration from modern Fauvism. The blue sky reflects the snowy ground, creating a confident image full of power. The muted use of reds, browns, and gold keeps the cool colors from overwhelming the composition.

fields.title: Midday Sun
fields.description: Artist Robert Hofherr paints an upbeat expressionist rendition of a home in the southwest. The geometric architecture benefits from supercharged color and bold graphic style. Various shapes of mostly flat colors interact with each other and the white background. "The limited, primary color palette creates a unique ''color world'' for the painting," says Robert

fields.title: The Art Sellers
fields.description: Artist Robert Hofherr renders an energetic minimalist scene of art sellers and their wares in a busy bazaar. The piece is the result of a complete reimagining of the setting. Robert allows the suggestion of the complexity of objects and textures as strokes of color. The very basic palette of three primary colors aids in reinforcing the graphic appeal of the work.

fields.title: Moonbeams
fields.description: Bold contrasts constitute artist Robert Hofherr''s stylized, graphic rendition of a house. The expressionist composition glows in the bright moonlight. "The white background is used to full effect," says Robert. "The home''s front walls are merely extensions of that same white background." The highlighted shadows on the lawn draw immediate attention to the front of the building.

fields.title: October 31
fields.description: Artist Keith Thomson captures a crowd of people in a packed subway car. The woman in the center nonchalantly stands out with her conspicuous witch''s hat. "All due respect to water lilies, but people are the impressionist''s most compelling subject," says Keith. He tells an entire story with a few brush strokes and splashes of color.

fields.title: Modern Love
fields.description: Artist Keith Thomson presents an impressionistic rendition of a young woman and a robot of indeterminate age. The pair enjoy a long walk on a beach at sundown. The vivid red hues set the tone of a romance out of the ordinary. "Modern Love poses the question - why not?" says Keith.

fields.title: Prime Beachfront Property
fields.description: Artist John Jaster presents a lifeguard tower in Miami Beach with an impressionist approach. The bright colors and unique design reflect the bustling and eclectic vibe of South Beach. The building, depicted in vivid red, blue, yellow, and turquoise, stands at the ocean''s edge with flags flying. A beach buggy parks by the side, ready for action.

fields.title: The Palm
fields.description: Artist George Peebles presents a beautiful palm tree overlooking warm waters. The leaves mesmerizingly sway along the gentle gusts of wind. The tropical setting, reminiscent of a relaxing vacation, expresses quiet and tranquility. The bold colors capture the essence of an enjoyable summer day.

fields.title: Palms
fields.description: Artist George Peebles displays beautiful palms in a quiet place along the beach. He paints with an impressionistic approach, carefully portraying light and its changing qualities on air, sea, and land. The bold colors of the deep ocean meeting the clear sky create a stunning divergence of blue shades. George paints the piece by the shore on a delightful day.

fields.title: Cygnets in Blue and White
fields.description: Artist Onelio Marrero depicts the backstage of a ballet recital - a familiar scene in which he has assisted. The painting captures one of those moments of preparation before a dance from Swan Lake. He arranges the setting to take the viewer from the partial figures in the immediate foreground to the other figures and backdrop. The young dancers prepare for an adaptation of the Dance of the Cygnets. The subtleties of color and textures of the tutus and the exciting brushwork keep the viewer engaged.

fields.title: The Palm Trees
fields.description: Artist George Peebles exhibits palm trees overlooking the Caribbean. He captures the relaxed scene with an impressionist approach. Fresh blue waters drift to the shore rhythmically as light glistens on the waves. "This piece will brighten up any space," says George.

fields.title: All You Need Is a Puddle
fields.description: "When you are a child, sometimes all you need is a puddle," says artist Onelio Marrero. He paints two young kids joyfully playing in a puddle after a day of being confined indoors due to the rain. He captures the fun and excitement of splashing around. The little girl frolics in full motion while her brother stares transfixed at his reflection.

fields.title: The Sleepover
fields.description: Artist Onelio Marrero displays the magic of three preteen young girls gathered around a flashlight during a recent sleepover. He captures the endearing moment at his oldest granddaughter''s home. The heavy shadows and exciting strokes create a dramatic illumination. "The lighting and spontaneous brushwork are reminiscent of the styles of Sargent and Sorolla," says Onelio.

fields.title: Cyan Dusk
fields.description: In the style of impressionism, artist Sheila Finch displays a stunning view of the heavenly sky. A fabulous array of vivid colors gleams during dusk. Living on her sailboat on the coast, Sheila finds each evening''s light show to be a compelling catalyst for creating pieces of the vast, peaceful, uplifting scenes surrounding her. She draws inspiration from the awe-inspiring sunset she witnessed on an uplifting March evening.

fields.title: Blue World
fields.description: Artist Sheila Finch presents an ethereal seascape with soft tonal hues. She takes inspiration from the Pacific Ocean sky, witnessing it along a walking path in the coastal bluffs. Layers of clouds emerge during the golden hour as the sun declines. The composition evokes an uplifting feeling of peacefulness.

fields.title: Coastal Elder at Cayucos
fields.description: Artist Elizabeth Garat paints an inspiring view of the California coast. She references the piece on scenes from an expedition to the beautiful coastal town of Cayucos, California. The stately tree stands alone in the surrounding field, capturing the viewer''s attention. Elizabeth fully offers the tranquility of the quiet view.

fields.title: Red Barn Off Grand Avenue
fields.description: Artist Elizabeth Garat shares a glimpse of a pastoral landscape with an impressionistic approach. "This iconic red barn off of Grand Avenue in the east end of Ojai, California is a favorite scene for me," shares Elizabeth. She beautifully captures the warm sunny day when the golden grasses glow. The invisible wax coat gives the piece a polished finish and extra protection.

fields.title: Still Dreaming
fields.description: Many of artist Nava Lundy''s visionary ideas come to her in her dreams. "One night in my half-awake state, the image of this butterfly came to, lingered, and demanded to be painted," shares Nava. She reveals the insect with its colorful wings in divergent patterns. Nava associates butterflies with loved ones we have lost who are returning to visit. "So when a butterfly needs to be painted, I listen."

fields.title: After the Rain (Piazza Navona)
fields.description: Artist Faye Vander Veer depicts an afternoon in Piazza, Navona, after a gentle rain. She balances the composition, drawing the viewer in as they move among the people, stopping at one of the cafes bordering the Piazza for a glass of wine. Faye uses loose brushwork and layers of various colors, scraping them down to create a harmonious effect. It evokes a feeling of calm and contemplation.

fields.title: N Train Ninja
fields.description: Artist Keith Thomson depicts a lone man, sitting with his legs crossed as he rides the metro. The composition may depict Hensojutsu, a ninja martial artist whose skills involve disguise, concealment, and infiltration for the purposes of espionage and assassination. Alternatively, he may just be a guy whose clothes happen to match the seats. Keith loves painting subways and how it offers so much of the New York experience at once.

fields.title: Rows of Lavender, Peach Light Above the Hills
fields.description: Artist Elizabeth Garat presents an impressionist landscape of lavender fields. The piece recalls a warm day in July during the height of summer. Billowy clouds in pink and blue hues stretch the horizon in a beautiful display of reflected sunlight. She paints on location in the countryside of Provence, France.

fields.title: Costal Impressions - The Lone Cypress
fields.description: In his signature style, artist John Jaster paints this famous tree in Pebble Beach, California. Overlooking Carmel Bay, The Lone Cypress grows into a Western icon as one of the most photographed trees in North America. The bold contrast of the colors results in a lively natural landscape by the beautiful ocean. "The Cypress sprung from a seedling on that rocky outcropping before the birth of our nation, some 250 years ago," shares John.

fields.title: The Blue Swallow
fields.description: Artist John Jaste paints the Blue Swallow Motel—an icon of Route 66 folklore that opened in 1942. Listed in the National Register of Historic Places in 1993, the motel continues to operate as a popular overnight destination. "It is shown here as it stood in the early 50s, with the sky blue swallow sign, orange building, and complement of vintage cars in the parking lot," says John.

fields.title: Winging It
fields.description: Artist Jeff Fleming presents an impressionist portrait of seagulls flying through the coast. "Summer may be over, but ocean waves still greet the shore, and birds continue to soar with sunlight on their wings," says Jeff. The morning harbor walkabout brings a cheerful smile when the seabirds glide across the water. Jeff applies paint with his fingers, brushes, and string, then drizzles it in random strokes to create dynamic energy.

fields.title: Mt. Diablo Spring View
fields.description: Well known for her landscapes, artist Catherine McCargar presents a view of Mt. Diablo and its surrounding foothills. The grand and proud mountain looks onto the verdant slopes and lush trees. The complementary and vibrant colors convey the vitality of spring, washing over the scene. Catherine entices the viewer to consider the scenery bursting forth with new life after a cold winter.

fields.title: Diversity is a Beautiful Thing
fields.description:
Artist Jeff Fleming presents a colorful array of butterflies with beautifully patterned wings. He quotes Maya Angelou as inspiration for the piece:

“In diversity there is beauty and there is strength.”

Diversity creates an ecosystem that fosters creativity and helps bring together different perspectives, ideas, and voices. This painting celebrates individuality with color and energy.

fields.title: Turning of the Tide
fields.description: Artist Lisa Elley presents a textured impressionist seascape of the Monterey coast. She captures the elegance of the seaside town of Pacific Grove in California. The atmospheric skies give way to luscious foliage and vibrant reflections painted entirely with a palette knife. The thick impasto beautifully captures movement and gives the piece a serene glow.

fields.title: Misty Stream in Yellowstone Park
fields.description: Artist Jonelle Summerfield paints a vibrant view of Yellowstone Park. The evergreen landscape thrives beautifully with lush foliage, a tantalizing river, and clear blue skies. "My goal was to visit the Grand Prismatic Springs, but the misty stream near the entrance caught my eye," shares Jonelle. The thawed snow on the grassy hill that leads to the brook matches the small white waterfall spilling into the river.

fields.title: Misty Morning on the Farm
fields.description: Artist Catherine McCargar presents an old barn on top of a sloping road in rural California. As a plein air painter, she sometimes ventures out in less-than-ideal weather conditions. "The day was cold and foggy, but this made for beautiful, nuanced colors and muted tones delightfully rendered in watercolor," shares Catherine. She draws inspiration from the Swedish painter Carl Larsson, whose cold-weather exterior paintings embody a similar soft ambiance.

fields.title: Shoreline Trail
fields.description: Artist Catherine McCargar paints a rural setting in this impressionist piece. She uses her refined skills to convey a grass field''s softness and intricacies. Meanwhile, she leads the viewer along the walking path into the welcoming shadows and shelter of the copse of trees ahead. "One can almost feel the crunch underfoot," says Catherine.

fields.title: California Calm
fields.description: Artist Lisa Elley paints a sweeping view of an impressionist seascape in bright and summery colors. She paints this charming coastal piece en plein air at Davenport Beach in California. "The view through the wildflowers and over the bluffs to the Pacific Ocean never disappoints," says Lisa. Her version of a colorful and textured piece brings the beautiful scene to life.

fields.title: Emotion
fields.description: Artist Mary Pratt exhibits an impressionist portrait of a woman in white. She creates undulating shades of a snowy white milieu surrounding a figure with downcast eyes. A neutrally colored bird rests on the figure''s forearm, representing peace and harmony. "I intend to project a peaceful setting where emotion can be expressed safely without judgment," shares Mary.

fields.title: Lofty Perch
fields.description: Artist Mary Pratt paints a surreal expressionist habitat surrounding a brightly colored bird perched on a branch. She believes birds are earthly showstoppers and captures them as such. These animals enhance our lives by encouraging us to pause and observe. "Oh look, there goes a beautiful bird—I always stop to look," says Mary.

fields.title: Morning Field
fields.description: Artist Kip Decker paints colorful wildflowers abundantly growing by the ridge of a hill. He shows the flourishing landscape with an expressionist approach. Kip paints the lively piece in strikingly dramatic impasto—capturing the feeling of the abundance of spring.

fields.title: Battle of the Grapes
fields.description: Artist Lynne Tompkins Brice paints a peanut butter and jelly sandwich with grapes on the side. A glass of milk completes the composition. Her process involves taking photographs of curated cuisine arrangements and saving the food later as her next meal. She beautifully blends the colors as she considers the balance between light and shadow.

fields.title: Cookies & Milk
fields.description: Cookies and a glass of milk lay on a green plate in artist Lynne Tompkins Brice''s painting. A childhood treat that serves as comfort food for many an adult. Lynne evokes both memories as well as the idea of future snacks. She beautifully blends the colors as she considers the balance between light and shadow.

fields.title: Katowice. Poland
fields.description:
Artist Olena Drobysheva paints a glimpse of the beautiful city of Katowice, Poland. She presents the cityscape with expressive paintwork and, in contrast, precise lines and contours on the buildings. The city''s architecture combines futuristic and classical styles with seamless elegance. Olena aptly captures the charm and culture of the district.

Please note: this piece will ship from the artist''s studio in Poland and rolled in a tube.

fields.title: Creekside
fields.description: Artist Michael Orwick exhibits an impressionistic piece capturing a serene summer day in an idyllic forest setting. Warm hazy sunlight illuminates the vibrant colors of the foliage, while cool shadows settle in the far reaches of the canvas. A bubbling creek winds its way through the scene, providing a tranquil soundtrack to the ambiance of the woods. The dreamy, peaceful quality of the painting draws the viewer in and allows the mind to wander in this beautiful natural scene.

fields.title: Small Butte with Creosote
fields.description: A compelling western scene of the Muddy Mountains lays out in the beautiful geography of the Mojave. Artist Crystal DiPietro paints an impressionist rendering of the glorious sight in pastel shades and loose linework. The light washes of the watercolor flows, while the outlines accentuate the hard edges of the rock formations. The colorful butte and wispy creosote bushes flourish beautifully in the balmy desert near Las Vegas.

fields.title: Canyon Scenery
fields.description: Artist Tao Bai presents a gorgeous outlook from a canyon with an impressionist approach. A steady stream flows lazily like a blue ribbon falling from the sky, dividing through the gorge. The bright sunshine glows with warmth and liveliness on the entire scenery. Verdant shrubs burst from the ridges, creating balance within the color composition.

fields.title: Autumn Forest
fields.description: Artist Tao Bai reveals a path winding through thick woods. Their leaves spread above the trail, creating a canopy with bright colors. Walking into the autumn forest, the sun shines through the leaves, creating dappled shadows and magical light. With his painterly technique, Tao uses an array of bright hues, evoking energy and harmony.

fields.title: Big Sur Falls
fields.description: Artist Tao Bai shows a sweeping view of the Big Sur coast. He uses a stylized impression of form to render this striking seascape. Warm rays of the setting sun glow on the water and cliff face, creating gorgeous glimmers in the waves. Inspired by nature, Tao paints scenes that bring beauty and harmony.

fields.title: Empty Nester
fields.description: Artist Mary Pratt displays an aerial view of a potted plant in a beautiful abandoned nest. She paints in brisk impressionist strokes but orients the piece in a manner that develops the elements into abstraction. "I noticed the jewel tones during the magic hour when the sun is setting," shares Mary. She paints the nest glistening in certain parts with threads of gold leaf.

fields.title: A Square in Aix en Provence
fields.description: Artist Jonelle Summerfield unveils an iconic French cityscape in the style of impressionism. "The magical light of Provence has been inspirational for generations of artists," says Jonelle. The sun highlights the architecture and cafe awnings in just the right places. These, in turn, beautifully reflect on the walkways. The painting features gallery-wrapped edges in elegant raw umber.

fields.title: The Falls at Boonton
fields.description: Artist Onelio Marrero shares a view of the Rockaway River in Boonton, New Jersey, on a brilliant winter day. He features the first cascade, where the river narrows into a gorge along its meandering route through northern New Jersey. Onelio employs vigorous strokes and palette knife work to accentuate the character of the water as it tumbles down a series of rapids. The varied brushwork, glazes, and impasto effects combined with fascinating colors engage the viewer''s senses.

fields.title: Cold One
fields.description: Artist Keith Thomson illustrates an impressionist view of a winter evening in Tribeca. Amber lights glow in the background as people celebrate in the night. A street-corner snowman with a similar silhouette to the crowd faces the warm, cheery pub. "It''s left to the beholder to decide whether he wishes he could join the men inside for a cold one," says Keith.

fields.title: We Met Online
fields.description: Artist Keith Thomson presents an impressionistic rendering of a woman having wine with a dog. They share a moment in a quiet corner of a candlelit restaurant. A heart-to-heart talk between the two soulmates takes place. Keith creates a charming narrative depicting the playful subject matter in an unexpected setting.

fields.title: The Swim
fields.description: Artist George Peebles demonstrates a dreamy seascape that borders the realms of abstraction. A family of five swims on a foggy day at the beach. George depicts the figures at a far distance in gestural strokes with minimal representation. A fascinating narrative occurs within the tranquil flow of blue and white tones.

fields.title: Bistro du Midi
fields.description: In his distinct style of impressionism, artist Onelio Marrero displays a man in a suit reading the news as he sits by an empty dining hall. He bases the piece on sketches of a Back Bay, Boston restaurant named Bistro du Midi. He creates a narrative of an imaginary proprietor perusing a newspaper before the establishment opens and the clients fill the place. Onelio gives the viewer a sense of the décor and light streaming through the windows - beyond it, a hint of the Boston Public Garden.

fields.title: Stalling and Waiting
fields.description: The title of this painting expresses artist Onelio Marrero''s observations of people sitting alone in restaurants and cafes. In this case, a woman waits against the windows that flood the cafe with morning sunlight. Onelio intentionally includes various objects on the table that suggest she may be accompanied by an absent character or be alone ruminating. He works with a broad range of brushwork while simplifying unnecessary details.

fields.title: Entering the Swift Current
fields.description: Artist Onelio Marrero presents a view of a canoeist traversing the New Jersey river as storm clouds brew in the distance. The piece embodies the adventure of canoeing - the shift of currents from placid to swift as the stream narrows and becomes more shallow. Onelio employs a sky with dramatic clouds to echo the change in the river''s currents. The varied brushwork, glazes, and impasto effects engage the viewer''s tactile senses.

fields.title: House With Red Door
fields.description: Artist John Jaster paints a portrait of a two-story dwelling with a vivid red door. He paints the composition in bold applications of solid color with an impressionist approach. Verdant foliage flourishes in the backyard of the inviting home. The bright sun highlights the surrounding greenery and casts dappled shadows across the front of the lawn.

fields.title: Sunset on the River Trail
fields.description: Artist Onelio Marrero captures this scene of a sunset''s effects on a snow-covered trail near his home in northern New Jersey. The rich colors and textures of this painting, rendered in sensitive yet bold strokes, reflect the fleeting light filtering through the trees. Onelio works from a small oil study and paints the rest from memory.

fields.title: Between the Shadows
fields.description: Artist Onelio Marrero paints the sunset''s effects on a snow-covered trail near his home in northern New Jersey. He shows the scene based on an oil sketch and his memory. The rich colors and textures of this painting, rendered in sensitive yet bold strokes, reflect the waning light filtering through the trees. Onelio includes the figure of his wife and soulmate as she walks ahead through the quiet trail.

fields.title: Red Barn Reflections
fields.description: In artist John Jaster''s impressionist piece, a brilliant red barn stands in a lush wheat field. It dwarfs in comparison to the two towering trees neighboring it. The bright sunlight reflects the scene in a still pond skirted by wild grasses and reeds. Thin wispy clouds stream along the sky in the fair weather.

fields.title: Tangential Dreams
fields.description: Two young girls in red go daydreaming in artist Onelio Marrero''s heartwarming portrait. He features his two granddaughters curled up in deep slumber. The reds and star patterns of the cloth reflect a hint of their dreams. "Though they are cousins separated by seven years, they are soulmates that share every moment they spend together," shares Onelio. He captures the magical moment in vivid strokes and colors.

fields.title: A Good Book
fields.description:
Artist Keith Thomson presents a surreal narrative of a woman reading by the windowsill as King Kong appears in view. The piece celebrates the singular escapism a good book can provide. He quotes Nora Ephron sharing the same sentiment as his work:

"The state of rapture that occurs when I read a wonderful book is one of the main reasons I read, but it doesn’t happen every time or even every other time, and when it does, I’m truly beside myself with joy."

fields.title: Hockey Fan
fields.description: A panoramic view of the Swiss Alps stretches out in artist Keith Thomson''s impressionist work. He renders a cherry-red Zamboni smoothing the frozen surface of the icy pond. "The composition is either a work of surrealism or if you like to play hockey, a depiction of your dream," says Keith. The solid color blocking allows the different elements of the piece to pop.

fields.title: Sunset Tulips
fields.description: Artist Tao Bai shares a view of a sunset over a colorful tulip field. He paints with his signature impressionist style to render the spectacular scene. Under the setting sun, the various colors in the pasture intertwine. The sky appears radiant in shades of yellow, pink, and blue.

fields.title: Path in the Garden
fields.description: Artist Tao Bai presents a view of a lush garden in midsummer. The dense trees and bushes envelop the space in rich shades of green. Tao paints the sun shining on treetops, creating dappled light and shadow scattered throughout. A small path cuts through the foliage, an open invitation to step through and explore.

fields.title: Forest Abstractions - Chorus Line
fields.description: Artist John Jaster displays a forest with tall aspens rendered in a playfully abstract style. Bold shades of yellow, orange and red suggest a warm autumn day in the woods. In his process, John creates stunning color combinations by utilizing multiple layers of heavy body acrylics and brushwork. He results with captivating scenery with intense contrasting hues and high-spirited energy.

fields.title: Under the Table and Dreaming
fields.description: Artist Onelio Marrero features two of his granddaughters in this heartwarming painting. "When the family gets together at my house, my two oldest granddaughters love to spend time together playing make-believe under the improvised forts I help them assemble," says Onelio. The two girls spend much time daydreaming or pretending to nap. They always have Onelio bring a timer visible on the lower right, so they can set it to "wake them up." This piece intimately captures the innocence and limitless imagination of children at play.

fields.title: Ascending Clouds
fields.description: Artist Onelio Marrero features a sunny marshland on an early autumn morning. He executes the composition from sketches and memory based on a swamp near his home. The powerful strokes, colors, and textures capture the effects of the temperate season of fall. "The title summarizes the fleeting effects of the atmospheric clearing after a few days of rain," notes Onelio.

fields.title: End of an Era
fields.description: Artist Onelio Marrero depicts two men dining al fresco at an outdoor tavern in Manhattan. He paints the piece based on his studies of the Central Park Boathouse Restaurant, the only lakeside dining establishment in the city. The foliage in the outdoor bar area suggests that autumn is finally about to begin. Onelio captures the brilliant morning sunlight with a sensitive yet robust application of paint.

fields.title: Opposites
fields.description: "Opposites attract," says artist Terri Bell. A tight textual and linear border holds together a loosely arranged grid area. Terri creates minimalist geometric structures but adds compelling points of interest through the busy lines and curves in the center. The stark contrast builds an effective harmony between the eye-catching arrangement of patterns.

fields.title: U-14 Wavy Red
fields.description: Each of the figures has a particular movement that allows them to express different feelings. This piece is a ceramic sculpture that has been finished in a way to look like bronze. Each Small Being is individually hand-modeled with clay at a high temperature and painted in bronze. It is then placed on a solid wood panel, which has been coated and painted red. This piece comes ready to hang.

fields.title: U-13 The Choice
fields.description: Each of the figures has a particular movement that allows them to express different feelings. This piece is a ceramic sculpture that has been finished in a way to look like bronze. Each Small Being is individually hand-modeled with clay at a high temperature and painted in bronze. It is then placed on a solid wood panel, which has been painted. This piece comes ready to hang.

fields.title: U-Climbers on Red III
fields.description: My Small Beings are made of ceramic painted to looks like bronze. They are mounted on a solid wooden panel that is painted red. On the back there is a dentate hook for easy hanging. This piece was inspired by the idea of overcoming obstacles, breaking down barriers and succeeding.

fields.title: Pink Seasoning
fields.description:
In this modern minimalistic still life, artist Ziui Vance paints a group of gourds in yellow, red, and blue against a pink pastel tone. "The mysticism of the gourd is partially due to its shape causing many people to believe that they have the capability of enacting the power to save the world," says Ziui. "However, on break, these gourds appear to be frolicking in a corner unbeknownst to the attention they are causing." 

The work comes in a metal frame with tempered glass.

fields.title: Two Ladies
fields.description:
Two gourds in deep blue and golden yellow lean against a cool muted background. "The mysticism of the gourd is partially due to its shape causing many people to believe that they have the capability of enacting the power to save the world," says artist Ziui Vance. Above the gourds are two tiny ladybugs flitting about. "However, after a day of tussling against the more elaborate foes, these gourds find themselves on the precipice of a new adventure." 

The work comes in a metal frame with tempered glass.

fields.title: Come Together
fields.description: A flock of various birds shares a telephone wire as they watch the moon in this dreamy scene by artist Sally Adams. Soft puffs of clouds scatter in the blue sky while the moon shines its waxing crescent on the upper left of the composition. Sally quotes a line from The Beatles'' song, Come Together, "One thing I can tell you is you got to be free!"

fields.title: Surrender
fields.description: From artist Morgan Fite''s series Lessons from Winter, inspired by her process of discovering and embracing the beauty, mystery and warmth of the coldest and darkest season of the year. Morgan captures a dense storm in this minimal abstract painting, with subtle pinks and purples emerging from the layers of white snowfall.

fields.title: Transference
fields.description: With her minimalist conceptual approach, artist Shyun Song delicately joins a psychological occurrence with stunning visual imagery. "A mysterious phenomenon of telepathy is symbolized by the flow of wine," says Shyun.

fields.title: Voyage
fields.description: "A long sea journey is implied by the blowing masts in this piece," explains artist Shyun Song. "An indigo blue background signifies the spiritual course of the journey."

fields.title: Restraint
fields.description: Shyun explains of her clean, minimalist oil paintings, "As an intense observer, I am interested in mythology and psychology. Whenever I come across a concept that sums up an element of psychology, I start sketching. I use geometric shapes and lines which I have found versatile in illustrating abstract concepts. When I transfer the sketch to a canvas, I still improvise and make specific color choices until I feel satisfied. Since my paintings begin with intangible concepts, I take the title of each painting as seriously as the aesthetic value of the piece. I believe that titles which resonate with our universal experience in life can create a deep human connection between an artist and the viewer."

fields.title: The House of Gratitude
fields.description: Loosely configured letterforms in clockwise rotation spell out the response ''thank you,'' two words that are critically important. This work makes reference to architecture, to both a house plan and a facade, and to a building with an open casement. We can also see these letterforms as a flag over the building, over a ground, a square, or as objects like a jug, a vase, a flower, an incense cone, or packages.Part of David''s signature series of minimalist abstractions inspired by his long standing love of language and words. In each collage painting he methodically pieces together the composition, building a story through the suggestion of specific objects - such as bowls, tents and tools - and their relationship with one another. "What doesn''t come across in a piece is the time it takes, the journey made, the lengthy process of selection and the changes undergone," explains David. "Often I take away, remove sometimes more shapes, than are added."

fields.title: Weighs and Means
fields.description: The play on words in the title relates to the aspects of balance and weighing that are at the center of this work. Incised lines were cut through the central orange surface to reveal the prepared white gesso base underneath. To provide this structure, the lines were scratched along the edges of the connected rods that make up two ''stick chart'' frameworks.Part of David''s signature series of minimalist abstractions inspired by his long standing love of language and words. In each collage painting he methodically pieces together the composition, building a story through the suggestion of specific objects - such as bowls, tents and tools - and their relationship with one another. "What doesn''t come across in a piece is the time it takes, the journey made, the lengthy process of selection and the changes undergone," explains David. "Often I take away, remove sometimes more shapes, than are added."

fields.title: In the Stillness
fields.description: Brit describes this delicate abstraction as the place where land and sea meet in the stillness of winter. Rich purple mountains in the distance and reflected in the water give way to soft yellow and grey light in all directions. "The wisdom of the natural world tells us that a time of rest is important - wintertime is a season for reflection and renewal of energies before the new life of spring can emerge," says Brit. The highly textured surface and low relief effects are created by a combination of embossed papers and layering of acrylic paint.

fields.title: Essence
fields.description: "Since moving to the Bay Area, I have become fascinated by the complexity and beauty I see in fog," says artist Alicia Dunn. "Reproducing the colors found in nature is a challenge in itself, as is creating something minimalistic that exudes depth and soul." Part of Alicia''s signature series of Northern California landscapes and seascapes capturing the nuanced light and energy of the area.

fields.title: Banana & Blue Glaucus
fields.description:
"I placed two objects that can not be seen together in real life to present the imbalances and irregularities in our world," states artist Heejin Sutton. "Hate and love, good and evil, joy and sorrow. However, in my painting, the imbalance is hidden. Instead, tranquility, peace, and happiness stand out. I want to show the happiness and peace we continually pursue and long for, even in the middle of this imperfect world."

Heejin layers Korean mulberry paper on a wooden panel with homemade flour glue. She then applies a glue base on which she draws her sketch and traces it on paper. Afterward, Heejin paints three or four layers of background color using gouache. Lastly, she adds the subject in fine detail. "The background color can be uneven. This is what this special paper is meant to be."

fields.title: Resolution
fields.description: A kite-shaped chalk drawing, which as David explains, "is like some form of algebraic diagram, an equation with a float of letterforms that monitor change and movement. It all balanced and clicked together in the making in a very fresh and surprising way. I was thrilled. And that''s why I settled on this title."Part of David''s signature series of minimalist abstractions inspired by his long standing love of language and words. In each collage painting he methodically pieces together the composition, building a story through the suggestion of specific objects - such as bowls, tents and tools - and their relationship with one another. "What doesn''t come across in a piece is the time it takes, the journey made, the lengthy process of selection and the changes undergone," explains David. "Often I take away, remove sometimes more shapes, than are added."

fields.title: In the Stillness
fields.description: Morgan creates ethereal atmospheres using feathery brushstrokes and subtle contrasts. Her muted, tonal palette allows the texture and layering to take centerstage. Morgan says her artwork reflects her calm and peaceful personality. "To me, this piece feels like an early November morning," she says.

fields.title: Phenomenon - Remnant
fields.description: A phenomenon is an object of a person''s perception; the mind or senses take notice. it is merely an experience. Beauty mysteriously enables us to engage in phenomena naturally, yet, such a natural state throws us into existential conundrums. These works are objects of phenomena. An experience that is of delight and stillness, but are uncertain, wrestling, and sometimes convicting. This painting is on a gallery wrapped canvas with finished edges. It comes ready to hang.

fields.title: Settling In
fields.description: Artist Morgan Fite paints with neutral tones, letting movement, texture and subtle contrasts tell the story and capture moments in time. "I painted this piece on our first snow day of the year this past winter," she says. "I was inspired by the overwhelming sense of peace and silence that comes with the first snowfall and from watching the fog settle in."

fields.title: Baseball Horizon
fields.description: A macro hyperrealistic rendition of a baseball by artist Stephen Capogna. "The painting depicts an ultra-close detail of a baseball with a space-like horizon in the background," states Stephen. Painting with a methodical process Stephen utilizes an airbrush and thousands of templates. The result is a highly detailed compelling image.

fields.title: Meerkat & Coral Reef
fields.description: This piece is made by layering Korean mulberry paper on a wooden panel with homemade flour glue. Then I apply a glue base. Next, I draw my sketch, and trace it on the paper. Then I paint three or four layers of a background color using pigments and glue base. Lastly, I paint the subject in fine detail, which takes most of time. The painting is on a cradled wood panel with finished edges.I placed two objects that can not be seen together in real life to present the imbalances and irregularities in our world. Hate and love, good and evil, joy and sorrow. However, in my painting, the imbalance is hidden. Instead tranquility, peace, and happiness standout. I want to show the happiness and peace we continually pursue and long for, even in the middle of this imperfect world.

fields.title: Fox & Coral-Reef
fields.description: Artist Heejin Sutton portrays a small white fox sitting on top of a geometric plane with purple corals growing at the bottom. "I placed two objects that can not be seen together in real life to present the imbalances and irregularities in our world," explains Heejin. "Hate and love, good and evil, joy and sorrow. However, in my painting, the imbalance is hidden. Instead, tranquility, peace, and happiness stand out. I want to show the happiness and peace we continually pursue and long for, even in the middle of this imperfect world."

fields.title: Gratification
fields.description: Shyun explains of her clean, minimalist oil paintings, "As an intense observer, I am interested in mythology and psychology. Whenever I come across a concept that sums up an element of psychology, I start sketching. I use geometric shapes and lines which I have found versatile in illustrating abstract concepts. When I transfer the sketch to a canvas, I still improvise and make specific color choices until I feel satisfied. Since my paintings begin with intangible concepts, I take the title of each painting as seriously as the aesthetic value of the piece. I believe that titles which resonate with our universal experience in life can create a deep human connection between an artist and the viewer."

fields.title: Resistance
fields.description: Artist Shyun Song explains of her clean, minimalist oil paintings, "As an intense observer, I am interested in mythology and psychology. fields.title: Loneliness-Aloneness
fields.description: "This diptych illustrates two sides of being alone," explains artist Shyun Song. "Loneliness is depicted as a downcast state when we miss other people, while aloneness is captured as an uplifting state when we enjoy being ourselves and expanding our souls."

fields.title: Metamorphosis I
fields.description: This piece is one of two images of "Metamorphosis". This one is the metamorphosis of a bud into a flower. The second painting, "Metamorphosis II," is the metamorphosis of a caterpillar into a butterfly.

fields.title: Metamorphosis II
fields.description: This piece is one of two images of "Metamorphosis". This one is the metamorphosis of a caterpillar into a butterfly. The second painting, "Metamorphosis I," is the metamorphosis of a bud into a flower.

fields.title: Interruption
fields.description: This painting is on gallery wrapped canvas with white edges. It comes ready to hang.

fields.title: Tune
fields.description: No description

fields.title: Adaptation II
fields.description: I wanted to express our adaptable existence by juxtaposing two different colored shapes.

fields.title: Adaptation I
fields.description: I wanted to express our adaptable existence by juxtaposing two different colored shapes.

fields.title: Whim
fields.description: No description

fields.title: Detachment
fields.description:
"Emotional freedom is portrayed by the parallel placement of the red and blue shapes together with the space between them," states artist Shyun Song. "The yellow background signifies the emotional field around them."

Shyun explains of her clean, minimalist abstracts, "As an intense observer, I am interested in mythology and psychology. Whenever I come across a concept that sums up an element of psychology, I start sketching. I use geometric shapes and lines which I have found versatile in illustrating abstract concepts. When I transfer the sketch to a canvas, I still improvise and make specific color choices until I feel satisfied. Since my paintings begin with intangible concepts, I take the title of each painting as seriously as the aesthetic value of the piece. I believe that titles which resonate with our universal experience in life can create a deep human connection between an artist and the viewer."

fields.title: Attachment
fields.description: "Red and blue shapes which are overlapped in the piece imply emotional dependency," explains artist Shyun Song. "The yellow background signifies the emotional field around them. As an intense observer, I am interested in mythology and psychology. Whenever I come across a concept that sums up an element of psychology, I start sketching. I use geometric shapes and lines which I have found versatile in illustrating abstract concepts. fields.title: Chasm
fields.description: "This painting captures a notion that reality consists of two opposing states," explains artist Shyun Song. "The dark line between the warm and cool colors stands for the unfathomable cleft which divides the two."

fields.title: Discourse
fields.description: "This piece illustrates an inner dialogue which we frequently go through by exchanging and interchanging our thoughts, ideas, knowledge, and views," explains artist Shyun Song. With her clean, minimalist oil paintings, Shyun reveals artistic visual imagery inspired by elements of psychology.

fields.title: Epiphany
fields.description: Artist Shyun Song explains of her clean, minimalist oil paintings, "As an intense observer, I am interested in mythology and psychology. Whenever I come across a concept that sums up an element of psychology, I start sketching. I use geometric shapes and lines which I have found versatile in illustrating abstract concepts. When I transfer the sketch to a canvas, I still improvise and make specific color choices until I feel satisfied. Since my paintings begin with intangible concepts, I take the title of each painting as seriously as the aesthetic value of the piece. I believe that titles which resonate with our universal experience in life can create a deep human connection between an artist and the viewer."

fields.title: Anima
fields.description: "This piece captures the inner feminine side of a man which instinctively releases nurturing energies," states artist Shyun Song. "The blue on blue rectangle stands for the man''s rational persona and the orange one signifies his loving soul."

fields.title: Vanity
fields.description: "The futility of greed, fame, and power is expressed by the falling fragments of primary colors," states artist Shyun Song. Irregular geometric shapes tumble down in a succession of blue to yellow to red. A solid block of each color grounds the composition to the pristine white background.

fields.title: Ephemera
fields.description: "This colorful springtime painting exudes hope all around," says artist Shyun Song. "It also reminds me that everything changes sooner or later." Inspired by the season of renewal, Shyun developed this minimalist abstract with the bright, vibrant colors of spring.

fields.title: Clarity
fields.description: The two primary colors, red and yellow, symbolize a raw state of mind which allows me to see things as they are.

fields.title: Duet
fields.description: The dynamic duet of yin and yang makes everything happen. The white space represents all kinds of possibilities.

fields.title: Boundary
fields.description: "I used firm and thick closed lines to symbolize the boundaries that people set in order to curb their indulgent tendencies," says artist Shyun Song. A box within a box rendered in deep blue draws the eyes diagonally downward. The pristine teal background exemplifies a flawless symmetry.

fields.title: Monologue
fields.description: This painting is on gallery wrapped canvas with white edges. It comes ready to hang.

fields.title: Dialogue
fields.description: This painting is on gallery wrapped canvas with white edges. It comes ready to hang.

fields.title: Forgiveness
fields.description: This painting is on gallery wrapped canvas with white edges. It comes ready to hang.

fields.title: Regret
fields.description: This painting is on gallery wrapped canvas with white edges. It comes ready to hang.

fields.title: Harmony
fields.description: "This piece is inspired by a musical keyboard representing harmony," explains artist Shyun Song. A delicate seam between sound and visual imagery, Shyun picks off the clean lines of the ivories and infuses her own melody into this minimalist abstraction. "My choice of bright colors heightens its positive mood."

fields.title: U-14 Wavy Red
fields.description: Each of the figures has a particular movement that allows them to express different feelings. This piece is a ceramic sculpture that has been finished in a way to look like bronze. Each Small Being is individually hand-modeled with clay at a high temperature and painted in bronze. It is then placed on a solid wood panel, which has been coated and painted red. This piece comes ready to hang.

fields.title: U-13 The Choice
fields.description: Each of the figures has a particular movement that allows them to express different feelings. This piece is a ceramic sculpture that has been finished in a way to look like bronze. Each Small Being is individually hand-modeled with clay at a high temperature and painted in bronze. It is then placed on a solid wood panel, which has been painted. This piece comes ready to hang.

fields.title: Out of the Wall
fields.description: In skilled realism, artist Guigen Zha displays a plum branch blooming out of a pale blue wall. The curvature of the tree contrasts strongly with the rigidity of the geometric structure. The interpolation represents the traditional aesthetics of the East in the background of the architecture of the West. Guigen creates a coexistence between the strong contrast in visual aesthetics.

fields.title: Window44
fields.description: "I hope to use shapes and colors to create a sensory resonance, which can go beyond words and language," reveals artist Wenjie Jin. Her unique perspective from a glass window develops into a graceful arrangement. She paints an organic connection between art and philosophy through a minimalist approach. "The viewer can quietly experience and feel what the composition tries to evoke and realize that these colors and structures bring us a special feeling."

fields.title: Window35
fields.description: Artist Wenjie Jin creates zones of color in a minimalist window arrangement. "You may encounter heart-touching moments, including beautiful distant poetry, colorful, surreal dreams, exquisitely carved shapes, a ray of afternoon sunlight, and perfect shadow," details Wenjie. The combination of the structures and space allows the viewer to immerse themselves in the work. She intends her art to freely embrace the audience.

fields.title: Gathered
fields.description: A contemporary scene by artist Robin Okun of tall willowy figures represented in blocks of color, stand amidst a simplified landscape. "The limited palette of red, blue, and green is highlighted with metallic silver to create the shimmery gradations of color throughout the piece."

fields.title: Memory’s Echo
fields.description: "Nature is an endless combination and repetition of very few laws. She hums the old well-known air through innumerable variations," artist Nava Lundy quotes Ralph Waldo Emerson. Inspired by this sentiment, Nava incorporates delicate iterations of a butterfly throughout the canvas. Touches of gold leaf, glitter, and pearlescent hues make this painting a sensory experience.

fields.title: Peaceful Day
fields.description: "The lines are smooth and inviting. They are delicate yet established," says artist Voskan Galstian. "The peaceful effects are created by this play of lines while the colors give off a joyful vibe. The movement shows a dynamic interplay that exists between both."

fields.title: Coastal Impressions - The Cove
fields.description: "Monterey Bay is one of many iconic spots in California where the Pacific Ocean meets the majestic cliffs," shares artist John Jaster. "It is a wildly beautiful inlet along the rugged Central Coast and the pinnacle of nature''s handiwork. This minimalist view of the extraordinary scenery captures the boldness of this natural wonder." John uses heavy body acrylics with multiple layers to achieve bold and rich colors.

fields.title: Mountain Colors
fields.description: Standing at the top of a small winding road in Northern California, artist James Hartman worked to capture the quiet autumn light falling across the landscape. He painted the piece in a palette of secondary colors to draw out the cool purple shadows against the warm mountain fields. "I developed quite a bit of texture on this one," says James.

fields.title: Small Beings on Window with Gold Curtain
fields.description: "When confinement is a life-or-death necessity, a window becomes your best friend, it gives you hope, strength, and freedom," says artist Yelitza Diaz. "Loneliness can be hard, but by clinging to your window, it strengthens you, and helps you go beyond your limits overcoming all obstacles with success and pleasure. This work represents the being that is creative without limits." The drapes flow swept by the wind, as the beings look far into the distance. The Small Beings and drapes in this piece are made of resin and painted to look like bronze.

fields.title: Two Step Dance
fields.description: "This piece depicts a couple dancing with alternating pinwheeling arms," states artist Diana Elena Chelaru. The dancers sway their bodies to music expressed in the graceful flow of abstract geometric shapes. This painting is part of Diana''s new series of mini works.

fields.title: Evening in a Bar
fields.description: This is another work where my focus is on an ordinary subject matter depicted with strong color and sparkling light effects.

fields.title: Sound of Silence
fields.description: A young woman rests in the woods, her dress merging with the wildflowers and growth around her. She looks ahead pensively. Diana says she imagined this young girl absorbed in a floral and mystical world.

fields.title: Groove 35
fields.description: An intricate modern abstract painting in coordinated bands of color and texture, balancing intuition and planning. Part of artist Gary J. Noland Jr.''s new series composed of many layers of acrylic paint that have been smeared, scraped, scratched and sanded to reveal a variety of colors and images. "The surface provides a harmonious balance, which references the struggle between chaos and order and hard-edged borders versus organic non-defined forms of expression, reflective of today''s society," explains Gary. "The "Groove" is the way we must continue to move on regardless of life''s distractions."

fields.title: Groove 30
fields.description: An intricate modern abstract painting in coordinated bands of color and texture, balancing intuition and planning. Part of artist Gary J. Noland Jr.''s new series composed of many layers of acrylic paint that have been smeared, scraped, scratched and sanded to reveal a variety of colors and images. "The surface provides a harmonious balance, which references the struggle between chaos and order and hard-edged borders versus organic non-defined forms of expression, reflective of today''s society," explains Gary. "The "Groove" is the way we must continue to move on regardless of life''s distractions."

fields.title: The Hidden Gem
fields.description: Artist Nava Lundy presents a floral portrait of a rose on a checkered background. "Watch as this painting transforms throughout the day," says Nava. This hidden gem glistens and glows as the light and temperature change. The softness of the delicately placed flower complements the precision of the geometric shapes of the golden circle and the movement of the checkered pattern.

fields.title: Flirting with Possibilities
fields.description: Artist Robin Okun depicts a gathering of five tall figures against a backdrop of vibrant blue. The strong geometric abstract designs in variations of blues uniquely contrast with the softer floral-like figures that pop with pink and gold. "I noticed the symmetrical gold in the red figures leading me to the title," shares Robin. She applies direct observations from her personal and work life as a compelling aspect of her creative process.

fields.title: Farmhouse Under a Sunset Sky
fields.description: Artist Sharon France exhibits a modern image of a rustic old farmhouse, an old barn, and a shed. She paints the dreamy display from free imagination.
