The golden gradient fully captures the warmth of the whimsical evening sky. An easygoing and mellow scene of the countryside beautifully unfolds with subtlety and charm.

fields.title: Flower and Bird II
fields.description: Inspired by traditional Eastern paintings and minimalist photography, artist Guigen Zha paints a modern natural landscape. A red parrot perches on blooming flower branches within an architectural setting. He marries two different styles of schemas with visual conflicts yet achieves perceptual harmony. Guigen correlates the clashing contents of the images effortlessly.

fields.title: Flower and Bird I
fields.description: Artist Guigen Zha displays an engaging postmodern scene of nature. Flourishing exotic flowers give shade to two ducks sprawling by the water''s edge. In the background, bold geometric architecture stands like monoliths at the water''s edge. Guigen weaves traditional aesthetics into a contemporary context.

fields.title: In the Quiet of the Mist
fields.description: Inspired by the old white farmhouses in the countryside, artist Sharon France captures a misty day in rich verdant hues. In this overcast scene, a lone house warms itself with a fire roaring in its fireplace while the sky grows heavy with rain. "I get a sense of quiet peace from this landscape and hope you may find it also."

fields.title: Diving In - Amber Rush
fields.description: Part of a series of modern abstract paintings exploring the captivating power of color and its modulations. "Playing with an extended notion of gradient, the subtle – yet not invisible – transition between hues is accentuated by soft textures obtained through an additive/subtractive technique with watery pigments," explains artist Marie-Eve Champagne. "Although very formal in approach, this series is also about tenderness and carefulness, shown here through soft ensembles with elusive color variations."

fields.title: Fragmentation - Breaking Point
fields.description: A free-flowing abstract expressionist work in inviting yellow, purple, and pink outlined in defining black. "This series plays with notions of deconstruction and movement," says artist Marie-Eve Champagne. "Can something broken remain whole?" Lines connect, disconnect, and reconnect over the multilayered surface, intertwining strokes through a dynamic rhythm of hues. "Each application of color is independent and unique, but once juxtaposed to the next its effects are transformed. Each fragment of color appears to be almost floating on the surface, moved by an unknown current, ready to be reconstructed or deconstructed anew."

fields.title: Grid Light
fields.description: Part of artist Terri Bell''s Geometria Grid series. This piece incorporates various blocks of subtle colors and textures into a cohesive and engineered partition pattern. "Each segment of this piece is unique and unified by a light palette," says Terri. "It has a fresh and light architectural feeling."

fields.title: Between Us
fields.description: "This piece is all about summer, all-year-round," says artist Marie-Eve Champagne. "Palm trees, beaches, green grass, evening walks, bike rides by the sea, fedoras, and all of that. Recollections of past summers, of childhood vacations, of cherished escapes. Greens, yellows, and blues. And peaches, purples, oranges." Part of Marie-Eve''s series exploring coastal life and the warmth of weather, venue, and feeling.

fields.title: All the People at This Party
fields.description: "This piece is named in homage to the Joni Mitchell song People''s Parties," explains artist Terri Bell. "In abstract terms, each square has its own characteristics and personality, rather like people behave while in unfamiliar groups - trying to stand out or fit in."

fields.title: Piazza Cafe
fields.description: The magic and mystery of the piazza and town hall after dark. The old town with its elegant buildings glows under the moon and stars. The cloak of darkness adds an extra dose of mystery and charm.

fields.title: Empty Shell to Past
fields.description: The empty shell of the historical St. Agnes hospital looks so grand and monumental under the sunlight in its quiet and peaceful surroundings. I especially like how the light interacts with each window; one can almost see its struggles and past.

fields.title: City of Prague
fields.description: The city of Prague is quaint and vibrant. There are so many little pockets of beautifully juxtaposed buildings.

fields.title: Pink Seasoning
fields.description:
In this modern minimalistic still life, artist Ziui Vance paints a group of gourds in yellow, red, and blue against a pink pastel tone. "The mysticism of the gourd is partially due to its shape causing many people to believe that they have the capability of enacting the power to save the world," says Ziui. "However, on break, these gourds appear to be frolicking in a corner unbeknownst to the attention they are causing." 

The work comes in a metal frame with tempered glass.

fields.title: Two Ladies
fields.description:
Two gourds in deep blue and golden yellow lean against a cool muted background. "The mysticism of the gourd is partially due to its shape causing many people to believe that they have the capability of enacting the power to save the world," says artist Ziui Vance. Above the gourds are two tiny ladybugs flitting about. "However, after a day of tussling against the more elaborate foes, these gourds find themselves on the precipice of a new adventure." 

The work comes in a metal frame with tempered glass.

fields.title: Three Gourds
fields.description:
"The mysticism of the gourd is partially due to its shape causing many people to believe that they have the capability of enacting the power to save the world," says artist Ziui Vance. "However, on break, these gourdes appear tired from the day''s labor of saving the children of the world."

The artwork is in a metal frame with tempered glass.

fields.title: Tribute to Mondrian, Red Diamond (U-14)
fields.description: This artwork is a humble tribute to Piet Mondrian. The wooden square mount is 18” x 21” x 4” covered and painted white. Small ceramic beings sit on the mount. They are painted to look like bronze.

fields.title: Tribute to Mondrian, Three Colors (U-15)
fields.description: This artwork is a humble tribute to Piet Mondrian. The wooden square mount is 18” x 21” x 4” covered and painted white. Small ceramic beings sit on the mount. They are painted to look like bronze.

fields.title: Red & White Climbers
fields.description: Artist Yelitza Diaz exhibits nude figures climbing minimalist geometric structures. She seeks to question the basic idea of minimalism by adding the human form to the composition. An experimental concept representing man''s journey of spirituality and elevation of being. The piece elicits the viewer to find meaning from their own experiences.

fields.title: Small Beings on Window with Silver Curtain
fields.description: "When confinement is a life-or-death necessity, a window becomes your best friend - it gives you hope, strength, and freedom," says artist Yelitza Diaz. "Loneliness can be hard, but by clinging to your window, it strengthens you, and helps you go beyond your limits, overcoming all obstacles with success and pleasure. This work represents the being that is creative without limits." The Small Beings and drapes in this piece are made of resin and painted to look like bronze. They are placed on a solid wood frame, which has been painted.

fields.title: Tribute to Mondrian, Four Colors (U-16)
fields.description: This artwork is a humble tribute to Piet Mondrian. The wooden square mount is 18” x 21” x 4” covered and painted white. Small ceramic beings sit on the mount. They are painted to look like bronze.

fields.title: Red & Bronze Small Beings
fields.description: Artist Yelitza Diaz exhibits nude figures climbing minimalist geometric structures. She seeks to question the basic idea of minimalism by adding the human form to the composition. Yelitza experiments with the concept of representing man''s journey of spirituality and elevation of being. The piece elicits the viewer to find meaning from their own experiences.

fields.title: Fan Dancer
fields.description: "As I did some research on different types of dances around the world, I got to discover more about fan dancers," shares artist Diana Elena Chelaru. Depicted in this modernist rendition is a figure holding a fan in one hand, gracefully moving about as if floating in the water. "I enjoyed working on this theme, so I am planning to have more compositions inspired by it."

fields.title: Enjoying a Drink
fields.description: This is another "snapshot" of a bar scene where the stylized figures are depicted holding cocktail coupes and they appear as if actors performing on a stage.

fields.title: Yellow & Red Climbers
fields.description: Nude figures climb minimalist structures in bold shades of yellow and red.  Artist Yelitza Diaz presents a conceptual piece representing the human journey of spirituality and elevation of being. Yelitza paints the figures with a bronze sheen to give them the roughness and apparent strength of metal. The composite art styles challenge traditional canons by presenting an original and modernized concept.

fields.title: White & Blue Climbers
fields.description: Artist Yelitza Diaz displays a modern piece of climbing figures in four minimalist panels painted in flat shades of white and blue. She paints the bronze beings dangling from the ledges, fighting their way up. Yelitza seeks to question the basic idea of minimalism by adding humans to the geometric composition. The suggestive piece inspires the viewer to find meaning from their own experiences in the artwork.

fields.title: Climber on Green Hope A.
fields.description: This artwork was inspired by the difficult political-social situation experienced by the country of Venezuela. The unsuccessful efforts of beings to recover freedom and survive the multiple conflicts, inspire me with the idea of escalation, progress, and hope to go constantly towards the triumph of the human being.My Small Beings are made of ceramic painted to looks like bronze. They are mounted on a solid wooden panel that is painted green. On the back there is a dentate hook for easy hanging.

fields.title: Climber on Green Hope B.
fields.description: This artwork was inspired by the difficult political-social situation experienced by the country of Venezuela. The unsuccessful efforts of beings to recover freedom and survive the multiple conflicts, inspire me with the idea of escalation, progress, and hope to go constantly towards the triumph of the human being.My Small Beings are made of ceramic painted to looks like bronze. They are mounted on a solid wooden panel that is painted green. On the back there is a dentate hook for easy hanging.

fields.title: Small Beings Sitting on Gray
fields.description: Each of the figures has a particular movement that allows them to express different feelings. This piece is a ceramic sculpture that has been finished in a way to look like bronze. Each Small Being is individually hand-modeled with clay at a high temperature and painted in bronze. It is then placed on a solid wood panel, which has been coated and painted gray. This piece comes ready to hang.

fields.title: Women’s Window
fields.description: Artist Yelitza Diaz demonstrates two nude female figures trying to connect on a geometric window coated in classic bronze. She seeks to question the basic idea of minimalism by adding the human form to the composition—a conceptual representation of man''s journey of spirituality and elevation of being. The piece elicits the viewer to find meaning from their own experiences.

fields.title: The Circle of Life B
fields.description: Artist Yelitza Diaz demonstrates a modern piece representing the spiritual harmony of human life. A bronze figure balances itself within the minimalist geometric structures of the unique composition. The central subject links the white base and circular structure painted in red. Yelitza colors the wooden and cardboard elements of the piece a classic bronze for a revolutionary touch.

fields.title: White, Black, and Red with Climbers
fields.description: Inspired by Kazimir Malevich, artist Yelitza Diaz creates a modern piece using primary colors on geometric figures. She seeks to question the basic idea of minimalism, adding the human form to the composition. The subjects help each other climb the structure in a symbolic representation of man''s journey. She coats the nudes in classic bronze to create a revolutionary touch.

fields.title: Woman in Red Circle
fields.description: Inspired by basic geometric structures, artist Yelitza Diaz features the circle as a reminder of the sun and moon. She creates the ring with a cardboard module, heavily coated and painted in bronze for a revolutionary touch. The woman, posing with her hands raised, upholds the idea of spiritual strength, balance, and success. The central figure links all the elements of the composition together.

fields.title: Woman in Golden Circle
fields.description: Inspired by basic geometric structures, artist Yelitza Diaz features the circle as a reminder of the sun and moon. She creates the ring with a cardboard module, heavily coated and painted in bronze for a revolutionary touch. The essential elements of minimalist shapes become challenged by adding the human form to the composition. The central figure, posing with her hands raised, upholds the idea of spiritual strength, balance, and success.

fields.title: Yellow and Red Square
fields.description: Using wooden modules painted in solid shades of red and yellow, artist Yelitza Diaz builds a base influenced by Kazimir Malevich. She challenges the minimalistic approach by adding the human form to the composition—a conceptual representation of man''s journey of spirituality and elevation of being. The classic bronze coating of the central figure establishes a revolutionary touch.

fields.title: Yellow and White Square
fields.description: Using wooden modules painted in solid shades of white and yellow, artist Yelitza Diaz builds a base influenced by Kazimir Malevich. She challenges the minimalistic approach by adding the human form to the composition—a conceptual representation of man''s journey of spirituality and elevation of being. The classic bronze coating of the central figure establishes a revolutionary touch.

fields.title: Woman Contemplating
fields.description: Artist Diana Elena Chelaru portrays a stylized portrait of Audrey Hepburn with geometric and floral patterns on her garb.  She gazes ahead as if quietly observing her viewer capturing the iconic actress'' bright expression. White and yellow shapes form the backdrop while rivulets of blue drip to the bottom. "In creating this painting''s background I used the flat wash technique, one of the most basic watercolor techniques," shares Diana.

fields.title: Woman With Attitude
fields.description: Artist Diana Elena Chelaru depicts a stylized portrait of Marilyn Monroe elegantly draped in a dress with geometric and floral shapes. The composition moves with colorful ornaments in blue, purple, white, and orange. "In creating the painting''s background I used the flat wash technique, one of the most basic watercolor techniques," shares Diana.

fields.title: Late Evening
fields.description: This is another of my art works that depicts a bar scene in blue and purple tones.

fields.title: Peach N' Peppers
fields.description:
"Every significant moment is its own fair share of sweet and spicy," says artist Ziui Vance. A modern still life of a luscious and ripe peach with red chili peppers. The captivating vivid colors and shapes stand out against their soft pastel background.

The artwork is in a metal frame with tempered glass.

fields.title: Yellow & White Climbers
fields.description: Blending the minimalist and modern, artist Yelitza Diaz displays a sculpture of figures climbing the canvas. The three bronze beings appear in different stages of climbing but share the same ardor to reach the top. The conceptual piece represents the human journey of spirituality and elevation of being. Yelitza challenges traditional canons by contributing something new and unifying art styles.

fields.title: U-Partners
fields.description: My Small Beings are made of ceramic painted to looks like bronze. They are mounted on a solid wooden panel that is painted red. On the back there is a dentate hook for easy hanging. This piece was inspired by the idea of overcoming obstacles, breaking down barriers and succeeding.

fields.title: U-Love
fields.description: My lifelong partner is the one who inspired me to create this work - time, lived experiences, conceived fruits, and mainly the unconditional support of my partner, who has become my right hand and eternal love.My Small Beings are made of ceramic painted to looks like bronze. They are mounted on a solid wooden panel that is painted red. On the back there is a dentate hook for easy hanging. This piece was inspired by the idea of overcoming obstacles, breaking down barriers and succeeding.

fields.title: Tea and Flowers
fields.description: Artist John Jaster renders an impressionistic still life in bright, cheerful colors. A teapot, a ceramic cup, a slice of lemon, a bowl of limes, and a vase of flowers, all set on a floral tablecloth. The sun shines through a leaded glass window behind the setting. The painting blends a palette of reds, blues, violets, and yellows into a harmonious sense of joy.

fields.title: Dazzle Me Twice
fields.description: A gorgeous bed of tulips grows to full bloom in artist John Jaster''s captivating floral scene. Buds in deep red and pink shades thrive from the ends of the long green stems. The perennials stand tall, waving in front of a blue pond with a lighter background of other flowers. John highlights the contrast of the bold colors and distinct thick linework, reminiscent of pop art representation.

fields.title: A Masked Girl
fields.description: Displaying his own rendition of popular iconography, artist Scott Dykema shares a charming image of Batgirl. Part of his series of portraits of famous comic book heroes. He reinterprets the masked city protector in his distinct style integrating street art and graffiti. The bright pink outline creates a dynamic aura accentuating the subject against the beige background.

fields.title: Coffee and Conundrums
fields.description: "Pondering worries and decisions, our tall, strong hero struggles to maintain control over the realities of the day even while graphic images soar through his thoughts," says artist Lee Smith. Part of artist Lee’s series on animals with human emotions, she utilizes textural surfaces and rich, intense colors to portray man''s best friends in vivid expression. Bold strokes of black and white contrast a collage of papers in muted greens, violet, and gold. "Strong coffee in a thick ceramic cup provides fortitude. The demands of the day are detailed in a complex background."

fields.title: Dazzle Me Once
fields.description: Artist John Jaster paints an impressionistic outburst of roses. He uses a palette of deep red, purple, yellow, and blue. John uses heavy bold strokes in multiple layers to achieve bold and rich colors. The overall composition appears as a vectorized image focusing on the contrast of the bold colors and distinct thick linework.

fields.title: Roger That
fields.description: I love that we can turn sheets of paper into an afternoon of soaring adventures over tropical islands, with terrible beasts and beautiful waterfalls, with our trusty wingmen by our sides. These are not just robots, machines built by man and equipped with only computational abilities. They have souls and boundless imaginations and they yearn for friendship and fun!  They exhibit only the purest expression of companionship here by enjoying a timeless game of "let''s pretend''.This wood panel was blanketed first with the torn, yellowed pages of a novel, then painted over with transparent blue/purple acrylic so that the text is readily visible on all sides, as well as in some more transparent areas of the painting.  The image itself is done in oil.  The work comes wired and ready to hang.

fields.title: Still Life with Camper
fields.description: Take the plastic off the lounge chairs and the blocks from under the tires. It''s time for summertime fun for the whole family! This piece pays homage to the family camping trip, in all of its motley glory. Celebrate with this lovely family over the burning coals of Dad''s early August barbecue, and top it off with Mom''s fresh-baked chocolate chip cookies!This piece is on a cradled wood panel. The sides are finished with the torn, yellowed pages of a novel. The work comes wired and ready to hang.

fields.title: Tic Tac Toe
fields.description: Artist Pat Doherty presents an assortment of twelve appetizers in a geometric pattern. Choices of avocado with aioli, jumbo prawn with herb cheese spread and cocktail sauce, cucumber, tomato, olive, and blue cheese. "In creating this piece, I draw on my experience as a former commercial art director," says artist Pat Doherty. She takes time to balance the elements of the composition and establish good color relationships between light and shadow.

fields.title: Canapes
fields.description: Artist Pat Doherty presents an assortment of twelve canapes in a geometric pattern. Various crackers, toasts, and cucumber slices are topped with delicacies, including caviar, smoked salmon, brie with cucumber, tomato, mozzarella, and salmon mousse. "In creating this piece, I draw on my experience as a former commercial art director," says artist Pat Doherty. She takes time to balance the elements of the composition and establish good color relationships between light and shadow.

fields.title: Glory Kat
fields.description: "A white cat, complete with halo, reigns over your domain," says artist Lee Smith. Part of Lee''s series on animals with human emotions. She combines rich, intense colors, along with textural surfaces to create good-natured, tongue-in-cheek portrayals of man''s best friends. "Do not cross this cat!"

fields.title: Culprits
fields.description: Part of artist Lee Smith’s series on animals with human emotions. Three dogs and two cats converge on the neighborhood to wreak havoc. One cat mysteriously sports a halo creating an illuminating effect in contrast to the dark and bold lines around the animals. Lee combines rich and intense colors, along with textural surfaces to create good-natured, tongue-in-cheek portrayals of man''s best friends.

fields.title: Mouse with Hot Chocolate
fields.description: Artist Jessica JH Roller shares a playful portrait of a mouse wearing a yellow knit winter bonnet. "Sometimes a mouse needs a cup of hot chocolate," says Jessica. She paints energetic and enthusiastic colors while retaining an atmosphere of coziness. The thick outlines against the bold red background allow the animated image to pop.

fields.title: Fade into You
fields.description: When asked about the subject of this painting, artist Malia Pettit described her as "bold, striking and intelligent." Malia says the title of the piece is more literal than one might expect. "It''s as though the woman who dominates this painting - wearing a power tuxedo no less - has willed herself to life on the canvas, transcending the surface and invading the space of the viewer. She has the power to seduce and command attention wherever she is put on display."

fields.title: Flower Girl
fields.description: A dramatic contemporary portrait. The figure looks out with an intense, piercing glance, balanced by the soft flowers in her hair and gentle blue sky in the background. Artist Malia Pettit explains that the painting is a progression of both her palette and subject matter. "It has all of the elements of my female portraits - dramatic shadows, bold features and sharp contrasting. However, I contrasted these elements with the crown of soft, whimsical, loosely painted flowers to lighten things up. The painting has a geisha-like feel with the high collar and flowing florals."

fields.title: Sweet Disposition
fields.description: A moody and engaging portrait in a lush and glossy palette of pinks and reds. Artist Malia Pettit combined elements of pin-up models with her signature painterly style. The confident, taffy-like stripes of the woman''s dress paired with marks of dripping paint give the piece a loose yet commanding feel. Malia describes her process as "liberating the paint."

fields.title: The Almost Perfect Day
fields.description: Out for an exhilarating ride on his best buddy, Barney, Leopold looses his grip on his shiny, red balloon. He is plagued by the confluence of heart-bursting joviality, and an instant of despair, so characteristic of the human condition. It is an ironic fate for a non-human. The work is done mostly in watercolor with brown and black ink detailing on the figures.

fields.title: Sushi II
fields.description: This upscale version of supermarket sushi has a bit more variety in the nigiri section:  tuna, salmon, bluefin tuna, shrimp, bonito, mackerel, imitation crab, surf clam (the latter two draped with a ribbon of nori or seaweed), are the freshly caught and sliced offerings.  Instead of the usual maki (rice concoctions surrounded by nori), it offers uramaki in which rice is the outer layer surrounding the filling and nori.  Showcased against a black background, this sushi looks stunningly gem-like.

fields.title: Raining Color
fields.description: A multi-colored and textured portrait set in a gray-blue background. "Life is beautiful when you are surrounded by colors and with a smile on your face," says artist Darlene McElroy. "Let''s dress up and proudly show off our soul."

fields.title: Santa Fe Muse
fields.description: A colorful portrait dotted with crosses in varied textures and colors. "The beauty of living in Santa Fe is that color, art, and characters are everywhere," says artist Darlene McElroy. "The way people dress is candy for your eyes. It''s a lot like Southwest Disneyland."

fields.title: Spring into Summer
fields.description: With a determined expression, a Pointer leaps out of the water over a colorful beach ball. Artist Jeff Fleming describes his painting style as kinetic impressionism. He started the piece with a pencil sketch on the canvas, then with gloved hands, he applied oil paint using his fingers. Details were later added using brushes. Once these layers of paint dried, he moved the piece to his studio floor. "At this point, I whisked paint in random but authoritative strokes - a speckling technique which replicates water splashing."

fields.title: Sweet Favorites
fields.description: A summer berry shortcake, colorful macarons and a cheesecake displayed on pedestal plates arranged on a blue striped tablecloth. Pat Doherty''s delectable oil paintings draw on her experience as a former commercial art director and designer. She seeks out her subjects at farmers markets and bakeries and then returns to her studio to simplify the details into bright, graphic arrangements. Pat takes time to balance the elements in her compositions and establish good color relationships between light and shadow.

fields.title: Unity Makes Strength
fields.description: "I wanted to convey a simple and powerful message: Unity Makes Strength," says Jose. "We all need one another, and we become stronger united in all challenges of our lives. I thought it would be fun to add the flexing arm with the hammer on the Arm and Hammer logo as a symbol of strength."

fields.title: Three Cars
fields.description: Part of artist Javier Ortas'' series dedicated to cities. He depicts three various vehicles in yellow, red, and blue driving along the highway. "Although I am passionate about nature and prefer the tranquility of small locales, I have almost always lived in big cities; Los Angeles, Mexico City, and Madrid," shares Javier. "Cities also have great charm and are a source of inspiration."

fields.title: Black-Winged Stilts
fields.description: Artist Javier Ortas depicts black and white shorebirds with long, fine pink legs, giving the birds an elegant gait. "Stilt is a common name for several species of this family of bird," explains Javier. "I have been an observer of nature since childhood. Although I paint using my imagination, a lot of these different species of birds are in my memory. I grew up watching and distinguishing different animals in the field on weekends and summers. Even today, bird watching is something I truly enjoy."

fields.title: Girls with Coats
fields.description: Two women in coats walk together on an autumn day. "The painting reflects my preference for the intensity of color and optimism," says artist Javier Ortas. "The characters'' clothing makes us imagine a cold day, but the well-being they express and the chosen tones bring warmth to the piece." Part of Javier''s long-running series of people enjoying everyday activities, painted from his imagination without any visual references. He starts with a single sketch to determine the composition and then begins drawing, with most of the colors already mapped out in his head.Measurements are for the full size paper 19.68" x 13.77", and the approximate painted area is 16" x 10". Under the painted area in the right corner in pencil is the title of the work in Spanish, "Chicas con abrigo," the signature and the year in two digits (19). It is also signed on the back.

fields.title: Four Ever Friends
fields.description: A charming display of four classic Sesame Street characters. Artist Karen Barton creates a nostalgic and delightful piece using her textured paint style and a choice of fun vibrant colors. The row of vintage toys - Big Bird, Ernie, the Cookie Monster, and Bert - stand against a white background bringing with them a feeling of comfort and joy.

fields.title: Feliz Navidad
fields.description: A colorful afternoon between Christmas and New Years in San Jose, Costa Rica. "It’s 80 degrees in the shade," shares artist Leroy Burt. "This beautiful old building is one of my favorites. I especially love the pink trim on the windows and the balcony. The young man standing in the doorway is waiting for a ride. He’s on his way to the Pacific ocean for an afternoon of surfing in the crystal waters of Playa Manuel Antonio in Puntarenas."

fields.title: Yum Yum Funyuns
fields.description: "Funyuns is a cult classic snack food," quips artist Karen Barton. "It definitely pairs well with a good movie." The fun and bright bag of onion-flavored rings rest against a pastel green wall while a few lay scattered on the teal countertop. Karen describes her paintings as being of a historical nature. She seeks out subject matter that represents a contemporary culture that also acts as timeless icons. The results are aesthetically pleasing little pieces that offer a freeze-frame of our fast-changing culture and attach to personal memories.

fields.title: Silly Rabbit
fields.description: "Trix is a favorite cereal for the young and old," says artist Karen Barton. The familiar wide smile of the bunny stirs joy and the sweetness of childhood memories. The vibrant red box is set against a pastel yellow background while a white rabbit stands behind a full bowl of milk and cereal. Karen describes her paintings as being of a historical nature. She seeks out subject matter that represents a contemporary culture that also acts as timeless icons. The results are aesthetically pleasing little pieces that offer a freeze-frame of our fast-changing culture and attach to personal memories.

fields.title: The Talk
fields.description: Two figures face each other in an exchange of words, their inner feelings expressed with sad and smiley faces. "Happy or sad, I portray my perspective of the human emotions, thoughts and perspectives on how we interact with each other," says artist Diana Rosa. "We learn to listen, trust and accept with personal growth and satisfaction."

fields.title: Deep in My Bones
fields.description: In a stylistic amalgam of pop and folk, abstract and figurative, artist Diana Rosa takes inspiration from her upbringing in Cuba. "Being born and raised in Cuba shaped my perspective on nature and how humans interact with land, animals and each other," she says. In this portrait, Diana weaves together natural and cultural elements of her native country, connected deep within her subject.

fields.title: Back to You
fields.description: A couple poses together in their underwear, rendered in artist Diana Rosa''s signature blend of pop and folk art styles. She cropped the composition to use the figures'' clothing and postures as a stand-in for personality traits most often gleaned from portraiture. The resulting piece is an imaginative and humorous take on questions of identity, love and relationships.

fields.title: Bowl of Grapes
fields.description: Artist John Jaster portrays a fresh display of red and green grapes with a ripe pomegranate placed in a glass bowl. Set above a patterned table cloth, the glass reflects light and vibrant hues of pink that surrounds it. Bunches of grapes nest in the cloth''s loose crease reminiscent of tiny bird eggs. The dark background highlights the scene completing the composition.

fields.title: Havana Dream
fields.description: "Vintage American cars are some of the finest works of art in the world," states John Jaster. "From the 40s through the 60s the auto industry embraced long stylized curves, bright colors, and artistic design. Cuba is literally a rolling car museum, where everywhere you look is an old-school American brand vehicle. This yellow and gold Plymouth has a red exterior visor and lots of beautiful chrome." John utilizes heavy body acrylics with multiple layers to achieve bold and rich colors.

fields.title: Well Stocked
fields.description: Artist John Jaster paints an impressionistic rendering of his local bar''s liquor shelf. Vibrant hues of red, orange, yellow, and green shine vividly through liquid courage and detailed stickers. John uses heavy body acrylics in multiple layers resulting in bold and rich colors.

fields.title: Orchid Delight
fields.description: Artist John Jaster presents a cluster of bold moth orchids with deep yellow petals and vivid red labellums. Utilizing multiple layers of heavy body acrylics, John creates rich and vibrant color combinations. Complementing hues radiate positive energies magnified by strong contrasting tones.

fields.title: Little Star
fields.description: An image of roses in a ceramic pot sits center of artist John Jaster''s pop art still life. A spotlight shines on the long-stemmed buds in the middle of a darkened room. Echoing the colors of the roses, flowers and foliage decorate the white vase. With a minimal palette, John successfully demonstrates the relationship between light and shadow.

fields.title: Mandarin Glide
fields.description: A bold impressionistic painting of a Mandarin duck gliding across a pond with its swirling reflections rippling in the water by artist John Jaster. John utilizes heavy body acrylics with multiple layers achieving rich and vibrant color combinations. "Nature has chosen an awesome color palette, especially when it comes to birds."

fields.title: Through the Looking Glass
fields.description: Painted as a nod to Warhol''s pop art style, artist Nava Lundy presents a closeup of a woman challenging the viewer to look directly into her eyes. She wears round thick rimmed glasses matching her midnight black lips. Her demeanor evokes a sense of reflective contemplation. The composition encourages us to look within ourselves and connect deeper. Painted using Nava''s signature gold-washed canvas, the work shines with rich color and luminosity of the gold shining through.

fields.title: To Creativity
fields.description: In artist Scott Dykema''s colorful piece, a colossal T-Rex storms past ocean waves. He collages old comic strips in the background and paints a rainbow with text reading "Thank You." Elements of street art prevail with the dynamic usage of bright-colored spray paint. Scott produces an ode to getting lost in the creative process, much adored by artists worldwide.

fields.title: That Car Is Sooo...
fields.description: Artist Scott Dykema depicts a chimpanzee riding a yellow car with flaming orange decals. He delivers a distinct statement piece using striking colors in his signature street art style. Part of his series of works with the iconic animal as the subject. "The chimp is almost asking the viewer to come along - going somewhere good perhaps?" suggests Scott.

fields.title: Tahoe
fields.description:
Artist Rick "Marlowe" Schneider depicts a captivating landscape of one of the most scenic areas in the United States, Lake Tahoe. The viewer is situated on a high terrain looking down at the vast body of water through tall and lush pine trees. Rick presents a vibrant dimensional display created from handmade papers that cast natural shadows depending on how the light hits the surface. 

This piece is a triptych, composed of three separate 36 x 12-inch panels.

fields.title: PenPals
fields.description: Four playful penguins wobble and walk up and down seaside rocks. Utilizing hand-cut papers, artist Rick "Marlowe" Schneider portrays the playful birds with fun and intriguing expressions. The dimensional piece pops with vibrant colors and eye-catching hues of aqua, yellow and blue.

fields.title: The Parrot
fields.description: Artist Rick "Marlowe" Schneider depicts a rich and captivating tropical mixed media in bold vivid colorful layers. The image welcomes the viewer to a tropical vista seen through thick banana leaves. A vibrant red parrot eyes the viewer while more birds fly beyond in a pink and purple sky. Rick utilizes full-bodied, handmade paper allowing him to achieve highly saturated pieces with interesting textures. Mounting the main image of the parrot and the foliage creates a natural cast shadow, it adds depth to the image depending on how light hits the surface.

fields.title: Blue Skirt
fields.description: Childhood is a carefree time. Sometimes a blue skirt is enough for a good mood. The picture is one of a series of memories of "childhood in the 70''s." At work I use the highest quality pigments. They do not change color or fade. I finish the art with matte no glare varnish so it looks good under direct artificial light. The painting is signed on front and back and dated.

fields.title: Forest Abstractions - Dance of Nature
fields.description: Artist John Jaster offers a playfully rendered forest filled with tall trees in vibrant hues of red, green, and blue. In his process, John creates stunning color combinations by utilizing multiple layers of heavy body acrylics and bold brushwork. The result is a captivating scenery with strong contrasting hues and high-spirited energy.

fields.title: My Sweet Valentine
fields.description: Artist Malia Pettit says that she challenged herself with this expressionist portrait by painting with a predominantly candy-colored palette of glossy reds and pinks. She worked to balance a sense of sweetness with a seductive element. The figure squarely faces the viewer with a confident and captivating expression.

fields.title: I Did It My Way
fields.description: Those were the days. The ones that were so entrenched in rich, slow, crooning songs, served alongside dark, textured side dishes of love, simple pleasures and hard luck.To know how much a robot can suffer and love! Sing it Frankie. Sing it to a newly diverse audience, at once timeless and also firing like a shot into an uncertain future full of wishful thinking and good luck.  This piece is made of hand-cut and torn paper adhered to a cradled plywood panel with matte medium then glazed with oil paint.  The sides are finished with the torn, yellowed pages of a novel. The work comes wired and ready to hang.

fields.title: All Cats Go To Heaven
fields.description: "A white-winged cat soars over the forest on its way to heaven," says artist Lee Smith. Bright verdant hues are contrasted with textured metallic paint and black outlines. As part of Lee''s series on animals with human emotions, she creates endearing pieces with edgy qualities. Combining rich, intense colors, along with textural surfaces she creates good-natured, tongue-in-cheek portrayals of our best friends.

fields.title: Midway Grill
fields.description: "The carnival comes to town and the Midway Grill lights up with the smells of hot dogs and cotton candy," shares artist John Jaster. "Overhead the brightly flickering Ferris wheel spins with peels of laughter." John utilizes heavy body acrylics with multiple layers to achieve bold and rich colors.

fields.title: 'Bot Descending a Staircase
fields.description: I had the most fun making this piece because it was my first attempt at abstraction in collage, which I have now discovered is incredibly fun, and because the subject matter is so silly. It is based on the famous "Nude Descending a Staircase, No. 2" by Marcel Duchamp, which I really enjoy. With my piece, I got to borrow his style and subject and make it hilarious by substituting a robot for the nude, and completely ridiculous by making the robot''s mode of transport a single wheel. It was an all-around great time.The piece is made of hand cut and torn paper adhered to a cradled masonite panel with matte medium. The work comes wired to hang.

fields.title: Alistair Gromit Spins a Yarn
fields.description: Wouldn''t we all like to be privy to Alistair''s tale? He looks like he''s got a story to tell. He charms his buddies with clever anecdotes. He is enigmatic, handsome, and well spoken. He invites you into his circle of cronies to share a burnt mallow or two and some good old fashioned camaraderie. Please, do pull up some debris and join the fun.This was my first attempt at a mixed media ''bot piece and it was a jolly good time! The paper collage process is always a lot of fun but glazing over it all with oils to create just the right glow from the fire and just the right campfire mood lighting was a new and thrilling experience. I shall be repeating it.This piece is hand-cut and torn paper adhered to cradled plywood panel with matte medium then glazed with oil paint. The sides are finished with the torn, yellowed pages of a novel. The work comes wired and ready to hang.

fields.title: Antipasto
fields.description: Artist Pat Doherty depicts an assortment of appetizers arranged on a wooden platter. "Your choice of brie or blue cheese with baguette, figs, baby carrots, tomatoes, olives, or grapes," says Pat. Her oil paintings draw on her experience as a former commercial art director and designer. She takes the time to balance the elements in her compositions establishing good color relationships between light and shadow.

fields.title: Surprise Party
fields.description: "The pastel-colored palette is sweet and feminine, like a box of macarons from Laduree," shares artist Malia Pettit. "It''s all together like a modern-day Marie Antoinette showing up for her own surprise tea party." Blush pink and peach dominate this candy-colored portrait. With the intuitive addition of pastel green on the background and a snippet on the model''s top, a cheerful balance is achieved.

fields.title: Aye Aye Cap'n
fields.description: A bright and fun still life showing a box of Cap''n Crunch cereal and toy by artist Karen Barton. Karen describes her paintings as being of a historical nature. She seeks out subject matter that represents a contemporary culture that also acts as timeless icons. The results are aesthetically pleasing little pieces that offer a freeze-frame of our fast-changing culture and attach to personal memories. "Cap''n Crunch is a favorite cereal for both young and old."

fields.title: Wonder
fields.description: Artist Karen Barton paints a still life of a classic American bread loaf. Two sliced pieces lay on the surface. Brightly colored circles in primary colors adorn the wrapper—the vibrant hues of the package contrast nicely against the soft blue and white background.

fields.title: Sushi Plate
fields.description: An assortment of nigiri and sushi rolls displayed on a white plate with chopsticks, placed on a green oval serving platter. "In creating my paintings, I draw on my experience as a former commercial art director and designer," says artist Pat Doherty. "I take time to balance the elements in my compositions and establish good color relationships between light and shadow."

fields.title: Big Chimpin
fields.description: Artist Scott Dykema paints a portrait of a chimpanzee wearing gold chains. He layers multiple moody colors in various applications and rich textures. "The chain is the chimp''s connection to humanity," explains Scott. He paints its expression as contemplative and caring, an expression of humanity.

fields.title: A Boss Chimp
fields.description: Part of artist Scott Dykema''s series of chimpanzees. Standing before a bright yellow background is a dapper primate wearing a golden chain above his two-piece suit. Patterns decorate his teal necktie as yellow drippings spill from his shoulders. "The paintings from this series express a deep connection and similarities between primates and man," says Scott. "They carry certain indistinguishable characteristics such as their adornment to their facial expressions. From contentment to dissatisfaction."

fields.title: Princess Cake
fields.description: A princess cake, with alternating layers of sponge cake, pastry cream, a layer of raspberry jam and a thick domed layer of whipped cream. The cake is covered by a layer of marzipan, giving it a smooth rounded top, with extra whipped cream and a pink rosebud on top. Pat''s delectable oil paintings draw on her experience as a former commercial art director and designer. She seeks out her subjects at bakeries and then returns to her studio to simplify the details into bright, graphic arrangements.

fields.title: Never Again
fields.description: A nude woman sits in an affecting posture, demonstrative of her feelings. Artist Sharon Sieben presents the expressive portrait evoking raw and powerful emotions. Her bold brushwork reveals an articulate and deep narrative. Sharon paints with strong strokes to create dynamic textures in the background.

fields.title: Monica and Dash
fields.description: Artist Lee Smith paints a golden-haired young woman walking her lively pup through a neighborhood. “Monica loves getting out in the fresh air to take a break from work, while Dash always thinks she heads home too soon," says Lee. The age-old conundrum between humans and dogs. They both feel invigorated by the cool breeze as they frolic along the spring landscape.

fields.title: Girl With Pearl Earring and Her Dog
fields.description: Taking inspiration from the famous Baroque painting, artist Lee Smith presents her spirited interpretation of Vermeer''s masterpiece. In her playful rendition, she includes the mysterious model''s favorite pet. Lee paints in the style of primitivism, creating a fresh perspective to the work. Rich with texture, the painting glows with intense color contrasts and playful patterns in the background.

fields.title: Shark River, Belmar, NJ
fields.description: Artist Kira Yustak reveals a primitive seascape of the New Jersey docks during a breezy and relaxed evening. She paints a scene of boats gently drifting by the water under the gleaming moonlight. The iridescent lunar glow creates reflections dancing along the rhythm of the sea. The piece appears beautiful and mysterious with its play on shadow and light.

fields.title: Envy
fields.description: Artist Sharon Sieben paints a woman in the foreground, keenly observing the other pair in the background. Minimal representation and primitive paintwork constitute the conversational display. With her hand on her hip, the main subject implies an air of conflict. "She is not included in the conversation," says Sharon. The piece makes the viewer question the engaging narrative between the characters.

fields.title: Unlikely Friends
fields.description: Everyone said the old dragon was grouchy, grumpy, and mean. Some even said he was dangerous and should be left alone. "A monster!" others cried, warning their children to stay away. Marigold didn''t believe any of it. She knew that sometimes we all need someone to reach out to, to be kind, and to be a friend. So that''s what she did, remembering to bring him some of her favorite flowers to cheer him up. That was the day she met her best friend.

fields.title: Great Plains Bison
fields.description: Three bison travel among the waving grasses of the great plains in Lee Smith''s primitivist piece. She creates marks and pronounced brushwork with texture paste to build an impressive portrait of these mighty yet endangered creatures—a proprietary texture paste she produces herself. She sands the dried surface to reveal images and shapes carved within. The rich glowing colors with contrasting black outlines make the animals pop.

fields.title: Two Barn Owls
fields.description: Artist Jessica JH Roller depicts two mysterious barn owls against a striking red backdrop. The wide-eyed birds live peacefully at an owl refuge deep in the forest. With the bold lines and contrasting white, the solid red background spotlights their vibrant and stark appeal.

fields.title: House Finches and Branches
fields.description:
Artist Johansen Newman presents a contemporary portrait of a young tattooed woman. Her fiery red locks draw the viewer''s attention to her contemplative face. She stands in the open air among leafless branches and friendly finches whose feathers match her hair. The cloudy blue sky in the background creates an alluring complement to the dominantly dark color palette.

The painting comes with a professionally-made frame in dark brown wood.

fields.title: Black Horse
fields.description: Artist Nick Bontorno paints a black horse running toward the distant desert bluffs. He renders the subject with minimal representation in the style of primitivism. The palette of soft pastels with the dark landscape complements his painterly approach. Nick focuses on how the piece feels rather than how it looks.

fields.title: 4 Horses
fields.description: Artist Nick Bontorno displays four horses grazing in a wide field. The muted background directs the focal point toward the charcoal-black subjects. Nick charmingly employs the fundamentals of primitivism with his unique touch. His painterly approach creates an atmosphere of whimsy.

fields.title: Rider and Crosses
fields.description: A woman rides a horse toward crosses in the night in artist Nick Bontorno''s piece. In his distinct primitivist style, he renders the work with minimal representation. The girl holds her hat as she peers out at the evening landscape. He creates an atmosphere of fanciful whimsy in a western setting.

fields.title: Rebuff
fields.description: Artist Sharon Sieben paints a nude woman in the style of primitivism. The bold gestural strokes evoke raw and expressive emotions. "Something said or done does not meet with her approval," says Sharon. She uses thick layers of graphite and acrylic pigments to shape her vulnerable state.

fields.title: Hill Country
fields.description: Artist Robert Hofherr presents a bright southwestern village with expressive paint application and a simplified rendering style. Lines and patterns make up the structures instead of representational detail. Robert utilizes the negative spaces as critical parts of the architecture. A limited earthy palette of clay red and juniper green offers a unique "color world."

fields.title: Buildup
fields.description: Artist Robert Hofherr paints a heavily stylized rendering of a cluster of European structures. The expressionist piece relies on the use of patterns and altered perspectives to create a unique image. The colored shapes that make up the work complement each other and the background. Robert adds patterns and linear elements to further alter the relationships of the many parts of the composition.

fields.title: Obsession 5
fields.description: Pink and red circles roll in a wave. Reminiscent of rose petals gently floating in a fragrant bath. The piece exudes the calm and relaxed energy of spending time washing the day away, melting tension, and gathering oneself. Part of artist Natasha Tayles''s signature Circles series.

fields.title: Obsession 4
fields.description: Three groups of purple hues sprout to the surface above a yellow background. Circles drift lively about the piece like petals blown gently by wind. This piece is part of artist Natasha Tayles''s signature Circles series.

fields.title: Obsession 3
fields.description: Part of artist Natasha Tayles''s signature Circles series. A lively geometric trio of spheres burst in the colors of red, yellow, and green. The sets of circles intermingle atop a gradient background reminiscent of childlike wonder and play.

fields.title: House on the Hill
fields.description: "A woman is walking away from a house, and she is leaving behind her old life," says artist Kira Yustak. "She is deep in thought, wondering what her future will hold. She also has many memories in the old house that she called home. The painting is meant to be hopeful in the face of adversity and change, reflected in her large soulful eyes."

fields.title: Chipmunks
fields.description: "This painting depicts a pair of cheerful woodland creatures," explains artist Kira Yustak. "Two chipmunks scamper around on a log in the forest. It''s a great reminder to appreciate the little things in life!"

fields.title: The Older Couple
fields.description: Two nude figures join hands in artist Libby Ramage''s arresting primitive piece. The elderly couple braces themselves going into an uncertain future. "The first layer of this piece is a map of New Zealand, selected for its Bay of Plenty which appears on the middle right side," says Libby. Collaged handmade paper, feathers, and fabric constitute the image of the large bird, poetically placed to evoke flight and nesting.

fields.title: Many Medals
fields.description: Artist Johansen Newman paints a military man displaying the symbols of his many accomplishments and acts of courage. Aglow with ribbons and medals, his chest becomes a canvas for pattern and decoration. Johansen renders the subject in her signature illustrative style rooted in primitivism. She fully captures the essence of the character born of imaginative creativity.

fields.title: Cat Napping
fields.description: Artist Andrea Doss presents a playful image of a green dragon dozing off with its two feline friends. "These creatures both love to nap and can often be found together in slumbering states," says Andrea. She presents a whimsical fantasy in her distinctive illustrative style. The sparkling stars complete the dreamy atmosphere of the composition.

fields.title: Day of the Dead
fields.description:
Artist Johansen Newman paints four women celebrating Dia de Los Muertos, a tribute to the festive Mexican holiday. "On this day, a community comes together to celebrate the memories of those who have passed away," shares Johansen. It speaks to the individuality of each life being celebrated and the personalized touch of each painted face and decorative costume.

The piece comes with a hand-made vintage tramp art frame.

fields.title: White Chrysanthemum
fields.description: Artist Pamela Hoke presents a fully-bloomed white chrysanthemum with its petals radiating in vigor. She finds herself enchanted by this flower from the beautiful autumn florals of her friend''s farm. The work focuses on the form and subtle movement of the delicate petals. "It is as if the flower is reaching out for hugs," says Pamela.

fields.title: Thundering Bison
fields.description: A hefty bison gallops along a golden prairie in artist Lee Smith''s primitive piece. She uses texture paste, implements, and brushwork to create an impressive portrait of the animal churning up the earth. The expressive painterly strokes embody its strength and frenzied energy. Rich glowing colors and contrasting outlines make the endangered creature pop from the canvas.

fields.title: Three Dingo Night
fields.description: "Three dog buddies enjoy a night on the desert," describes artist Lee Smith. "One has ideas, one is unsure, and the other howls at the moon." Part of Lee''s series on animals with human emotions. She combines rich, intense colors, along with textural surfaces to create good-natured, tongue-in-cheek portrayals of man''s best friends.

fields.title: Yellow, Orange and Blue
fields.description: Part of artist Natasha Tayles'' signature Circles series. A rhythmic pattern of playful orbs in yellow, orange, red, and blue glows around the bright morning sun. A welcoming piece honoring the new day.

fields.title: Acquiescence
fields.description: "The subtle feminine face in this piece displays an expression of definite reluctance to commitment," says artist Sharon Sieben. A woman bathed in bright yellows is defined in black strokes with touches of red and gray. Her tightly pressed lips and downcast eyes reveal her feelings.

fields.title: Morning Sun Bonsai
fields.description: A bonsai tree glows in morning light, with rays of sun shining through the branches. "The painting is meant to show joy in the new day as it arrives with a positive glow," says artist Kira Yustak. "The viewer can almost feel the warm sunlight. Bonsai trees represent peace, harmony and balance."

fields.title: The Getaway
fields.description: Artist Lee Smith presents a mischievous-looking rabbit in the act of running away. She leaves out the pursuer from the composition, allowing the viewer to create their own narrative. Bold black linework with strategically placed teal accents outlines the patterned golden hues of the charming hare. The gray background allows the subject to take center stage, enhanced with a complex system of white tick marks, which add interest and help create the feeling of action and motion.

fields.title: Who Let the Dogs Out
fields.description: Artist Lee Smith paints a playful pack of dogs leaping headlong, intent on the fun. Bold linework with teal highlights outlines their rich golden hues. The white patterned marks on a dark gray background complement the gold and create an energetic sense of movement. The viewer''s eye flows easily from pup to pup, visually connected by the composition. "A lively, fun piece for your collection, especially if you love that old song... you know the one I mean," jests Lee.

fields.title: Water is Life
fields.description: Symbolic of water''s vitality, artist Kira Yustak depicts a sight of hands cupping water from a clear river. She paints the introspective piece with an absorbing primitive style. "Our bodies are made from 60 percent water, and it is very essential to life on Earth," says Kira. She portrays the hands feeling the cool soothing water in a spiritual way emanating tranquility.

fields.title: Siblings
fields.description: "Three canine siblings discuss upcoming activities in which, clearly, the youngest gets a raw deal," describes artist Lee Smith. The dogs depict varying emotions easily read with a bold showing of teeth and glaring eyes. Lee combines rich, intense colors, along with textural surfaces to create good-natured, tongue-in-cheek portrayals of man''s best friends. This piece is part of her series on animals that portray human emotions.

fields.title: Waters Edge
fields.description: A pair of feet on the sand, with bubbling ocean waves rushing to meet them. "You can almost feel the cool water touching her toes and the sand beneath her feet," says artist Kira Yustak. "One can imagine the soothing sounds of the ocean and the calming breeze of salty air."

fields.title: Blue
fields.description: Artist Lee Smith presents a richly hued portrait of a moody blue dog with soulful eyes. Subtle bits of collage add a playful pop to the composition. Lee adds depth and texture by scratching and etching liberated marks into the thick glazing. She paints contrast between the subject and golden yellow background through highlighted edges in vibrant colored linework.

fields.title: Smiling Faces 7
fields.description: "Smiling faces are gathered together," describes artist Natasha Tayles. As part of her smiling faces series, Natasha paints colorful rows of joyful expressions against a lively background. She finishes this piece with a touch of green on its edges.

fields.title: Smiling Faces 6
fields.description: Sunshine smiles fill a happy rainbow background. The suns evoke happy thoughts and positive energy. Part of a series of smiling faces by artist Natasha Tayles.

fields.title: Smiling Faces 5
fields.description: Cheery smiles in white and gold saturate the space against a black background. One face has hearts as eyes, love among all the happy gestures. Part of a series of smiling faces by artist Natasha Tayles.

fields.title: Blue, Purple and Orange
fields.description: Dainty happy orbs of blue, purple, and red transform from cool to warm. Illuminated from above by early winter sun, they fall unhurriedly to the soft pristine snow. Part of artist Natasha Tayles''s signature Circle series.

fields.title: Orange and Blue 9
fields.description: A luminous combination of red, blue, and white circles radiate from above, silhouetted by the bright morning sun. They cascade down like individual rays of light. Part of Natasha Tayles''s signature Circles series.

fields.title: Turquoise Runners
fields.description: Artist Nick Bontorno exhibits wild horses running in the desert. The pair sprawl through the canyons with reckless abandon. The pink and turquoise hues create a vibrant and energetic display. Nick''s painterly approach further creates an atmosphere of fanciful whimsy.

fields.title: Señorita
fields.description: A young Latin girl travels the desert on a pink horse in artist Nick Bontorno''s piece. The muted background directs the focal point towards the vibrant central hues. Nick charmingly employs the fundamentals of primitivism with his unique touch. Trails of cottony clouds span the teal sky as the sun sets on the horizon.

fields.title: Moon Runner
fields.description: Artist Nick Bontorno presents an image of a white horse speeding through a vast canyon. The crescent moon peeks from the cliffs, casting a subtle glow. In his signature style, Nick renders the subject with minimal representation. The palette of soft pastels with the dark landscape complements his painterly approach.

fields.title: Rainbow Horse
fields.description: Artist Nick Bontorno presents a majestic horse gazing at the sky in dark earth tones. A lustrous rainbow shines on the horizon as a soft mist blankets the vast desert. Nick''s signature painterly approach creates an atmosphere of whimsy.

fields.title: Painted Horse
fields.description: Artist Nick Bontorno presents a spotted horse walking through a cactus field in a red desert. Its white main gently sways as it plods across the canyon. In his distinct primitivist style, he renders the subject with minimal representation. The fiery hues create a vibrant and energetic display.

fields.title: Moon Runner 2
fields.description: Artist Nick Bontorno shares an image of two black horses running through a green field. The waning moon fades into the night, casting a subtle translucent glow on the misty landscape. Nick renders the subjects with minimal representation, focused on how the piece feels rather than how it looks. He employs the fundamentals of primitivism in his signature style.

fields.title: Steady On
fields.description: "Colorful and brave our feathered friend faces the future with an adventurous attitude," says artist Lee Smith. "A gritty grin tries to insist everything will work out well." Part of Lee''s series on animals with human emotions. She combines rich, intense colors, along with textural surfaces to create good-natured, tongue-in-cheek portrayals of animals.

fields.title: Howdy Ma'am
fields.description: "Born on the ranch and a veteran cattle herder, this cowboy sidekick is ready to close out the day with a cold drink and maybe a little line-dancing," jests artist Lee Smith. The dog grins with a sparkle in their eye, eager to kick their boots up. Part of Lee''s series on animals, she combines rich colors, along with textural surfaces to create good-natured portrayals of man''s best friends.

fields.title: Fair To Middlin'
fields.description: "Life on the ranch is often exciting, always hard. But with his dusty cowboy hat and ''seen it all'' expression this laid-back barn cat lets nothing rile him up," says artist Lee Smith. He sits against a halo of bold yellow strokes with his ears poking through his cowboy hat. Part of Lee''s series on animals, she combines rich colors, along with textural surfaces to create good-natured portrayals of man''s best friends.

fields.title: Obsession 6
fields.description: Vibrant red and pink circles figurately dominate the coast on a hot summer day. An abstracted view from above of colorful bucket hats and beach umbrellas, the scent of sunscreen, and the joy of building sandcastles. This piece is part of artist Natasha Tayles''s signature Circles series.

fields.title: Smiling Faces 4
fields.description: Colorful smiling faces gather together and bounce about happily. They turn and twirl amongst a sea of other cheery expressions. A whimsical piece with childlike humor by artist Natasha Tayles.

fields.title: Smiling Faces 3
fields.description: Rounded happy faces bounce about in a bubbly dance. They turn and twirl amongst a sea of other cheery expressions. A whimsical piece with childlike humor by artist Natasha Tayles.

fields.title: Yellow, Orange and Blue 2
fields.description: Brilliant yellow, orange, red, and blue orbs fall from the sky, backlit by the bright sunshine. A happy scene, reminiscent of dandelions swaying on a warm spring afternoon. This piece is part of artist Natasha Tayles''s signature Circles series.

fields.title: Red/Black Horses
fields.description: Artist Nick Bontorno displays two horses facing away from each other. Their contrasting black and red coats allow both subjects to stand out against the pale landscape. Nick charmingly employs the fundamentals of primitivism with his unique touch. His painterly approach creates an atmosphere of fanciful whimsy.

fields.title: Pink Runners
fields.description: Two pink horses run through a broad expanse in artist Nick Bontorno''s piece. The vibrant red hues of the galloping equines radiate an intense vitality and spirit. Nick paints in a primitive style, creating an atmosphere of fanciful whim. Intuitive usage of soft pastels against the dark landscape aptly complements his painterly approach.

fields.title: Blue Horse
fields.description: Artist Nick Bontorno paints a lone horse standing in a vast canyon. The pale blue tones and minimal representation display a relaxed resonance throughout the barren pastoral landscape. His painterly approach further creates an atmosphere of fanciful whimsy. "I focus on how the piece feels rather than how it looks," shares Nick.

fields.title: Male Gaze
fields.description:
Artist Johansen Newman displays an image of a tattooed woman sitting alone in a tavern surrounded by men. "There''s a lot written in popular culture and art about the male gaze," says Johansen. In this piece, she moves the topic from the subtle to the blatant. Comfortable in her own skin and confident with her own thoughts, The woman at the bar glows in full color while the crowd of gazing men recedes in sepia tone."

The painting comes with a handmade wooden frame painted brown.

fields.title: A Flutter of Wings
fields.description:
Artist Johansen Newman exhibits a portrait of a tattooed lady in a yellow floral dress. The woman catches a moment of contemplation, surrounded by the enthusiastic support of the birds around her. A glorious sunset glows from the background, executed in bright salmons, pinks, and purples. "There''s excitement in the air. Something is about to happen," says Johansen.

The painting comes with a handmade wooden frame painted brown.

fields.title: Mimi in the Chair, Smoking
fields.description:
Artist Johansen Newman shares a portrait of an older woman in a chic floral dress and fishnet stockings. In a deep blue Mid-Century Modern styled room sits Mimi, smoking in a cozy armchair. She surrounds herself with her best friends whose coiffures she is thrilled to replicate for herself - or perhaps the other way around. "In any event, the three are completely simpatico," says Johansen.

The painting comes with a handmade wooden frame in black.

fields.title: Blue Teapot and Roses
fields.description: Artist John Jaster paints a realistic still life of a teapot and flowers. White roses blossom, some with open petals and some still in their colorful buds. The ornate blue and white ceramic pattern elegantly stands out against the green leaves and stems extending toward the edge. John paints a bold black background to illuminate the carefully detailed light and shadow depiction.

fields.title: Three Houses
fields.description: Artist John Jaster presents an impressionist prospect of three houses side-by-side. TH yellow, pink, and green exteriors create a colorful display. John paints a bright yellow jeep parking by the street as a supplementing point of interest. The tall tree in the middle ground filters the bright sun into sharp shadows across the scene.

fields.title: East Village
fields.description: An unconventional yet memorable narrative unfolds in artist Keith Thomson''s city scene. The piece shows a hot dog vendor having a slow day while a ballerina executes a grand jeté. "This would be an unusual scene — anywhere but in the East Village, where just about anything can happen and often does," says Keith. He captures the remarkable charm New York uniquely offers.

fields.title: Yellow Brick Road
fields.description: Artist Jesse Aldana paints a panoramic coastal view, panning from the warm sandy shore to the distant metropolis. The godlen sunset inches toward the horizon, lighting up the low clouds and the ocean''s surface. Storms lash out at the city by the bay as the dramatic skies brings romantics out for the evening.

fields.title: Shadowed Hill Behind the Barn
fields.description: Artist Catherine McCargar displays a view of a barn overlooking a verdant hill. After winter rains, the hillsides in northern California green up, and winter morning light casts long shadows. Catherine captures the scene en plein air painting with ample lighting. She renders the simple beauty of a crisp and quiet moment of life on a farm.

fields.title: Can Egrets Forget?
fields.description: Artist Emil Morhardt paints a snowy egret, two great egrets, and a great blue heron taking in the view. Painted against a clean white background, the birds glow enthusiastically. Emil delicately paints their soft white plumage, capturing each nuance realistically. He utilizes acrylic and fine brushwork, presenting the most intricate details.

fields.title: Point Lobos Succulents
fields.description: Artist Catherine McCargar presents an intriguing close-up of succulents tenaciously adorning a dramatic cliff. The view overlooks the Pacific Ocean in Point Lobos Natural Reserve. "This park near Carmel, California, is among my most inspirational places to visit," shares Catherine. She joyfully gets lost in painting, adding detail after detail. The fluid colors allow the movement of pigments and the precision of brushwork.

fields.title: Shaken
fields.description:
Artist Nava Lundy wittingly quotes James Bond as a nod to the title:

"Shaken, not stirred."

She displays a close-up of a martini, depicting the drama in the olives making their way to the bottom of the glass. Nava captures it all with a refreshing splash frozen in time. She draws inspiration from the reflective color of the liquid, in addition to it being her favorite cocktail.

fields.title: Ranunculus Shindig
fields.description: Artist Jinny Tomozy exhibits a realistic portrait of a Ranunculus bouquet. "Ranunculus are similar to roses but have more delicate petals that are tissue-thin and in greater numbers," describes Jinny. Layers and layers of petals that transition from cool greens in the center to warm pinks and yellows make them a delightful subject matter. Jinny creates the piece from several different references and arranges it into one bouquet.

fields.title: Blushing Tones
fields.description: Artist Jinny Tomozy paints a realistic still life of a fresh bouquet. She paints the soft, toned hues of the petals that emerge from the grey background. The colors subtly intensify towards the left side of the painting, and soften towards the right, creating a gradual shift in color saturation levels. This transition creates an underlying movement from one side to the other.

fields.title: Sunday Supper
fields.description: Artist Lynne Tompkins Brice exhibits a still life of a grilled cheese sandwich paired with a bowl of tomato soup. The realistic detail emphasizes her careful regard for coloring and blending. "The end of a busy weekend is often punctuated by a simple supper of comfort food," says Lynne. She intends the piece to remind the viewer of reassuring times with the family.

fields.title: Sunnyside Up
fields.description: Artist Lynne Tompkins Brice pictures an appetizing realistic still life of bacon and eggs with a side of sliced tomatoes. "The art of brunch makes for every kind of edge," says Lynne. She explores several techniques to make the painting look delicious. The crackly ends, loose yolks, and juicy consistency make for a sumptuous feast for the eyes.

fields.title: Staff of Life
fields.description: Artist Lynne Tompkins Brice displays a still life of a sourdough loaf realistically. "There''s nothing quite like the yeasty aroma of freshly baked bread straight out of the oven," says Lynne. She beautifully blends the colors as she considers the balance between light and shadow. Her process involves taking photographs of curated cuisine arrangements and saving the food later as her next meal.

fields.title: Blooming Succulents
fields.description: Artist Jinny Tomozy displays a budding aloe vera with a realistic approach. The contrast in color and shape of the flower in comparison to the rest of the succulent draws the viewer''s attention. Jinny aims to capture the variation with a dynamic view of the strong leaves with the delicate flowers almost appearing to float above them. The delicacy of the tubular petals against the thick, hardy leaves creates a fascinating combination.

fields.title: Postcard from Yellowstone
fields.description: Artist John Jaster presents a realistic depiction of a small buffalo herd grazing in Yellowstone National Park. He displays the natural elements in a remarkable panoramic view. Ranges of monumental mountains tower in the distance while a pristine stream flows behind the expansive grassland. John captures wildlife at its most phenomenal state.

fields.title: Of Rocks and Colors - Sulphur Shine
fields.description: Artist Marie-Eve Champagne features a realistic image of beautiful yellow ore in mesmerizing crystalline clusters. An entry to her series of still-life minerals and their relationship to pigments and colors. "After all, once transformed into a paste, aren’t colors just a bunch of crushed rocks on a surface," suggests Marie-Eve. A light minty teal background softly cpmplements the vibrant yellow translucency of the subject, emphasizing the glowing aspect of the rock.

fields.title: Tide Pools
fields.description: Artist Jesse Aldana paints a dramatic seascape in realistic detail. Warm rays of sunlight pierce through the clouds and illuminate the breathtaking panorama. An extremely low tide reveals a sea bed of deep striations interrupted by tranquil pools of water. The vast ocean teems with enough surprises and quiet beauty to match the brilliant skies overhead.

fields.title: In the Rain
fields.description: A solitary black swan leisurely glides on a tranquil pond in artist Guigen Zha''s allegorical rendering. The still waterscape ripples from the delicate movements of the tranquil environment. Raindrops gather on the lotus leaves, forming larger water droplets that seem to quiver lightly. Guigen expresses isolation and yearning for beauty in an emotional display.

fields.title: The Escaping
fields.description: Artist Guigen Zha paints a realistic image of lotuses with a subtle spatial illusion. He shows the beauty of the flower''s mysterious character, emerging from the mud unstained. "Reality is black. Tomorrow should be green," says Guigen. "If I don''t want to be a part of the black, what I should do today is escape." He draws influence from the Chinese philosopher Zhou Dunyi in this culturally symbolic composition.

fields.title: Blooming
fields.description: Artist Guigen Zha displays an exquisite white lotus in stark focus and realistic detail. The flower flourishes with velvety white petals and tender pink tips. The long-stemmed leaves reflect its beauty in the pristine turquoise pond. "The white lotus is flawless, it symbolizes the divine side of humanity,” shares Guigen.

fields.title: Upgrade!
fields.description: "Say yes to the upgrade," says artist Nava Lundy. She shares an image of a woman enjoying being pampered in celebration. A reminder to everyone that they must take care of themselves. The subject savors the moment of being treated like a queen, being groomed as they indulge her with bubbly champagne.

fields.title: Love Is in the Air
fields.description: Artist Jesse Aldana presents a unique outlook of a sweeping horizon executed in an upward view. The sunset paints the sky in vibrant colors and accentuates the realistic details of the composition. Swaying palm trees lift up the airy clouds evoking the sentiment of romance. Jesse paints a light-hearted red balloon dancing along the breeze to draw the viewer''s attention.

fields.title: Speeding Crows
fields.description: I saw this pair zooming around my house, cawing wildly on some crow mission," says artist Emil Morhardt. "One would think that Common Crows are black, but in fact they are iridescent and when the sun shines through their feathers, surprisingly golden."

fields.title: Raven Couple
fields.description: "Common Ravens are a friendly lot, hanging around in large groups at an abundant food source or pairing off to wander as a couple," explains artist Emil Morhardt. "These two were gazing at sunset alone together when I spotted them." Painted over a gray background wash, in blacks, browns, purples, and magentas that conjure the iridescence of their plumage, along with golden yellow sunlight striking their heads and tail feathers.

fields.title: Oasis
fields.description: I enjoy making trips to Palm Springs to collect inspirational material for paintings. I am especially drawn to the bougainvillea blossoms that grow so well in that place. This painting pays homage also to the southwestern architecture that works well with the mountains and the particular plantings that thrive in the urban desert.

fields.title: Shall We Dance?
fields.description: When artist Jo Galang moved to Vancouver many years ago, she and her family settled in the city near Stanley Park. "On frequent visits to the park, we would often see the swans at the lagoon," says Jo. "I have always been fascinated with the splendor and gracefulness of these creatures."

fields.title: The Waffler
