fields.description: "Does Norman Rockwell''s America still exist?" asks artist Keith Thomson. "My ongoing search for it took me to a Waffle House in Kentucky, where I found this guy, a Hell''s Angel having a tough time deciding between the pecan waffles and the chocolate chip."

fields.title: Atlantic Clam Shell
fields.description: Clam shells galore can be found along the beaches of the Atlantic. I currently live in Texas, however, I have been deprived of finding these little gems on my trips to the Gulf of Mexico. This particular shell was “smuggled” out of a restaurant in Stuart, Florida where I dined with my father during a recent summer visit and, of course, ordered clams on the half shell. Ah, memories! This painting is on a gallery wrapped canvas with finished edges. It comes ready to hang.

fields.title: Of Rocks and Colors - BG
fields.description: Artist Marie-Eve Champagne displays a metallic ore on a striking lilac background. The subject opposes the contrasting hue, putting each aspect on display. This series takes root in a profound love of minerals and their relationship to pigments, colors, and ultimately, painting. "After all, once transformed into a paste, aren’t colors just a bunch of crushed rocks on a surface?" suggests Marie-Eve. She bases the piece on a photo of blende and galena taken at the NHM.

fields.title: Of Rocks and Colors - S
fields.description: Artist Marie-Eve Champagne shows a realistic depiction of aquamarine crystal clusters on a coral-pink background. The subject opposes the contrasting hue, putting each aspect on display. This series takes root in a profound love of minerals and their relationship to pigments, colors, and ultimately, painting. "After all, once transformed into a paste, aren’t colors just a bunch of crushed rocks on a surface?" suggests Marie-Eve. She bases the piece on a stalactitic photo from the London NHM.

fields.title: Autumn Trees
fields.description: Painting of an autumn landscape in the afternoon with lots of fallen leaves.  The gallery wrapped canvas has finished sides and is ready to hang.

fields.title: Castle Vinne
fields.description: This painting depicts ruins of an old castle in morning light. It''s not far from my home, so I went there a few times to finish the painting. I then added small details in my studio. This piece is on a gallery wrapped canvas and the painting continues around the sides. It comes ready to hang.

fields.title: Literary Delights
fields.description: Artist Onelio Marrero titled this painting fittingly to describe his love for reading. He and his wife love to visit local bookstores to find books to read. Onelio adheres to the mental attitude of C. S. Lewis, one of his favorite authors, who said, "You can never get a cup of tea large enough or a book long enough to suit me.” To Onelio, there are few quiet pastimes that compare to reading or perusing the shelves of bookstores.

fields.title: Carne Tagliata
fields.description: Part of Onelio''s ongoing series centered around people occupied in various simple tasks. This painting depicts a butcher at work in his shop - it could be a shop like any meat vendor''s establishment throughout the world. In this case the setting is one of the indoor markets in Florence, Italy. The title means prime cut in Italian. One can see evidence of the location on the left where the title is displayed on a sign showing the symbol for the Euro.

fields.title: Silent Hill
fields.description: Painting of meadow with red poppies and a small hill in a background. This painting is on a gallery wrapped canvas and the painting continues around the edges. It comes ready to hang.

fields.title: A Glimpse of Hope
fields.description: "Hope is the belief that things will work, most especially when it seems otherwise," says artist Jo Galang. "Deep, never wavering hope is what we need to cling to. No matter the darkness we face, keeping hope alive can give us calm and peace when something less than desirable emerges."

fields.title: Promised Land Water Lilies
fields.description: This enchanting location is in a state park in Pennsylvania named Promised Land. I have often explored this lake and its many inlets in my canoe. I love to glide the canoe over the lily pads and hear the soft swishing sound they make on the hull as I glide over them. As I painted this scenery, I was transported back to the place in my mind in my efforts to convey the serenity of the setting.

fields.title: Seabreeze Journey
fields.description: A soft burst of pastels paints the evening sky in this delightful seascape by artist Gail Greene. "A setting sun creates a mystic feeling of enchantment," shares Gail. "I love sunsets and the salt air. The wide array of mesmerizing colors as the sun slowly slips into the sea is a favorite to paint."

fields.title: BLT
fields.description: Artist Lynne Tompkins Brice displays a still life of the classic BLT sandwich split in half and laid on a napkin. "Biting into a big old bacon, lettuce, and tomato sandwich is a delicious experience," says Lynn. She intends to recreate the sensation of crunching, squishing, and dribbling as the sandwich is consumed. Her work captures the subject thoroughly, telling the whole story.

fields.title: Cheeseburger & Fries
fields.description: Artist Lynne Tompkins Brice shares a vivid rendering of a juicy cheeseburger and fries. "This can be a very guilty pleasure," says Lynne. She hopes to invoke the feeling of that very first bite. She finely blends and contrasts the colors as she considers the balance between light and shadow.

fields.title: Saturday Morning Breakfast of Champions
fields.description: Artist Lynne Tompkins Brice displays three delectable donuts on a plate with a glass of milk. "Washing down each gooey, sugary bite with a cold gulp is priceless," says Lynne. She sets up the still life, paints with feeling, then devours the sweet treat. The realistic detail emphasizes her careful regard for light and shadow.

fields.title: Vidalia Season
fields.description: "Sweet Vidalia onions are harvested once a year, an event much anticipated by culinary connoisseurs and home cooks alike," says artist Lynne Tompkins Brice. She displays a realistic still life of the invariable kitchen staple, peeled and sliced by a small knife. Lynne enjoys discovering all the subtle color variations in the translucent onion skin. She smoothly blends the colors as she considers the balance between light and shadow.

fields.title: Margherita Pizza
fields.description: Artist Lynne Tompkins Brice paints a box of fresh warm pizza. The comforting display presents the meal, half-finished with crusts left by the side. "It''s pizza night in America, game day, or birthday party fare," says Lynne. She intends for the viewer to smell the steamy, toasted aroma just by casting their eyes on this painting.

fields.title: Salsa!
fields.description: "Fresh salsa is all about the crunch as well as the slurp," says artist Lynne Tompkins Brice. She presents the four fresh ingredients in a charming rustic still-life. The realistic detail emphasizes her careful regard for coloring and blending. Lynne hopes the composition will make the viewer reach for the tortilla chips.

fields.title: Rainbow Succulents
fields.description: In realism, artist Jinny Tomozy presents a view of flourishing succulents. "What intrigues me about succulent plants are the abstract forms they create," shares Jinny. She depicts a dynamic sense of movement in the plant''s growth patterns. Some have subtle, soft tonal qualities in their hues, and others have vibrant, saturated spectrums of color that burst from their centers.

fields.title: Succulent Stars
fields.description: Artist Jinny Tomozy presents a birds-eye view of growing succulents. She draws inspiration from the bright spectrum of color and contrasting shapes and textures of the plant. Mesmerizing geometric patterns extend from the dense layers of leaves. "Sometimes it stacks perfectly on top of one another but most time displays the enchanting Fibonacci spiral," shares Jinny.

fields.title: Rainbow Harvest
fields.description: Artist Jinny Tomozy presents a realistic still life of vibrant and colorful produce - an intimate look at the gardener''s prize. "I can not resist the bounty of a fresh harvest," says Jinny. The saturated hues of the fruits that have been nurtured all summer finally come to reveal themselves. The shine of the plump globes displays a dance of highlights among the gathering.

fields.title: Pairs Well with Wine
fields.description: "Even a simple charcuterie is a beautiful thing," says artist Lynne Tompkins Brice. A soft cheese, freshly sliced apples, and a scattering of grapes lay on the wooden board. She captures the less-is-more appeal of simple pleasures.

fields.title: Sea Foam
fields.description: "A heavy layer of cloud begins to break up and shafts of sunlight scatter over the rhythmic murmur and roar of churned white water below," describes artist Jesse Aldana. "It beats upon tall ancient rocks of the California coast and retreats back into the ocean."

fields.title: Big Blue
fields.description: A pair in a kayak glides through the ocean under a clear blue sky in this realistic piece by artist Jesse Aldana. Calmer waters in the open sea promise a great day under the warm sun as the light glistens on the crashing waves near the shore. A gentle haze glows where mountains peek through the mist. "The bright horizon hints at a future of limitless possibilities."

fields.title: Check!
fields.description: "This painting shows live-action role players under a bright early evening sky as the day''s story wraps up," describes artist Jesse Aldana. "The women in the foreground have broken character momentarily—Check!—to grab a photo with their defeated, but amiable foe."

fields.title: Whimbrel and Plover
fields.description: In this dramatic seascape, Jesse Aldana describes a stormy evening on the coast near Santa Barbara, CA. A cloudburst races across the channel while a sailboat lolls aground on the beach. He mutes the sound and intensity offshore with a calm foreground of silent reflection, over which a strand of plover skitter into the distance.

fields.title: Jetties
fields.description: Glowing rays of sunshine spread across the sky shattering onto the ocean''s gentle crashing waves. Artist Jesse Aldana depicts a panoramic view between two jetties on an evening when the sun broke through a cloud bank between storms. He takes inspiration off the coast of Santa Monica Bay in Southern California.

fields.title: Blue Stones in Water
fields.description: Artist John Jaster paints a captivating image featuring an assortment of shiny, colorful stones, in dominant shades of blue and brown, in fresh shallow waters. The colors pop beneath the bright mid-day light presenting the polished river stones in their best natural condition. Utilizing multiple layers of heavy body acrylics, John achieves a dynamic piece with bold and rich colors.

fields.title: Beach Patrol
fields.description: "The iconic powder-blue lifeguard tower with a patriotic flag waving, stands tall on the wide Southern California beach," describes artist John Jaster. A lifeguard on duty sits attentively in his tower with his bright orange vehicle parked on the side. A flock of seagulls is standing by for any hint of activity. "The sky is pristine and the sand is hot. In the background, Santa Monica shimmers like a mirage."

fields.title: Hidden Valley Ranch
fields.description: A weathered red barn ranchhouse sits prominently on a field with cattle grazing in the green pasture. "The backdrop of a thick line of trees dressed in bold autumn colors gives a sense of a forgotten moment in time," says artist John Jaster. John utilizes heavy body acrylics with multiple layers to achieve bold and rich colors.

fields.title: Dreams
fields.description: Artist Jesse Aldana presents a realistic still-life composition. The viewer’s eye is drawn inward from the soft creases and gentle folds of cloth to the arrangement of books and a bookcase. "A slashing diagonal provided by the course of blue fabric in this composition hints at a theme of triangles that echoes throughout the painting," explains Jesse. The longer one observes the three-sided shape curiously appears in different spaces.

fields.title: Sunflower Medley for Blues
fields.description: A happy and bright still life featuring a handful of sunflowers arranged in a white ceramic vase by artist John Jaster. The vibrant colors of green and yellow illuminate the piece as it is set against a blue wood-paneled wall. John utilizes heavy body acrylics with multiple layers achieving a strong contrast of bold and rich colors.

fields.title: Out Running the Waves
fields.description: When I walk along Santa Barbara beaches in winter, Marbled Godwits are the most common bird, often seen in herds, as in this painting. They stampede along racing the waves up the beach, then turn around and follow them back down probing for invertebrates in the sand. I used a mixture of transparent and opaque acrylics to try to capture the luminescence of the morning light with Santa Cruz Island in the background.

fields.title: The Great Pumpkin
fields.description: In this classically styled still life, Jesse uses the opportunity to ruminate on colors he more frequently employs in describing a sunset. Deeply dyed fabric, a sturdy pumpkin leftover from the fall''s revelry and showy chrysanthemums stand in for cerulean sky and the fiery orange of clouds at the close of day.

fields.title: The Souvenir
fields.description: An unclaimed polar bear sits at the center of artist Keith Thomson''s surrealist piece. The charismatic creature patiently revolves around the conveyor belt among a crowd with calm composure. "Airport baggage claims offer a painter a singular mix of dreary fluorescents contrasted with shiny metal," jests Keith. He presents a playful hothouse of human eccentricity through whimsical storytelling.

fields.title: Coincidence?
fields.description: Artist Keith Thomson paints a surrealist subway scene in solid and bold colors. "This painting examines how an ordinary scene can be ratcheted into the phantasmagorical by the repetition of something," says Keith. He displays a commuter and an identical replica in trench coats leaving the train. He catches the viewer off-guard when he reveals they are brothers who take the same train, and everything is a mere coincidence.

fields.title: Sunday in the Burb
fields.description: "This exact scene took place earlier this year," says artist Keith Thomson. "Except rather than an elephant walking on the suburban street in the pale dawn, there was a nondescript jogger in a gray tracksuit. With all due respect to him, an elephant seemed more interesting." Keith paints a seemingly surrealistic scene of an auspicious elephant marching down a quiet street. He plays with the thought of the subject diverging from the setting for a playful piece.

fields.title: Roots
fields.description: This painting is all about roots–both going back to my artistic roots, and learning that in order for something to grow, one must take care of the roots. Crafted in a flowing, minimalist style, it is a return to the artistic style that feels most authentic for me. The figure in this piece simultaneously withers into the wind and reaches into the ground. Sometimes, when we think we''re withering away, we realize we just need a little root care, we need to reach inside and nurture what makes us us.

fields.title: Relic
fields.description: Using art to work through the loss of my father, this piece explores how grief causes otherwise forgotten objects to take on new meaning. My dad and I were estranged, and his passing left me with feelings of guilt, relief, regret and pain. Reminding me of all that were the things of his that found their way to my house–relics of his life. These little talismans hurt to see, but they also provide solace, reminding me of good times and giving me some part of him to hold onto, even as I grieve.

fields.title: Black Cherry 'n' Vanilla
fields.description: I remember feeling a surge of joy when I felt the subtle pulse of new friendship as a child. New friends made their way into my life, not often, but effortlessly. It just felt good, like the first licks of an ice cream cone on a warm summer afternoon. Having ice cream with one another, especially in this beautiful setting, embodies contentment for these new fast friends.  There''s just not much that can top robot love.This wood panel was blanketed first with the torn, yellowed pages of a novel, then painted over with transparent yellow/green acrylic so that the text is readily visible on all sides, as well as in some more transparent areas of the painting.  The image itself is done in oil.  The work comes wired and ready to hang.

fields.title: These Boots
fields.description: Artist Miranda Gamel illustrates a surrealist image of a woman resting on a tiger''s back. A depiction of vulnerability and peace with oneself. Miranda paints the woman nude except for her black combat boots. The subject exudes power and confidence in her path as her most authentic self.

fields.title: Venus
fields.description: Inspired by the classical painting, The Birth of Venus, artist Miranda Gamel shows a surrealist portrayal. The subject stands beautifully with long wavy hair and glistening eyes under a turquoise moon. Miranda integrates psychedelic motifs in the background while a glowing mist rises below. The rich oil paint application creates details and soft transitions over the aerosol base.

fields.title: Nebula
fields.description: Artist Miranda Gamel depicts an ethereal being with a glowing crown and wings. Star nebulas and light beams surround her in lustrous prismatic hues. The nude figure glimmers with flowing red hair and a mix of blue and fuschia for her complexion. Inspired by the film Avatar, Miranda blends a dark background with luminous colors for a dreamy surrealist touch.

fields.title: Time II
fields.description: Artist Guigen Zha references Salvador Dali in this surrealist scene of Chinese cultural relics. Starlings rest on plum tree branches floating in the dreamy blue sky. On the shadowed steps toward the still water, oriental artifacts glisten in the sunlight. An etched mural of a family appears golden on one side and colored in the shade. "Everything in the painting has actually existed in the same space and time," notes Guigen.

fields.title: Time I
fields.description: Artist Guigen Zha presents elements of Chinese cultural relics set upon a surrealist beach. A Tang Sancai, a type of pottery from the Tang Dynasty, sits prominently with its gilded handles. Together on the steps are an embroidered shoe worn by women and a pomegranate flower in full bloom. He paints a snail walking into a mural depicting cultural history. "The piece presents a reminder of the past and how time flies," says Guigen.

fields.title: Other Worlds
fields.description: Artist Evgenia Smirnova depicts two fishes swimming in intergalactic space. The cratered moon rises behind the red lighthouse towering in the foreground. "Welcome to my surreal world," says Evgenia. She draws details with a graphic pen over the expressive acrylic paintwork.

fields.title: The Waiting
fields.description: Artist Evgenia Smirnova depicts a clown in a red polka-dot costume carrying a balloon of the same color. He leans against a checkered black and white lighthouse. "Welcome to my surreal world," says artist Evgenia. She creates a fanciful narrative with her dreamy choice of subjects and illustrative painting style.

fields.title: Pressure Point
fields.description: This painting is about rethinking the role of women in art history and examining the smile itself as a boundary.

fields.title: Study for the Hunter
fields.description: Artist Jennifer Ross depicts a horse with its mane and tail braided in the traditional style for show jumping. A leopard skin blanket lays over its back. She uses eggshell collage techniques to form the anatomy and coarsens the hair with thick acrylic gel. “I experimented with using an aluminum panel and I’m so happy with how it turned out," says Jennifer.

fields.title: Glory Bee
fields.description: "This piece is a whimsical look at bee appreciation," says artist Linda Benenati. A woman wears a golden crown of bees, her arms raised towards the hive above her head in a gesture of praise and adoration. Linda often includes bees in her paintings as a tribute to the encaustic medium which is made from beeswax.

fields.title: Her Friend Harvey
fields.description: A playful portrait of a woman posing with her imaginary rabbit friend. Artist Linda Benenati pays homage to Jimmy Stewart''s 1950 film titled Harvey. "I feel that it is always good to have friends, even if they are imaginary," says Linda.

fields.title: Mystery of the Tell-Tale Heart
fields.description: A mirror image of a woman sitting on a red chair deep in contemplation. A leafless red tree rests on her head, converging to form a beating heart, while a raven looks down on the scene. Artist Linda Benenati enjoys putting a hint of mystery and intrigue in her paintings. Part of her Duplicity series, which shares a visual narrative and uses titles of popular mysteries as the basis for the works.

fields.title: Happiness in Sorting
fields.description:
Two bears sit quietly together going through a tub of laundry. "The mundane tasks in life are the most spirited places of laugher and companionship," states artist Ziui Vance. "The subtle whispers across dirty laundry are ruffled by laughter as a crisp breeze flutters applause from drying sheets. The banality of life is refreshingly fun when you give space to share it with a friend."

Ziui''s work commonly reflects on everyday life scenes, encompassing a wide range of domestic contexts. Her depictions of the familiar teddy bear range from working in the home to traditional activities plying at the artisanal history of trades. Her ability to cleverly capture the tone and color of a Golden Age of painting illustrates great charm and the life and times of a distant contemporary life.

The artwork is in a metal frame.

fields.title: Play Room 2
fields.description:
"The playfulness of friends should always equal the quizzical nature amongst opponents," states artist Ziui Vance. Three bears sit around a classic board game. A dog barks at them grabbing their attention. Ziui''s work commonly reflects on everyday life scenes, encompassing a wide range of domestic contexts. Her depictions of the familiar teddy bear range from working in the home to traditional activities plying at the artisanal history of trades. Her ability to cleverly capture the tone and color of a Golden Age of painting illustrates great charm and the life and times of a distant contemporary life.

The artwork is in a metal frame.

fields.title: Sensual Transcendence
fields.description: Artist Burte-Ujin Batbayar illustrates a naked female body with four arms, two appealing to her sensual desire. The figurative piece suggests merging the physical and spiritual realms, inviting the viewer to contemplate the interconnectedness of pleasure and transcendence. Adding to the enigmatic quality of the painting, butterfly patterns adorn the figure''s eyes and various body parts, creating an otherworldly aura that evokes a sense of excitement and nervousness.

fields.title: The Mountains between Us
fields.description: Artist Alana Clumeck created this painting as a symbolic depiction of her experiences in the first few weeks of the COVID-19 shutdown in California. "With little human interaction for weeks, the hummingbirds in my garden were my friends," she says. "At night, my son and I would howl at the moon, like wolves in the wild. And with the borders closed to access my homeland, I left space in the painting portraying the mountains between my family in Australia and me."

fields.title: Ten of Swords
fields.description: Artist Rachel Srinivasan presents a surreal image of a white bison standing in the middle of 10 swords—nominative to its corresponding card from the tarot deck. The creature appears bright and powerful despite depicting the traditional symbolism of loss and hardship. Hope prevails in the form of the spirit beast surrounded by a warm geometric color field, albeit fractured. "The mental turmoil comes to an end," says Rachel. "Clarity is on the horizon."

fields.title: Alchemic Kingdom
fields.description: "In this painting, a shift change is captured at the Alchemic Kingdom," says artist Jesse Aldana. "A multi-faceted amusement park whose grand hotel rises airily in the distance offers co-workers and friends a chance to visit and share the latest."

fields.title: Windmills
fields.description: On this piece I painted a little Dutch ceramic windmill souvenir with a small Delft blue windmill drawing.  In the background there''s another windmill scene: a copy of Jacob Van Ruisdael''s 17th century painting "The Windmill at Wijk Bij Duurstede."  I love the combination of a cloudscape and landscape in the same painting and all those wonderful details makes it one of my favorite landscape paintings.

fields.title: Birch Wood
fields.description: Artist Evgenia Smirnova demonstrates a surrealist image of fishes that resemble the human eye tethered to tall birchwood trees. "Welcome to my surreal world," says Evgenia. Inspired by fairytales, she aims to share love and hope through her paintings. She pictures them in an illustrative style, fitting her fantasy themes.

fields.title: Old Growth, New Beginnings
fields.description: Artist Jennifer Ross displays an egg in brilliant turquoise. She composes the springtime piece with her signature eggshell collage. "Throughout my artistic career, I have returned to the imagery of a bird’s nest with a single egg above," shares Jennifer. She celebrates the season with new buds on the branches holding the nest.

fields.title: The Everlasting Folly of Rose and Abernathy
fields.description: Artist Diane Flick exhibits a surrealist scene giving life to an ordinary kitchen appliance - the toaster. "Serious about their craft, these besties pride themselves on fitness, mindfulness, and aggressive goals for self-evaluation and improvement, all between potential prestige-winning pop competitions," narrates Diane. The animal-headed subjects perform laser-focused leaps into the joyful expanse above. The friendly balloons mitigate the intensity, reminding them and us that the world is not as we see it. Instead, it is as we see ourselves.

fields.title: One Blossom One World. Peony & Deer I
fields.description: "A flower is small, but it is also a world of its own," says artist Guigen Zha. He paints a surreal image of a flower growing from bud to bloom. A parallel metaphor of human life from birth to death plays out in the scene. Guigen displays a peony, a deer, and a human expressing the interconnection and interdependence of all things in a utopian world.

fields.title: Nine of Swords
fields.description: Artist Rachel Srinivasan presents a surreal portrayal of the nine of swords tarot card. A majestic and mysterious white bison remains strong as a falling blade pierces through its back. A symbol of getting through hard times and appreciating life. The bison reflects the viewer, reminding them they are stronger than they know.

fields.title: Eight of Swords II
fields.description: Artist Rachel Srinivasan''s surrealistic piece combines the traditional symbolism of the tarot card with the image of a white bison and eight crossed swords. The creature, alone against a green expanse, represents the individual depicted in the card - bound by their limitations and feeling trapped. "It is also a powerful symbol of strength and resilience, suggesting that even though the individual feels restricted, they possess the inner resources to overcome," shares Rachel. The entire work embodies purity and a higher spiritual understanding.

fields.title: Rest
fields.description: The background of the piece is an off-white color (Spanish white) and is house paint.  The rest of the piece was done using oil paint.  The background has a matte finish and only the oil paint is varnished.  There is a build up of paint, and some texture, which can be seen in the photographs of it, especially around and within the orange circle.  The three women at the top are painted from a vintage photo of the Motown group, The Ronettes.

fields.title: Remembrance
fields.description: A naked child with thick red hair sits with his knees to his chest on a toy wooden horse. He sits with a vacant stare, hands clasped together. Artist Krzysztof Iwin painted this scene to represent a Latin theory where individuals are believed to be born without any memories, known as a tabula rasa or having a blank slate. In this way, all knowledge comes from experience or perception.

fields.title: The Stroll
fields.description: A bearded man returns a kind smile as he holds on to his pet''s long peculiar ears. "The picture shows a funny scene of a walk with a strange animal with long ears, which are the ears of the pet owner," explains artist Krzysztof Iwin.

fields.title: Yellowstone with Lock and Key
fields.description: Candice was deeply inspired after a visit to Yellowstone National Park. The central landscape image was created using a photographic transfer method while the landscapes on either side were created with paint applications. "The abstracted compositional areas serve as windows or doors to memories, to secrets, to hidden worlds," Candice says.

fields.title: Water of Life
fields.description: A surreal scene of an inhuman hand emerging from the night sky and spilling liquid in front of a fairy-like figure. The boney arm and random pouring may suggest the uncertain nature of life. In turn, the figure seems deeply absorbed in the flowing liquid, unaware of the greater source.

fields.title: Who Are These Angels CXLV
fields.description: A mystical figure emerges from the divide of light and darkness. In this ethereal piece by artist Naoko Paluszak, the entity appears to be made of the same energy as where it came from. Naoko created both color balance and a robust contrasting composition that evokes strong emotion. Part of Naoko''s signature Who Are These Angels series.

fields.title: Luminous Stream
fields.description: Artist Zelie Alice takes inspiration from how unusual Tuscany''s landscape can be. The different shapes from the straight-line and crisscross cypress trees that spread into the valleys of Val d’Orcia, Italy never fail to motivate her. She chooses her palette incorporating a random realism style, painting fantasy skies, and foregrounds. She follows line, form, textures, and colors to create compelling images keeping cypress trees dominant on the horizon. Part of Zelie''s Tuscan landscapes series.

fields.title: Desert and the Sea
fields.description: Artist Dixie Salazar offers a dynamic composition that combines both her fascination with desert cacti and sea imagery. In this piece, a textured purple curtain falls on the right as an imaginative view of the ocean obstructed by cacti appears with a clear glass bowl. Dixie continues to explore the use of collage and heavy underpainting, complemented by oils, for a highly textured surface. The goldfish bowl with fish is another recurring object in Dixie''s oeuvre.

fields.title: Natura Naturans
fields.description: "This painting is a presentation of how nature nurtures its creatures in the most magical ways," explains artist Sahand Saher. "How kind she is to its creature for nature in its core is joyful, abundant, and kind." In his Dream a Little Dream Of Me series, Sahand portrays the underlying wellness of nature, expressed through symbolic compositions and objects.

fields.title: New Toy
fields.description: A gigantic white cat holds a green vehicle close, claiming it as its new possession. The image presents a whimsical sense of curiosity in a dreamlike terrain. Part of artist Sahand Saher''s series of oversized animal portraits, in various landscapes.

fields.title: Lines Upon Lines
fields.description: A white cat snuggles contentedly in between hills in deep slumber. Part of artist Sahand Saher''s series of oversized animal portraits, in various landscapes. "Embraced by the fluffy soft hills, the cat is enjoying a warm lazy summer evening."

fields.title: From the Ashes
fields.description: Artist Miranda Gamel depicts a woman rising from fire and ashes. The hazy atmosphere expands in a subtly abstract approach. The subject wears a floating gold glowing crown on her head as she leaves the flames and walks with pride toward her guiding light. Miranda layers the piece with bold acrylic colors over the dreamy application of ink washes in the background.

fields.title: Case of the Mythical Monkey
fields.description: A man in a trench coat and hat peers at his likeness, with one figure appearing to mirror the other. Although seemingly identical characters, they study each other with a slight difference in their gaze. "I enjoy a hint of mystery and intrigue in my paintings," says artist Linda Benenati. Part of Linda''s whimsical Duplicity Series which utilizes titles of popular mysteries to share a visual narrative.

fields.title: Mystery of the Blue Velvet Mask
fields.description: "I love to put a hint of mystery and intrigue into my paintings," says artist Linda Benenati. Part of Linda''s whimsical Duplicity Series which utilizes titles of popular mysteries to share a visual narrative.

fields.title: Prologue of a Cherry
fields.description:
A bear poses with a basket of cherries while her pet is excited looking up at the one in her hand. "The presence of a cherry quickly tames a barking dog," states artist Ziui Vance. Ziui''s work commonly reflects on everyday life scenes, encompassing a wide range of domestic contexts. Her depictions of the familiar teddy bear range from working in the home to traditional activities plying at the artisanal history of trades. Her ability to cleverly capture the tone and color of a Golden Age of painting illustrates great charm and the life and times of a distant contemporary life.

The work comes in a metal frame with tempered glass.

fields.title: Sorting Peaches
fields.description:
A cuddly bear quietly sits in the morning light sorting fruits. "Patience is patience, as is taking the time to appreciate the differences in celestial fruit," states artist Ziui Vance. "Each day presents a moment to examine our needs more critically. To find the efficacy of our flaws and render anew from the energy that was lost to bewilderment."

The work comes in a metal frame.

fields.title: Out of This World
fields.description: "A panther in space, now that''s out of this world," says artist Miranda Gamel. She depicts a surrealist image of the ebony feline in the celestial cosmos representing our propensity for adaptability. It thrives in the environment it creates, with kaleidoscopic jungle imagery materializing around it. Miranda paints the composition using an acrylic base and oil paint to refine the details in the jaguar and dreamy nebula surrounding him.

fields.title: One Blossom One World. Peony & Deer III
fields.description: Artist Guigen Zha paints a giant blooming peony in lush shades of pink. As the national flower of China, they represent prosperity and nobility. A silhouette of a deer stands in the foreground, silent and majestic. The animal is a symbol of peace and happiness in Chinese culture. Together, they express sources of noble associations and interpretations. Guigen explores the sublime parallels between humans, animals, and nature.

fields.title: Her Transformation
fields.description: Artist Miranda Gamel shares a dreamy portrait of a woman with a neon pink crown surrounded by glowing butterflies. Miranda portrays the subject with illuminated wings on her back, hidden from her point of view. "Just as a butterfly in nature will never know its beauty but will share it with the world unknowingly," says Miranda. The piece depicts the beauty we all hold within but cannot see ourselves.

fields.title: Isolation III
fields.description: Artist Guigen Zha paints red lotus flowers under the shining sun. Square blocks of gradient color fill the fragmented scene. He paints a three-legged bird in a yellow circle encased by a hexagon to nod to ancient Chinese mythology. He highlights the isolation of the god bird in alien space, looking toward the sun.

fields.title: Don't be sad, it could have been worse
fields.description: The picture shows the boy and his imaginary friend who comforts him in a difficult situation.

fields.title: Semaphore
fields.description: This painting is on a gallery wrapped canvas with finished edges. It comes ready to hang.

fields.title: Emptiness
fields.description: This piece is on a masonite board and will frame for display.

fields.title: Blue-Green Cubist Cafe
fields.description: This painting is a cubist version of recent coffee art I have created. The geometric repeated mokka pattern backed by the green blue hues connote joy and imagination and love of pattern. This piece is on gallery wrapped canvas and the painting continues around the sides. It comes ready to hang.

fields.title: Morning Joy
fields.description: A white Persian cat stands amongst a pink cherry blossom forest on manicured rambling hills. Part of artist Sahand Saher''s series of oversized animal portraits of mostly his pet cat, Mukka. He creates various imaginative landscapes resulting in surreal imagery.

fields.title: Nature is Love
fields.description: A sleeping cat rests under a blanket of a lush blooming garden at the foot of a purple mountain. Mukka, the model, is artist Sahand Saher''s pet. The inspiration for this series came after seeing his cat sleeping in the long hours of a lazy summer evening. This piece is the fourth in a series of oversized animal portraits, painted in different scenes. "No model is better than a sleeping one!"

fields.title: Tranquil Blue
fields.description: A white gigantic cat comfortably sleeps on lush hills before a majestic snowy summit. Artist Sahand Saher paints his cat, Mukka, after catching the feline sleeping in the long hours of a lazy summer evening. "No model is better than a sleeping one!" says Sahand. Third in a series of oversized animal portraits of mostly Sahand''s cat, painted in various landscapes.

fields.title: Grateful
fields.description: "No model is better than a sleeping one!" exclaims artist Sahand Saher. "I caught my cat, Mukka, sleeping again one lazy summer evening." Inspired by his pet cat''s slumber that night, Sahand started painting his subject and the imaginary background rapidly grew around him. This piece is the second in a series of oversized animal portraits of mostly Sahand''s own cat, in various landscapes.

fields.title: Dream a Little Dream of Me
fields.description: A fluffy white cat sleeps peacefully on vast orange hills as the sun begins to set. Artist Sahand Saher gains inspiration for his series of oversized animal portraits after seeing his cat, Mukka, sleeping in the long hours of a lazy summer evening. "No model is better than a sleeping one!" says Sahand. This piece is the first painting Sahand created featuring gigantic depictions of mostly his cat in various imaginative landscapes.
